loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 31 years old and married with one child.

Eden is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eden has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 48 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura (siembre maíz), comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Alfredo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 48 years old and has been farming for several years. He grows corn and sells his products at different markets that are located near his house. Alfredo lives with his wife in their own home.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can continue his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía de  53  años de edad es casada, tiene casa propia y vive con su pareja no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en su negocio de pulpería, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que ha diario le visitan.
 Doña  Rosalía es una mujer trabajadora que desea sacar adelante a su negocio y crecer como microempresaria es un ejemplo de trabajo en su comunidad.
 Está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería en general como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, pan, huevos, queso etc. también desea ampliar la línea de cosméticos, es un cliente sub siguiente muy buena, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante junto con su familia y también que su negocio sea más grande.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 53 years old, married and has her own house. She lives with her spouse and has no dependent children. For the last 10 years she has sold groceries in a small store. Her clients are neighbors and friends who visit her.

Rosalía is hard-working woman who wants to get ahead with her business and grow. She is an exemplar micro-entrepreneur in her neighborhood. She is requesting this loan to buy groceries in general like beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, cheese, etc. She also wants to expand a line of cosmetics.

She is a very good regular client. She hopes that this investment allows her to progress together with her family and also that her business grows.
San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2014.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cheese etc. for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest and patient. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items she sells. Her business goal is to have the best retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create more profit and improve the living standards of her family. She will use the anticipated profits to better her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he keeps cows and grows crops. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes he will have more businesses within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Jerioth

texts.en: Jerioth is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to have the best salon in the region within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a room in his house

loans.name: Lorena Margarita

texts.es:
Lorena de 27 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado de educación básica debido a que sus padres no le dieron importancia a su estudio. Solamente vive con su pareja y con su hija.

Lorena es comerciante, es costurera desde hace 10 años y desde hace 5 vende productos de enchape, con ambas actividades apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Solicita el crédito para comprar enchapes como anillos, collares y pulseras ya que sus clientes le han pedido producto con el que no cuenta y con el crédito piensa hacer el pedido. Lorena espera que con su esfuerzo y el fruto de su trabajo logre aumentar su clientela y dar el estudio completo a su hija.
texts.en:
Lorena is 27 years old. She has a life partner and a 5-year-old daughter. She was only able to attend school until 4th grade of basic education because her parents did not think her schooling was important. She lives alone with her husband and daughter.  

Lorena has her own businesses. She has been a seamstress for 10 years, and for the last 5 years has also been selling plated jewelry. With these two activities she helps her husband with household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy jewelry such as rings, necklaces and bracelets that her clients have requested but that she doesn’t have in stock. With this loan she will be able to place her order. 

Lorena hopes that through her efforts and with the fruit of her work she will be able to gain more clients and be able to send her daughter all the way through school.

loans.use: to buy jewelry such as rings, necklaces and bracelets.

loans.name: Samuel Elias

texts.es:
Samuel de 34 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijas de 10 y 4 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. Su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

Samuel es agricultor desde pequeño, trabajo y aprendió con su padre y es hoy en día su única fuente ingreso y con la que mantiene a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para cosechar el ajonjolí que sembró está en el punto de corta y tiene que contratar mano de obra lo antes posible para evitar pérdidas por la caída de la semilla y comprometer las ganancias para su familia.

Samuel seña con aumentar el área de siembra de 14,000 mts cuadrados a 21,000 mts cuadrados y cultivarlos de granos básicos además quiere dar el estudio completo a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Samuel is 34-years-old, married, and has two daughters who are 10 and 4 years old.  His family didn't have sufficient resources to give him the opportunity to study.  His partner is a homemaker and only she and their two daughters live with him.

Samuel has been a farmer since he was little, and he worked with and learned from his father.  Today it is the only source of income that goes towards supporting his family.  He is asking for a loan to harvest the sesame that he planted.  It is about to be cut and he has to contract out manual labor as soon as possible to avoid losses from falling seeds that will compromise these earnings that go towards his family.

Samuel dreams of increasing the area of cultivation from 14,000 meters squared to 21,000 meters squared and planting basic grains, as well as completely educating his daughters.

loans.use: to harvest the sesame crop that he planted

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos de los que solo dos estudian. Él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

José es agricultor, trabajó desde muy pequeño debido a que su padre falleció y tenían que cubrir los gastos de la familia, con sus hermanos trabajaban en el campo de 6:00 am a 12:00 m y les pagaban el día. A sus 11 años decidió trabajar por su propia cuenta empezando con maíz y hoy en día tiene además frijol.

Solicita el préstamo para contratar mano de obra para cosechar el frijol y pagar maquinaria que lo procesa para tenerlo listo para vender. Su sueño más grande es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para que no pasen las dificultades por las que él paso.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old. He has a partner and three children, two of whom are in school. He did not have the opportunity to study. His partner is a housewife. Only her and their children live with him.

Jose is a farmer. He has been working since an early age, as his father died and he had to help cover the family expenses. He worked in the fields with his brothers from 6:00 a.m. until noon. They were paid by the day. At age 11, he decided to work on his own, starting with corn and he also currently grows beans.

He is requesting this loan to hire laborers to harvest the beans and to pay for the machinery that processes it, so that he can have it ready for sale. His biggest dream is for his children to finish their studies so they do not have to go through the difficulties he faced.

loans.use: to hire labor to harvest beans and to pay for the machinery to process it.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma tiene 45 años de edad, su estado civil es viuda, tiene 3 hijos, mayores de edad quienes trabajan en la ciudad de Lima y aportan en la canasta familiar, vive en casa familiar en el caserío de Laynas. La vida en el caserío se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales,comercio de arroz, comercio de ganado vacuno etc. Dicho caserío está ubicado en distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Enma es el alquiler de mototaxi, la cual cubre la ruta Laynas-La Matanza y viceversa. La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 1 año. El destino del crédito será para realizar la construcción de su casa en el caserío Laynas; pues desea realizar la compra de cemento, fierro, etc. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el servicio es muy comercial en la zona dado que es el único medio publico de transporte. Enma piensa trabajar otorgando buen servicio que le permitan a un mediano plazo incrementar sus ingresos y así obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Enma is 45 years old. She is a widow with three grown up children who work in the city of Lima and help with her expenses. She lives in the family home in the village of Laynas. Life in the village is quiet. Its inhabitants work on agriculture, cattle raising, rice trading and cattle trading. The village is located in the district of La Matanza, province of Morropon, region of Piura, north coast of Peru.

Enma's occupation is the rental of a motorcycle taxi, which covers the Laynas-La Matanza route. She has had this occupation for more than 1 year. The purpose of the loan is to build a home in the village of Laynas. She wants to buy cement, iron, etc. The market provides good opportunities for her business as it is the only means of transportation. Enma hopes to work providing a good service which will allow her to increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build her home in the village of Laynas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her store as well as shelving units and a refrigerator to store beverages

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus es un joven de 22 años, que siguiendo las orientaciones de su padre, quien le propuso generar sus propios ingresos mediante el emprendimiento de un negocio, decidió antes de empezar,   identificar las necesidades del sector;  Jesus observando las dificultades de las familias, para lavar diariamente la ropa después de trabajar, pues no tenía máquinas para hacerlo, o debían ir a otros sectores para obtener el servicio,   comentó a su padre la oportunidad  de ofrecer este servicio y este sin dudarlo lo apoyó en la adquisición de lavadoras; eso hace 5 años y hoy su negocio aún está ha funcionado; su propósito es ampliarlo, esforzarse trabajando para salir adelante y especialmente para  lograr estudios de calidad, que mejoren  su nivel de vida y finalmente sueña con adquirir su propia vivienda.  
En la actualidad, Jesus está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 10 lavadoras, pues su negocio tiene una gran demanda y hay clientes que no reciben el servicio. Como Jesus considera que entre más se incremente el volumen del servicio, mayor es su rentabilidad, a esto es justamente a lo que le está apuntando, con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 22 year old man. He is following the advice of his father, who recommended that he generate his own income by starting a business. Before starting, he decided to identify the needs in his area. Jesus noticed the difficulty faced by families to wash their clothes daily after work, as they do not have washing machines to do it. Some of the families had to go to other areas to obtain this service. He spoke to his father about the opportunity to offer this service and his father supported him with the acquisition of washing machines. This happened 5 years ago and his business is still running today. His goals are to expand the business, to work hard to get ahead, to be able to have a quality education that will help him improve his quality of life and, finally, to have his own home. 

Jesus is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which would be his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan, he will buy 10 washing machines. His business has high demand and he cannot serve some customers. Jesus considers that as the service volume increases, his profits will increase, and this is what he is aiming for with the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy 10 washing machines.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is a widowed mother who works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lory is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Lory has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Carolina

texts.es:
Evelyn de 23 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija, logró estudiar hasta 9° grado de educación básica, dejo el estudio debido a que su madre por una enfermedad que la postró por tres años dejo de trabajar y no pudo pagarle el estudio. Es madre soltera, su pareja la abandonó y tuvo que hacerse cargo de su hija, únicamente vive con su madre y su hija.

Evelyn es comerciante, vende pupusas desde hace 6 años en su casa y con eso ayudó a pagar el medicamento para el tratamiento de su madre, una vez esta se recuperó, puso un chalet en un centro escolar que queda a un kilómetro de donde vive y esa actividad a sido desde entonces su única fuente de ingreso.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar material selecto, laminas, ladrillos, cemento, hierro y demás para reparar su casa, debido a que en época lluviosa se moja todo en el interior de su casa. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener una vivienda digna y segura para su hija y su madre.
texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Evelyn is single and has a daughter. She reached 9th grade in elementary school. She left school because her mother, who stopped working due to a sickness that had debilitated her for three years, couldn't pay for Evelyn's studies. Evelyn is a single mother. Her partner abandoned her and she had to take care of her daughter. She only lives with her mother and her daughter.

Evelyn is a storekeeper. She has been selling stuffed tortillas for 6 years in her house, and with this she helped pay for the medicine for the treatment of her mother. Once her mother recovered, Evelyn setup a snack shop in a school that is a kilometer from where she lives, and this occupation has been her only source of income since then.

She requests a loan to buy fill material, sheets of metal, bricks, cement, iron, and other things to repair her house, because everything inside her house gets wet during the rainy season. Her dream has always been to have a respectable and secure home for her daughter and her mother.

loans.use: to buy fill material, sheets of metal, bricks, cement, iron, etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 3 años y su negocio es la confección de edredones.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Pura Pura’ un área caracterizada por ser el pulmón de la ciudad además, de conectar naturalmente entre ciudades y localidades  vecinas, como; El Alto, La Paz, Zongo y Chacaltaya a través de diversas vías. Barrio tipo industrial, porque se encuentran varias industrias de textiles, gaseosas, plásticos, etc. de clima frio y seco durante todo el año. Amalia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su niño de 3 años, viven en una casa propia de la familia que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de edredones tipo patchwork que es una técnica artesanal que consiste en la unión de pequeños trozos de tela, lo que da como resultado superficies muy coloridas, que se emplean para diferentes labores, en especial colchas y edredones. “mi negocio comenzó como una forma de reutilizar algunos tejidos que teníamos de diferentes colores, luego fuimos perfeccionando la técnica ahora trabajamos con pedidos por mayor y menor…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar y diversificar su negocio con la confección de nuevos productos, ella desea realizar una inversión mediante la compra de material de trabajo por mayor como; hilos, tela de color blanco, cuadrados de tela roja y azul de 12,5cm por 12,5cm., reglas, varios 'cutter', tijeras y lápices. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Amalia solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para la confección de edredones y cumplir con sus clientes mayoristas.
texts.en:
Amalia is a single, 32-year-old woman. She has a daughter who is 3 years old, and her business is the production of quilts.

She is a good mother, independent, active, responsible, and hard-working. She performs her business in the ‘Pura Pura’ zone, an area that is characterized by being the lung of the city as well as naturally connecting neighboring cities and towns, such as El Alto, La Paz, Zongo, and Chacaltaya through a variety of routes. It is an industrial type of neighborhood because there are a variety of industries in textiles, soft drinks, plastic, etc. It has a cold and dry climate during the whole year.

Amalia has a dark complexion, short stature, and long, black hair that is tied back. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish because of her business. She lives her life along with her 3-year-old son. They live in their own family home, which has electricity, potable water, and a sewage system. 

Her business is the production of patchwork quilts, which is an artisanal technique that consists of the union of small bits of cloth, which as a result gives very colorful surfaces which they employ for different jobs, especially bedspreads and quilts. “My business began as a way to reuse some different-colored cloth that we had. We then continued to perfect the technique, and now we work with wholesale and individual orders...” she comments. 

Her dream is to increase and diversify her business with the creation of new products. She wishes to make an investment by means of the purchase of works materials wholesale, such as: thread, white cloth, 12.5 cm squares of red and blue cloth, rulers, various cutters, scissors, and pencils. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 10 years that she has been performing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Amalia is requesting a loan for the purchase of work materials for the production of quilts and to fill her wholesale customers’ orders.

loans.use: to purchase work materials for the production of quilts and to fill her wholesale customers' orders.

loans.name: Richelieu

texts.en:
Richelieu is a 42-year-old man from Concepcion, Iloilo. He runs a small sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in his town. This is the main source of his income.

Richelieu is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and gasoline. With this, Richelieu will be able to attract more buyers to his store, thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and gasoline

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as God-fearing. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are daily customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as poor roads. 

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as time-conscious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are daily customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as the lack of enough capital. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a motorcycle helmet for use by customers to ensure safety. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will create employment. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle helmet for use by customers

loans.name: Senkata Alta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SENKATA ALTA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chaquetas, venta de ropa, venta de juguetes, venta de mantas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felicidad es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chuño y papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, pues se independizo de sus padres pero emprendió un negocio en el mismo rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las comunidades y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group A.C. "SENKATA ALTA" started it's seventh cycle at Pro Mujer as a part of the Centro Focal de Senkata.  It is made of up 8 members and led by a board of directors of whom Felicidad is the president.  The members of this communal association lead various business selling products such as jackets, clothing, toys, blankets, and vegetables.  

The loan will benefit small micro enterprises that Felicidad is a member of.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 2 years and she became a member by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution.  Presently she has a business selling potatoes and freeze-dried potatoes.  She started this business a few years ago when she became independent from her parents but started a business in the same line of work.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase the capital (amount of wholesale potatoes) that she will get from the wholesale vendors of communities and afterwards sell at her kiosk.  This kind of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically since she is married and has 3 children.

When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings and health services that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 48 year old married woman and a mother of three grown up children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small carenderia or restaurant in her place. She has been in the food vending business for more than four years now. Gina is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients to sell like meat., vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, rice and soft drinks. With a loan, Gina will be able to cook more food thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.
In the future, Gina hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to sell like meat., vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is an old client in the institution who has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX. His major source of income is retail shop and motorcycle taxi which he has done for fivr years. His major challenge is limited capital which affects his sales. Brian joined Ugafode to access financial support to expand his business and earn more income; he applied for this loan to buy another motorcycle to expand his boda boda business and also to add more capital in his retail shop. Brian’s dream is to expand his retail shop into a wholesale in the area. Brian thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled him to acquire pieces of land and also sustain his business which earns him more income. He is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells drinks. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
AIDA, who is in her early 50s is married with one child who is still in school. She has been running a business of selling second hand home utensils for five years now. She works from 10am to 5pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be AIDA's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to open a genge but later on she closed it and started selling second hand home utensils. She is doing fine and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase stock on second hand plates, saucepans, dishes, cups, etc. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She dreams of building her own house.

AIDA will make sure she pays the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase stock on second hand plates, saucepans, dishes, cups, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells motorcycle spare parts. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of capital. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be resilient. She operates a retail business where she sells medicine and cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine and cosmetics. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of medicine and cosmetics

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has two children with ages four and 14 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will employ people. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as polite. He operates a business where he offers transport services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are of all types. 

He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy cows and goats to sell. This will enable him to have other source of income. His business goal is to own a fleet of vehicles within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his family's living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats to sell

loans.name: Matias

texts.es:
Matías de 34 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta 3er grado de educación básica, dejo la escuela porque tuvo que trabajar con su padre y ayudarlo con los gastos de la casa. Actualmente vive solo.

Matías trabaja como jardinero cuidando un vivero en una casa, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, de pequeño tuvo la experiencia de trabajar con su padre cuidando un jardín le gusto tanto que ahora se dedica a eso. Todos los días camina 1 kilómetro diario mañana y tarde de 6.00 am a 1:00 pm tiene que cortar flores y preparar arreglos para los pedidos que le hacen o bien cuando llegan clientes a comprar. Además es agricultor, siembra siembra granos básicos.

Solicita el préstamo para construir una habitación en su casa para ampliarla y también repara el techo que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado y permite el paso del agua. Matías sueña con construir su casa de ladrillo, por el momento es de tablas y teja, además quiere conseguir un mejor trabajo y formar una familia.
texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Matías is single and doesn't have any children. He reached the 3rd grade in elementary school. He left school because he had to work with his father and help him with the household expenses. He currently lives alone.

Matías works as a gardener taking care of a nursery in a house. He has been making a living this way for 6 years. While growing up, he had the experience of working with his father taking care of a garden. He liked it so much that now he does it for a living. Everyday he walks 1 kilometer. Morning and afternoon, from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m., he has to cut flowers and prepare arrangements for requests that are made or for when customers come to buy them. In addition, he is a farmer and grows staple grains.

He requests a loan to build a room in his house to enlarge it, and also to repair the roof that has deteriorated with time and leaks water. Matías dreams of building his house with brick. For the moment, it is made of boards and tiles. In addition, he wants to get a better job and start a family.

loans.use: to build a room in his house to enlarge it, and to repair the roof.

loans.name: Zulola

texts.en: Zulola was born in 1996. She is married. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Zulola has no children. She lives with the parents of her husband. Zulola is a student of the first course Tajikistan State University Commerce. She learns Finance and Credit. She was one of the best pupils in school. She studies at the university well. Zulola must pay for her university tuition but she has no opportunity. She is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ricarte

texts.es:
Ricarte tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, el caserio de Shin Shin, en donde cultiva café, su casa se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Ricarte se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 10 años. En el Caserio shin shin. El destino del crédito es para comprar de abonos y inversión mantenimiento de su finca, pues manteniendo sus fincas en óptimas condiciones Ricarte obtendrá mayores rendimientos. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ricarte is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the community of Shin Shin, where he grows coffee. His house is located in the Cañarís district of the province of Ferreñafe, which is in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. People in this community generally make a living in agriculture, cattle ranching, and trade. 

Ricarte has been growing coffee for 10 years in the Shin Shin community. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer and to invest in the maintenance of his fields so that they will remain in optimal condition and produce higher yields. This will allow Ricarte to increase his income in the near future and also increase his savings and thus improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. He operates a rental housing business in which he provides houses for rent. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy materials to renovate his rental houses. His business goal is to own more houses within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Kevin also does farming, and he hopes that in the future, he will be a famous farmer.

loans.use: buy materials to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells sheep. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sheep. His business goal is to have more than 200 sheep within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have more sheep. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of sheep

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a rental houses business where she owns houses for rent. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials to renovate the rental houses. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own more rental houses. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy materials to renovate the rental houses

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of purified drinking water to sell.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es: Solicita el préstamo para comprar 10 conos de hilo para de diversos colores y estilos para elabora matatas y sacar a tiempo sus pedidos. Su sueño es construir su casa de bloques, y dar estudio completo a su hija además vender su producto en otras zonas del país.
texts.en: Reina De La Paz requests a loan to buy 10 cones of thread of various colors and styles to make tote bags and meet her orders on time. Her dream is to build her home with blocks, and give her daughter a complete education. Also, her dream is to sell her merchandise in other areas of the country.

loans.use: to buy 10 cones of thread of various colors and styles to make tote bags.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as a risk taker. He operates a business making jikos (cooking pots) and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area. He considers his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more materials for making jikos. His business goal is to have an established business within 5 years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits from this loan to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: buy more materials for making jikos (cooking pots).

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as time conscious. He operates a retail business selling bread. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for bread distribution. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment. This his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits from this loan to educate his children.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for bread distribution.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a quarry. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy quarry equipment. His business goal is to own more quarries within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy quarry equipment.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a male Kiva borrower. He has six children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rain season which affects transport. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a taxi. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 52 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Catalina has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Catalina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, eggs, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wood, metal bars, pins, and metal sheeting to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock. Her business goal is to be successful in business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will open other business outlets. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits from this loan to add more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock.

loans.name: Chigwirizano Group

texts.en: Ireen is 24 years old and married with two children and three dependents who she looks after. She sells radios, DVD players, and television screens together with her husband Davison in a market. She is doing business in order to alleviate her family's poverty and to be able to pay school fees for her children. Before she started her business she was selling vegetables. She is requesting this loan so she can bulk buy electronic accessories to attract more customers who are fishermen in her locality. Ireen plans to use any profit generated to open a wholesale shop in which she will sell assorted groceries. In the future she hopes to buy a secondhand vehicle for her family. As a woman she is able to feed her family and she has managed to buy fashionable clothes for herself and her children.

loans.use: buy electronic accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.en:
Khayriniso is borrowing from IMON for the first time. She is a careful mother of 3 children. Khayriniso is responsible for feeding her family as her husband’s income is small. 

Khayriniso is a sewer. She has been sewing for the local people for the past 10 years. She sews a variety of clothes. Khayriniso makes additional income from animal husbandry. She works hard every day to earn a living. She improves her living conditions little by little. 

Khayriniso is going to change the doors and windows of her house but does not have enough money for this. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to purchase plastic doors and windows. She awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase plastic doors and windows.

loans.name: Santos Abelis

texts.es:
Santos de 24 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene una hija de tres años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado de educación básica, desde muy pequeño trabajo en el campo en la mañana y por las tardes estudiaba. Su pareja es ama de casa y cuida a su hija.
Santos es militar, tiene 2 años desempeñándose en el destacamento de la cabecera departamental, descansa cada 8 días y visita a su familia, camina 45 minutos desde su cantón al pueblo más cercano para tomar el autobús que viaja 2 horas para llegar al destacamento y de igual manera cuando sale de este.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar un terreno que le venden en $1,000, su sueño más grande ya lo empezó, después de comprar el terreno él quiere construir una casa digna para su familia y dar el estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 24 years old, has a partner and a three-year-old daughter. He went to school through the 4th grade of basic education. When he was very young, he worked in the fields in the morning and in the afternoons he went to school. His partner is a housewife and cares for their daughter.

Santos is a soldier. For two years, he has been in the detachment of the department head. He has a break every week and visits his family. He walks 45 minutes from his canton to the closest town to take the bus, which travels two hours to arrive at his detachment, and he travels the same way in reverse when he leaves.

He is applying for a loan to buy a plot of land that is being sold for $1000. He has already begun his greatest dream. After buying the land, he wants to build a worthy house for his family and provide an education for his daughter.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane, and other materials

loans.name: Jaime Guillermo

texts.es: Jaime es un hombre trabajador que cuenta con 32 años de edad y habita junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre que cada día se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia prestando sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana a su vivienda. Jaime desea terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda, ya que no ha podido terminar de construirlo, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir su cuarto, y así cumplir su sueño de ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jaime is a hard-working man who is 32 years old and lives with his life companion and their three children, ages 9, 7, and 5. He is a man who strives every day to raise his family by offering his services in security at a business near his home. 

Jaime wants to finish building a room in his house, since he has not been able to finish building it. For this, he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to finish building his room and thus complete his dream of expanding his house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to finish building a room in his house.

loans.name: Yanaptasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YANAPTASIÑANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de periódicos, taller de soldadura, venta de papa, venta de vajillas, venta de decoraciones en cristalería y porcelana, vajillas, servicio de transporte, venta de juguetes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabeth es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de vajillas y utensilios de cocina; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa de su esposo, quien trabajo varios años con este producto, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vajillas, termos y ollas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es casada y tiene un hijo.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “YANAPTASIÑANI” will begin the first period in Pro Mujer [Benefit Woman], as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II [Focal Center of Santiago II]. The group is made up of 8 members, and it is directed by an executive board, in which Señora Elizabeth is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied. Among them exists: newspaper sales, a welding garage, potato sales, dinnerware sales, decorative porcelain and crystal sales, dinnerware, transportation services, and toy sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small business owners, one of which is the member Señora Elizabeth. She points out that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, joining by the invitation from a friend that is a client of the institute. Currently, she has a business selling dinnerware and kitchen utensils, a business she says was launched several years ago by the initiative of her spouse, who worked for several years with these products. With the passing of time, he is deciding to start an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is for an increase in capital to buy dinnerware, thermoses, and pots and pans at wholesale, which she will get from the city wholesalers of La Paz. Afterwards, she will market and sell these at her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate income to economically support her family, since she is married and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she like the training and the health area that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy dinnerware, thermoses, and pots and pans at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in nails, wood, and metal sheeting to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, ella es madre soltera vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia. Ana posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años, ubicado en su lugar de residencia, Ana solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 41 years old, is very hard working and responsible. She dedicates herself full-time to her business. Ana is a single mother who lives with her children in her own house.

Ana has for various years operated her fruit and vegetable stand from her residence.

Ana is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more fruit and vegetables at wholesale, in order to increase her income and, thus, her quality of life.

loans.use: buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale to sell from her house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has three children, and she operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in  a market area, and her primary customers are of all types. 

Grace will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. 

She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting and wood to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, cooking oil, soap, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Pili will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, and other items. 

Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, and other items

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has five children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. 

Caroline will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. 

Her business goal is to have a store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Jhonny Esthela

texts.es: Jhonny de 39 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 14 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando con el apoyo de Jhonny. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, desde hace 8 años, lo que le ha permitido sostener a su familia, y brindarles lo que este en sus manos. Jhonny es una mujer admirable que siempre busca lo mejor para sus hijos, es por ello que desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda, ya que ha observado que su vivienda, es muy pequeña, por lo que desea darle una mayor comodidad a su familia, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda, que le permita brindar mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 39 years old and a single mother who lives in her own house with her family, including her two children, ages 6 and 14, who are studying with Jhonny's help. She is an enterprising woman who has earned her living as a domestic servant in a private home for 8 years. This has allowed her to sustain her family and offer them whatever she could acquire with her own hands.

Jhonny is an admirable woman who always seeks the best for her children. It is for this reason that she wants to add a new room to her home. She has noted that her house is very small and she wishes to provide greater comfort for her family. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, blocks, and iron bars to construct another room in her home, allowing her to offer her children greater comfort.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, blocks and iron bars to construct a room in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting and pins to replace the roof of the kitchen of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking fat, rice, soap, and other items

loans.name: Blanca Leonor

texts.es: Blanca tiene 35 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos se dedica a la agricultura. Vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar maiz y obtener una producción buena ya que es la única actividad que realiza . Realiza las compras en Ventanas, su sueño es comprarse un terreno para sembrar mas para tener mejores ganancias. en su tiempo libre le gusta leer y hacer deporte.
texts.en: Blanca is 35 years old. She lives with her three children and makes a living in agriculture. She lives in Ventanas province of Los Rios. She requests a loan for the purchase of organic fertilizers and other fertilizers to plant corn and yield a good crop since this is her only occupation. She does her shopping in Ventanas, and her dream is to buy herself a piece of land to plant more and make a better profit. In her free time, she likes to read and play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: AKOU, depuis l’année 2000, fait le commerce des fruits devant son domicile dans le quartier Agoè "assiyéyé" où elle habite. Elle est une très jeune dame mariée et mère de quatre enfants et âgée de 27 ans ,puis s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois dans ce marché. AKOU sollicite un prêt pour plus approvisionner et satisfaire sa clientèle afin d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Since 2000 Akou sells fruits outside her home in the Agoè "assiyéyé" neighborhood where she lives. She is a young 27-year-old married mother of four children.

Akou resupplies four times a month at the market. She is seeking a loan to replenish her stock supply and satisfy her customers, so she can increase her profit margin and provide for her family.

loans.use: buy 10 baskets of oranges and 30 bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and labor to repair the septic system of her house.

loans.name: Las Pollitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS POLLITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de gorras, taller mecánico, venta de deportivos, venta de cordones, venta de tortas, venta de plantillas, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de gorritos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años iniciando el mismo después de haber asistido a cursos de capacitación, posteriormente decide emprender su negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “LAS POLLITAS” will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer [Benefit Woman], as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani [Focal Center of Colpani]. The group is made up of 8 members, and it is directed by an executive board, in which Señora Juana is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied. Among them exists: hat sales, a mechanic garage, sports product sales, shoelace sales, cake sales, shoe insole sales, and coca sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small business owners, one of which is the member Señora Juana. She points out that this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation from a friend that is a client of the institute. Currently, she has a business selling caps, a business she says that she launched herself after having attended training courses. Afterwards, she decided to launch an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is for an increase in capital to buy wholesale wool, which she will get from the city wholesalers of La Paz. After she produces her merchandise, she will market and sell it at her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate income to economically support her family, since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the health area that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool.

loans.name: Dina Maribel

texts.es: Dina es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 36 años de vida ha logrado tener una vivienda propia en la que habita junto a sus dos hijos uno mayor de edad y el otro de 10 años de edad, además vive con ellos una sobrina de 22 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable que se gana la vida como jornalera en un vivero cercano a su domicilio, además su hijo mayor le apoya con los gastos de su hogar. Dina desea brindar una mayor seguridad a su familia, y para ello ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: materiales y mano de obra para elaborar e instalar un portón de hierro en la entrada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dina, 36, is a hardworking woman who has achieved owning her own home where she lives with her two children, one grown and the other 10 years old, as well as her 22 year-old niece. She is an admirable woman who earns a living working in a plant nursery near her home. Her oldest son also helps out with the household expenses.

Dina wants to give her family more security, which is why she has asked for a loan from FUSAI to buy materials and pay labor costs for the construction and installation of an iron gate at the entrance to her home.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor to build and install an iron gate at the entrance to her home.

loans.name: Alis Enrique

texts.es: Alis de 45 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijastras y su hijastro ya mayor de edad que apoya a la economía de su hogar. Él siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, y es por ello que desde hace mucho tiempo se desempeña como jornalero en una finca cercana. Alis es un hombre responsable que actualmente está construyendo su vivienda, pero no tiene la liquidez necesaria para comprar las láminas del techo y las paredes de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en lámina galvanizada y clavos para terminar de construir su vivienda de lámina.
texts.en: Alis, 45, is an enterprising man who lives in the home he owns with his wife and his two stepdaughters as well as one grown stepson who helps out with the family finances. He is always looking for a way to get his family ahead, and for that reason he decided a long time ago to become a laborer on a nearby farm. Alis is a responsible guy and is currently building his house, but he doesn't have liquid assets to buy all of the tin sheeting that he needs for the roof and walls of his home. For that reason, he has asked FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized tin sheeting and nails so he can finish building his home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized tin sheeting and nails to finish constructing his home.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is a married woman and she has four children. She describes herself as God-fearing. Milicent operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, soap, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuation. 

Milicent will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, and other items

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, sweets, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, soap, flour and other items to sell during this peak season. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide a better life for her family. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Marycel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marycel works hard to support her family.

Marycel has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothes and a sugarcane farming business. Marycel is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Marycel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 50 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Felicidad has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Lizeth Alejandra

texts.es:
Lizeth es una joven de 24 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, junto con su pareja trabajan diariamente para darles una buena calidad de vida y no dejar que pasen alguna necesidad, Lizeth como mujer independiente, le gusta tener su negocio y su propia entrada de dinero, por si un día le falta su pareja tener con que sostener a sus hijos.
Tiene su  negocio de venta de bebidas alcohólicas, y frituras que ha ido formando y surtiendo conforme su utilidad, lo inicio empíricamente y aprendió trabajando en negocios similares.
Lizeth solicita una ayuda crediticia para la compra de surtido, básicamente bebidas alcohólicas y adecuaciones al local como pintura, luces entre otros.
Ella pide una ayuda desea con mucha fuerza comprar su vivienda, y tal como dice el verbo “comprar” lo quiere hacer con su propio esfuerzo por ellos quiere un apoyo para salir adelante y esforzarse por ese sueño.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a young woman of 24, the mother of two children, ages 6 and 2. She works every day along with her partner to give them a good quality of life and not let any needs occur. Lizbeth, as an independent woman, likes having her own business and her own source of income, so that if some day she doesn't have her partner, she will have something to support her children.

She has a business of selling alcoholic beverage and fried snacks, which she has been making and stocking according to their usage. She began the business empirically and learned by working in similar businesses.

Lizbeth is applying for financial help to buy stock, basically alcoholic beverages and items for her facilities, such as paint and lights, among other things. 

She is requesting help. She wants with great desire to buy her house, and just as she says to verb "to buy," she wants to do it with her own effort. For this, she needs support to get ahead and strive for this dream.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages and items for her business, such as lights, paint, etc. She wants with great eagerness to buy a house.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a gasoline retailer from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 54 years old and has been in the business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income. 

Virgie is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. With a loan, Virgie will be able to improve her gasoline stocks, allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Virgie hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in the market area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high costs. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kiramiraa

texts.en: Kiramiraa is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be a go-getter. He operates a retail business where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to have a big business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a better life. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a married woman, and she has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

Maureen operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

Maureen will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman, and she has eight children. She describes herself to be focused. 

Caroline operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. 

Caroline will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Midius

texts.en:
Midius is a new client to the organization. She is a widow and has five children. Midius lives in Nyamabare village, Rukungiri. She is a hard working lady and does outside catering as her main source of income. With this business, she has managed to educate her five children to the secondary level. Midius has relied on this business for her financial needs, but she has now found out that her business alone cannot meet all her needs, including school fees for her dependents. So, she has decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance. Midius regrets not joining UGAFODE earlier, saying if she had joined some years back, her children would have reached the university level.  

Midius has approached UGAFODE for financial assistance and she applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to buy more items like cooking pans, plates, dishes, and food warmers to empower her catering business. Midius is very dedicated to educating her dependents up to the university level with financial assistance from UGAFODE microfinance.

loans.use: To buy items like cooking pans, plates, dishes, and food warmers for her catering business

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a male Kiva borrower. He has one child. He describes himself to be obedient and faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high competition. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to expand to a large scale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is a married man, and he has two children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. 

Elvis has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are locals. 

Elvis will use the KES 20,000 loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a better businessperson. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment to have a child

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. Cicilia operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. 

Cicilia will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. Priscillah operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of finances. 

Priscillah will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Asuntah

texts.en: Asuntah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are both large scale and small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough finances and poor climate. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale farming business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman, and she has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Eunice operates a farm where she keeps poultry and cows. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

Eunice will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in the season. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy garage equipment. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy garage equipment

loans.name: Janet
