texts.es: Mercancías y carnes frías, son las dos actividades comerciales, a las que se dedica Janet, una mujer de 47 años de edad, que inició su propio negocio desde hace 13, cuando lo hizo como iniciativa propia, en función de mejorar su nivel de vida y atender las obligaciones de su hogar, especialmente para dar cumplimiento a los gastos que se generan. Salchichas, macarrones, mortadelas, víveres, ropa exterior, productos de tocador, son las líneas de artículos que vende diariamente a crédito, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su meta mas adelante es adquirir su propia vivienda y generar oportunidades de más ingresos, más ahorros, más utilidades y mayores créditos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carnes frías, ropa exterior, ropa interior, productos de tocador y artículos navideños. Con esta inversión logrará mejorar su capacidad de respuesta a los pedidos de los clientes y ampliará su capital de trabajo, para finalmente lograr muchos de sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Merchandise and cold cuts are the two occupations through which Janet makes a living. She is a 47-year-old woman who started her own business 13 years ago. She started it as her own initiative, in order to improve her quality of life and attend to her household obligations, especially to take care of the expenses that generate. 

Sausages, macaroni, mortadella, provisions, outerwear, and toiletries are the types of items that she sells on a daily basis on credit. She works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. Her goal for the future is to acquire her own home and to create opportunities to generate more income, more savings, more profit, and larger loans. 

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan – the first loan that she requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo – with which she will buy cold cuts, outerwear, undergarments, toiletries, and Christmas items. With this investment she will be able to improve her ability to respond to her customers’ requests, and she will expand her working capital. This will allow her to finally succeed in many of her dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts, outerwear, undergarments, toiletries, and Christmas items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be the best tailor and supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big tailoring shop. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of tailoring materials and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah is a married woman. She has six children. She operates a farm where she grows bananas. Her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital and pests. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved lifestyle. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a chemist where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for two years. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Gnima's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 13 décembre 2003 le banc villageois regroupe en son sein des femmes qui partagent l’idéal que toute personne doit être utile à la société et particulièrement à sa famille. Les sous  groupes qui le composent sont très dynamique dans le secteur du petit commerce et font preuves d’une solidarité et entre aide mutuelle. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et pratiquent le petit commerce.

 Madame Gnima (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est mariée, âgée de 44 ans et  mère de  03 enfants (02 garçons et 01 fille de 22 ans). Elle est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires (pomme de terre, oignons, bouillons culinaires et autres produits alimentaires) légume et divers condiment et bouillons. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché central communal en gros et demi gros pour la revente par détail. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte assurer son approvisionnement pour une valeur de 200 000 Fr CFA en sacs d’oignon de 25 kg et divers condiments et bouillons culinaires. 

Avec les bénéfices lui permettront de prendre en charge en partie les besoins de la famille en nourriture, scolarité et santé et d’autre part à augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Created December 13, 2003, the "banc villageois" loan association regroups women who share the ideal that each person should be useful to society and especially to his/her family. The subgroups are very dynamic in the area of small retail commerce and demonstrate solidarity and mutual assistance. Members all live in the same locality and are small retail merchants.

Mrs. Gnima (standing on the far right with her hand raised), is the featured borrower. She is a 44-year-old married mother of three children (two boys and one 22-year-old girl). She sells food products (potatoes, onions, bouillon cubes) and various vegetables and condiments.

She gets her supplies wholesale and semi-wholesale at the municipality's central market, for resale at retail prices. She has acquired good experience in this field having practiced it for several years.

She will use the new loan to secure  200,000 CFA francs' worth of supplies: 25-kilo bags of onions, various condiments and bouillon cubes.

The profits will enable her to take over some of the family's food, education and health needs, and also to increase her savings.

loans.use: secure supplies worth 200,000 CFA francs of onions in 25-kilo bags and various condiments and bouillon cubes.

loans.name: Sarantañani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARANTAÑANI” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sofía es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frazadas, venta de ropa, venta de monederos, servicio de internet, venta de mantas, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sofía es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, al observar que era muy productivo y de alta rentabilidad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “SARANTAÑANI” will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer [Benefit Woman] as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes [Focal Center of the Andes]. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a Board of Directors, of which Sofía is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied. Among them exist: selling blankets, selling clothes, selling purses, internet service, selling manta (a type of natural, unbleached cotton) and transportation services. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners, of which Sofía is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining due to the invitation from a huge promotion that the institution carried out in her area. Currently, she has a food sales business. She lets us know that she started this business various years ago, after noticing that it was very productive and had high profitability. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (to buy provisions on wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in La Paz. After she produces her merchandise, she will market it in her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children. 

When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy provisions on wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick making materials and pay labour fees

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, eggs and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area fit for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, eggs and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, eggs and other items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be resilient. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of float. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add to her M-pesa float. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float

loans.name: Hassen

texts.en:
Hassen is a 25-year-old single man living with his family in Haja city, Yemen. He belongs to a poor family. Hassen studied until elementary education but he couldn't complete his studies. He runs with his father a small store for repair and maintenance of cars. His income from this hard business is low because that store lacks of a lot of equipment and there is not enough auto oil. The store is very far from the house where Hassen lives with his family. He decided to purchase a minibus to use as transportation from his business to the house and vise versa. Hassen doesn't have enough money to do so. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a minibus for him to use as transportation to save the money that he pays daily for transport.

Hassen looks forward to providing his store with all the equipment needed to be able to attract a lot of customers.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to use as transportation to save the money that he pays daily for transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repairs to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy galvanized sheets and nails to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex proviene de una familia muy humilde que con sacrificio diario trata de salir adelante, Trabajo en el poder Judicial, su meta más cercana es poder recibirse y trabajar en su profesión para así sacar adelante a su familia.
Está estudiando para ser abogado, y por medio de esta profesión poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Alex comes from a very humble family. Through daily sacrifice, he has been able to get ahead. Alex works for the judicial system. His short-term goal is to receive his degree and work at his profession so that his family can get ahead.

Alex is studying to become a lawyer. By pursuing this profession, he will be able to help his family. Alex is requesting this loan in order to pay his fees. As a result, he will be able to continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 30 años al cultivo caña de azucar, cuando su cultivo ya esta listo lo comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, y ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Manuel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 64 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and son. He has been cultivating sugar cane for the past 30 years. When his crop is ready to be harvested, it is then sold in the neighboring towns. Manuel already has many established customers.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can improve the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, he can continue cultivating his crops since this is his only source of income. Manuel will be able to have a better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can improve his land.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are individuals. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy a water tank. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big water bottling company. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is a single woman with one child, who describes herself as determined. She has been operating a clothing business for two years. It is in a good area and her customers are of all types. Delphine describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. Thus, she will use this 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.ru: Зухура, 58 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, с 1990 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Зухуры на сегодняшний день есть: 2 коровы. Дети помогают Зухуре, однако ей хочется ни от кого не зависеть, а так как доходы катастрофически низкие и единственный заработок для нее - животноводство, Зухура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Зухуры и ее семьи.
texts.en: Zuhura is 58 years old, a widow and a mother of 3 children. She has a specialized secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry since 1990. Today, Zuhura's farm contains 2 cows. The children help Zuhura; however, she does not want to be dependent on anyone, but because her income is catasrophically low and animal husbandry is her sole source of income, Zuhura requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. The earnings from the business will help improve Zuhura's and her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with two children. For ten years, she has been running a retail business selling clothes. Her business is located in a market area and her customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delays in acquiring new stock. Thus, she will use the 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more clothes to sell. Jane's business goal is to open a boutique within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, having successfully repaid her previous loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a welding business where he offers welding services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy welding materials. His business goal is to own a big welding garage within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy welding materials

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a married woman with three children who describes herself as industrious. She has a business selling clothes, which she has been running for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, but she describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of finances. Teresia will use her 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stocks of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analiza is 21 years old now.

Analiza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags for her business.

Analiza has been in this business for two years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags for her business

loans.name: Jorge Alonso

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre trabajador de 48 años de edad, que debido a un problema de salud no puede ejercer la mayoría de trabajos donde aplique fuerza por ello ingeniosamente ahorro y se sacrificó para comprar un carro a cuotas y empezar en el negocio de transporte de pasajeros una actividad muy necesaria en la vereda pues el transporte es muy limitado.
Con la ayuda de un crédito Jorge le hará unas reparaciones necesarias a su vehículo que de momento lo tiene parado pues no le parece ético operar sabiendo que el carro puede no estar en condiciones óptimas.
Este hombre por su problema no puede tener ningún otro trabajo solicita su ayuda para reiniciar su actividad y seguir velando por su familia conformada por su hijo y su pareja y buscando siempre la felicidad de ellos.
texts.en:
Jorge is a hardworking man who is 48 years old.  Due to a health problem, he cannot hold most jobs where you have to use force.  Because of that, he resourcefully invested and scarified to buy a car in installments and to begin the business of transporting passengers.  This is a very necessary job in the village because transportation is very limited.

With the help of a loan, Jorge will make some necessary repairs to his vehicle.  At the moment he has stopped it since it does not seem ethical to him operate knowing that the car cannot be in top conditions.

This man, because of his problem, cannot have any other job.  He asks for your help to restart his job and to continue providing for his family, made of his son and his wife, and looking always for their happiness.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle to operate again.  He is a man, that due to a health problem, cannot work a normal job.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nirmahmad

texts.ru: Нирмахмад  мужчина 30 лет , женат , молодой отец троих детей . Он с детства приручен к тяжелому труду на поле , помогал родителям по дому , ухаживал за скотом , выращивал и собирал фрукты и овощи . У его родителей не было средств для того ,чтобы он получил высшее образование , поэтому Нирмахмад после женитьбы продолжил заниматься скотоводством. Сейчас он на на своем земельном участке имеет 5 голов коров и 10 баранов . Нирмахмад берет кредит , чтобы закупить корм для скота и увеличить поголовье скота.Но в настоящее время не имеет нужной суммы ,поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Нирмахмад выражает свою благодарность МДО Арванд и надеется,что МДО Арванд выделит нужную ему сумму для расширения и продолжения бизнеса.
texts.en: Nirmahmad is a 30-year-old married man and a father of three children. Since childhood, he has been used to hard work on a field, helping his parents at home, taking care of livestock, and growing and harvesting vegetables and fruits. His parents did not have money to provide him with a college education, and this is why Nirmahmad continued to be involved in animal husbandry after getting married. He currently has 5 cows and 10 sheep. Nirmahmad is requesting this loan to buy livestock feed and increase livestock headcount. At the present time, he does not have the necessary sum of money, and this is why he came to MDO Arvand for financial support. Nirmahmad expresses his gratitude to MDO Arvand and hopes that MDO Arvand will lend him the necessary sum to expand and continue his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 59 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza  cada día para salir adelante apoyado en su negocio de venta de medicamentos naturales, actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre le solicitan sus productos. Julio se siente feliz de tener un lugar propio donde vivir, ya que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 37 años, ya que gracias a su tenacidad logró obtenerla. Julio desea que su vivienda le ofrezca mejores condiciones de vida, ya que actualmente el techo de la misma se encuentra deteriorado, al igual que las láminas de las paredes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para cambiar el techo y las laminas de las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julio, 59 years old, is a hardworking man that strives every day to get ahead supported by his business selling natural medicines, a job that he has been doing for 20 years.  He has a lot of customers who always request his products.  Julio is happy to have his own place to live as he has lived in his own house for 37 years.  Thanks to his tenacity, he managed to obtain it.

Julio wants his house to offer him better living conditions.  Currently the roof is damaged, same with the wall sheets.  For that, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets, nails, and wood to change the roof and the wall sheets of his house.

loans.use: To invest in galvanized sheets, nails, and wood to change the roof and the wall sheets of his house.

loans.name: Farzonai

texts.ru: Фарзона женщина 40 лет , замужем ,мать четверых детей . Она родилась и выросла в сельской местности и с детства приучена к тяжелому труду на поле . У ее родителей не было средств ,чтобы дать своим детям высшее образование,поэтому Фарзона после замужества продолжила заниматься животноводством.Сейчас на своем участке земли она ухаживает  за скотом.Она работает день и ночь в холод и жару ,чтобы прокормить своих детей,чтобы они как она не знали нужд . Фарзона хочет закупить корм для скота и расширить бизнес.Но у нее нет полной суммы.Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Она надеется ,что МДО Арванд откликнется на ее просьбу о помощи и выделит ей нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Farzonai is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She was born and raised in a rural area and has been used to hard work on a field since her childhood. Her parents did not have money to provide their children with college education, and this is why Farzonai continued to be involved in animal husbandry after getting married. Now she takes care of livestock on her plot of land. She works day and night, during the cold and heat in order to feed her children so that they would not know needs. Farzonai wants to buy livestock feed and expand her business, but she does not have the full amount of money. This is why she came to MDO Arvand for financial support. She hopes that MDO Arvand will respond to her request for help and lend her the necessary sum. She is grateful for the support and trust in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and expand her business

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a nursery school where she teaches children. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are children. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

She will use the 60,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy school furniture and stationery. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy school furniture and stationery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a divorced man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a developing area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of fruits for selling during the coming peak season. His business goal is to be a major supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will sustain his family financially. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Mwadori

texts.en:
Mwadori is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for one year. His primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be animal diseases. 

He will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more livestock. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own more livestock. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 56-year-old dressmaker from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has five grown-up children. Vilma has been engaged in a dressmaking business for more than 30 years now.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy materials for sewing, like cloth, needles, thread and other items. With this loan, she will be able to make more dresses to sell for a good price.

In the future, Vilma has hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing, like cloth, needles, thread and other items

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en:
Sevindj is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents in the Fuzuli region. They are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. Her father is a teacher and her mother is a housewife. She helps Sevindj in her little business. 

Sevindj has been in farming for 2 years, planting cabbages. Now she would like to improve her little business. For this reason she needs a loan of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With  this loan she wants to buy fertilizer and water.

Sevindj is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the loan and for helping her develop her business. In the future she wants to build a big greenhouse to improve her business. And in her personal life she wants to get married and to have children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and water.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Carina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

Carina has been farming bananas for 18 years and also earns additional income from working in a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 31 год, замужем, образование - средне-специальное. В настоящее время занимается животноводством, полеводством, продает экологически чистое, вкусное молоко. Прибыль в среднем составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Жылдыз есть 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец, 1 лошадь, на участке мерою 0,60 ГА собственной и 2,0 ГА арендованной земли она выращивает клевер, перец для реализации. Жылдыз с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Супруг и 3 детей помогают по хозяйству. Жылдыз обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров с телятами для увеличения объемов реализации домашнего молока.
texts.en: Zhyldyz is 31 years old, married, has a specialized secondary education. At the present time, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming and sells ecologically-clean and delicious milk. Her average profit amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). Zhyldyz's farm contains 2 dairy cows, 20 sheep and 1 horse. She grows clover and pepper for sale on 0.60 hectares of owned and 2.0 hectares of leased land. Zhyldyz treats her business with great responsibility. Her husband and 3 children help her with the business. Zhyldyz requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 2 dairy cows with calves in order to increase the milk volumes and sales.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and calves in order to increase the volumes of eco-friendly milk

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 43-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Carmelita has a business selling fish in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Carmelita has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sherry

texts.en:
Sherry is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children aged 13, 10 and 7. She lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. 

Sherry runs a retail store selling goods including clothes, undergarments, slippers and sandals. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell. With a loan, Sherry will be able to improve her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Sherry hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell including clothes, undergarments, slippers and sandals

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru: Валентина, 61 год, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Образование у Валентины средне-специальное. У нее 34 года трудовой стаж, сейчас работает завхозом, ежемесячная зарплата составляет около 6,500 сом (KGS), также получает пенсию. Валентина решила перекрыть крышу дома, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 16,000 сом (KGS). На полученный кредит Валентина купит шифер, рейки и прочие материалы. Перекрытие крыши поможет утеплить и облагородить дом.
texts.en: Valentina is 61 years old, married and has grown and independent children. Valentina has a specialized secondary education. She has 34 years of work experience and now works as an assistant manager and earns a monthly salary of 6.500 som (KGS) and also receives a pension. Valentina decided to re-coat her house roof and requested a loan in the amount of  16,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank for this purpose. Valentina will use this loan to buy slates, rails and other materials. Re-coating the roof will help her insulate and enhance her house.

loans.use: to purchase slates, rails and other materials to re-coat the roof of her house

loans.name: Maria Monica

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo recién nacido, y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es independiente, constante, buena madre, responsable, activa y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Sur’ de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas en especial la manufactura, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente que varía entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y su bebé recién nacido, viven en un cuarto alquilado que cuenta con el servicio de agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de temporada, como; bermudas, pantalones cortos, shorts, etc. en un puesto de venta fijo en la calle. “la necesidad por trabajar me inicio en la venta de ropa de temporada, por suerte me va bien, tengo clientes constantes porque no paro de trabajar” comenta. su trabajo lo realiza de lunes a domingo en horarios de 9 de la mañana a 7 de la noche. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa de marca, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de temporada por mayor para abaratar costos de transporte y tener variedad de pendas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor para surtir su negocio y abastecer a sus clientes constantes.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman of 21 years old, she lives with her partner, has a newborn baby, and her business is clothing sales.

She is independent, steadfast, a good mother, responsible, active and hardworking. Her business is located in the southern part of the city, an area known for its growing commerce in all areas and especially in manufacture, the hot climate, tropical and humid, with an ambient temperature which varies between 21-35 degrees centigrade during the day and throughout the year.

Maria has a dark complexion and long black hair, short stature, her mother tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and their newborn baby. They live in a rented room which is connected to drinking water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is selling seasonal clothing such as: bermuda shorts, short pants, shorts, etc. in a permanent sales place on the street. "Need to work got me started in seasonal clothing sales, luckily it's going well, I have regular customers because I can't stop working", she says. She works from Monday to Sunday from 9 in the morning to 7 at night. Her dream is to have a store of brand clothing and she wants to make an investment in her business by buying seasonal clothing wholesale to lower transport costs and have a variety of garments. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the year that she has been in this line of work.

For these reasons Maria is requesting a loan to buy clothing wholesale to stock her business and supply her regular customers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale garments to stock her business and supply her regular customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and doors, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María Amparo tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto as u esposo en el distrito de Oyotun una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio, y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

María Amparo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 07 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo: compra de patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Amparo is 28 years old.  She lives with her husband in the Oyotun district, a rural area where the population works in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru. 

María Amparo has raised animals for 7 years.  Her business is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan for working capital, to purchase ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs.  The loan will help her have a greater diversity of animals so that she can grow her business and meet her customers' needs.  This will allow her to increase her income quickly, increase her profits, and therefore improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, and metal bars, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Idimurod

texts.en:
Idimurod was born in the year 1961. He lives with his family in a rural area. Idimurod is an electrician. He has been providing services to local people for more than 20 years and has good reputation among the local people of his village. 

Idimurod’s wife is a housewife and so he is the only food-provider of the family. He lives with his family together poorly as the family income is small. 

Idimurod must change the doors and windows of his house as they are broken and too old. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy plastic doors and windows. He awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic doors and windows.

loans.name: Armi Rose

texts.en:
Armi Rose is 26 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for herself.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Armi Rose has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future Armi Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonila is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leonila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a 46-year-old married mother of three children who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher and her husband works in agriculture. 

Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their daughter's education.

This loan of $ 800 will allow Olga to send her daughter  to University. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, school supplies. Olga loves her daughter very much and hopes that further education will help her to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay for tuition, textbooks, school supplies.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is engaged in retail sales of dried fish. Aileen has been in the business for more than 2 years now.

Aileen works hard in order to support her husband to meet the needs of the family especially for the schooling of their children. Aileen is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell and a new weighing scale. With a loan, Aileen will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more dried fish to her customers. 

In the future, Aileen hopes to make her business successful and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell and a new weighing scale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 55 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, compra de más mercadería, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old.  She lives with her partner and they do not have children.  They live in a rural area in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  Her community works in agriculture, ranching and commerce.  


Rosa has a small grocery selling items like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, eggs, soups etc.  She has had her business for over 10 years and it is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan for working capital to invest in more merchandise.  This will allow her to increase her sales and have a large impact on her business.  With greater product selection she can meet the diverse needs, requirements and tastes of the customers in her area.  She will be able to increase her income quickly, increase her profits, and therefore improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To expand her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build extra rooms to expand his house.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 43 years old with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins.

Eva has been raising pigs for 7 years and also earns additional income from raising poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elsa is 65 years old now.

Elsa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use.

Elsa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vilma is 43 years old and has one child in school.

Vilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

Vilma has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 34 years old and has one child in school.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a new client for the organization; he is married with 4 children with three who attend school. He carries out coffee trade as his major source of income, which he has done for 10 years. 

However Edward is affected with limited capital, therefore he decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance so as to buy dry corn to compete favorably in the market. Edward hopes that this loan of 5,000,000 UGX will help him to increase his sales to earn him more profits. 

Edward praises Ugafode for the financial assistance which will enable him to boost his business and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy corn to sell.

loans.name: Princesitas Del Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRINCESITAS DEL AMOR” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gregoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de café, venta de artesanías, venta de tucumanas, venta de cotillones, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de mantas, servicio de lavado de auto.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gregoria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de artesanías en aguayo; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió aprendiendo la técnica de su madrina a la que apoyaba en su negocio, con un poco capital decidió independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aguayos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The  “PRINCESITAS DEL AMOR” communal bank is starting its 9th lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes.  This group is composed of 8 members and is run by a board of directors, of which Gregoria is the President.  The members have diverse businesses such as selling coffee, crafts, tucumanas (Bolivian empanadas), party favors, groceries, food, shawls, and a car wash business. 

The loan being requested will help the small business owners in Gregoria's group.  She joined Pro Mujer 2 years ago, invited by a friend who is a member of the communal bank.  She currently has a business selling crafts made with aguayo fabric.  She learned the technique from her Godmother who supported her in starting her business.  Once she had a little bit of capital, she decided to set up an independent business.

This loan will be used for working capital to purchase aguayo fabric wholesale.  She will purchase the fabric from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and then sell her products at her stand.  This work allows her to help support her family financially, as she is single with two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and loans that Pro Mujer provides.

loans.use: to purchase aguayo cloth.

loans.name: Osias

texts.en:
Osias is a 53-year-old man who is married to Ana, a 40 year old woman. They are blessed with a daughter namely Marsiani, 7, an elementary school student in second grade. Osias works as a private employee while his wife, Ana, has a business selling vegetables. 

Osias is also responsible for his brother, named Daniel, particularly his education costs. Now he is studying at a University in the 2nd semester. Daniel needs some money to pay his education costs. Therefore, Osias has applied for an individual loan from TLM of IDR 8,000,000. The loan will be spent on Daniel’s semester registration fees and other college fees and requirements.

loans.use: to pay his brother's semester registration fees and other college fees and requirements.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
Khurshed was born in the year 1993. He is a hardworking and industrious man. Khurshed is a student of the 4th year in Tajikistan National University. He studies in the faculty of Economy and Finance. 

Khurshed studies economics and the banking system. He is one of the best students. He always helps his classmates. He has a lot of friends. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition fees for the university. He awaits your support and in advance thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy slippers, candles, sugar, coffee, plastic, soaps, eggs, soy sauce, cooking oils, biscuits, cigarettes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Melony

texts.en:
Melony is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Melony is 39 years old and has one child in school.

Melony has a fishing business in the Philippines. Melony requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

Melony has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Melony would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Milagros is 65 years old now.

Milagros has a food vending business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Milagros has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking oils, toothpaste, hair oils, candies, detergents, soaps, shampoo, rice and other things to sell.

loans.name: Usmonkul

texts.en:
Usmonkul is poor man from a rural area. He is married and his children are adults. He has worked for 30 years in a local school as a teacher as he has a higher education. Usmonkul likes his job very much and has worked for many years in a local school with pleasure. He is one of the best teachers who has a great experience. 

Usmonkul must buy coal and wood to keep his house warm in the winter season as the weather is cold in the winter season. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy coal and wood for the winter season. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood for the winter season.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 34 years old and all of her children are in school.

Marilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cristina is 54 years old now.

Cristina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use.

Cristina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use.

loans.name: Tutea's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Tutea, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 4 children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Tutea joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Tutea plans to invest in a business.

Between the 14 farmers in Tutea's Group, a total of 7.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. 

Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old and has six children. Juana is a married woman.

Juana is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Juana requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juana has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Juanita is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Juanita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with her 2 children. Mzia works as a cleaner at a public school and gets small monthly income. Her daughter is a nurse at the hospital. 

As the existing income is quite small, Mzia decided to generate more income and start an additional business to provide better living conditions for her children. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 550 Gel to start a trading business. 

With the received credit she will purchase clothes and will resell them at a higher price. This will give her a chance to generate more income and a stable income. Mzia awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes.

loans.name: Fredik

texts.en:
Fredik is a 46-year-old man who is married to Osterfina, a 40-year-old housewife. They have not been blessed with children. Fredik is working as a civil servant while Osterfina runs a business producing cakes, cookies, and snacks such as corn fried, roasted peanuts, cassava chips and banana chips to sell at supermarket or stores; in addition she also receives orders directly from customers. This business has been running for years as it was inherited from Osterfina’s mother. 

Due to the fact that many people will soon be celebrating Christmas and New Year, Osterfina is also receiving many orders for cakes, cookies and snacks. Therefore Fredik is keen to request an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 7,500,000. Its purpose is to purchase ingredients for cakes and cookies such as corns, peanuts.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cakes and cookies.

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en:
Zarofat is a careful mother of 3 children. She is married. Zarofat lives with her family in a village. Her husband has been a farmer for many years and his income is small. 

Zarofat is going to start her own business growing and selling vegetables and crops. With this aim, Zarofat took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ provided by a women's organization and she got a certificate. 

Zarofat will grow crops and vegetables on her land and sell them in a local market. Zarofat is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers so she can start a new business.

loans.name: Ferderika

texts.en:
Ferderika is a 52-year-old widow who is blessed with 3 children, they are Maria Yanti, 31, married; Maria Sarlina, 27, married; and the last is Rosalia, 20, in the 1st semester at University. 

As a breadwinner, Ferderika has to work hard to support her family life. She has been running a kiosk business since 2006. She sells various product s which are needed on a daily basis such as instant noodles, sugar, coffee, snacks, shampoo, soap, cooking oil, etc. 

At the moment Ferderika needs more business capital and she has applied for an individual loan from TLM of IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on more stock to be sold in her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to be sold in her kiosk.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old and single.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Virginia has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Virginia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne, pictured above, has been a farmer for 6 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 36 years old, is married and has 6 children.

Everlyne likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Everlyne plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Everlyne’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 9.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 54 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalina has been raising pigs for 19 years and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 52 years old and has six children. Ofelia is widow and has two children who are in school.

Ofelia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ofelia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Carol works very hard to provide for them.

Carol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Carol has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Carol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yunish

texts.en: A loan of 300 SSP helps Yunish to pay for food products, beans and others.

loans.use: To buy more food.

loans.name: Al Weam Group

texts.en:
Manal is the featured borrower for Al Weam Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Manal is a 34-year-old married mother of two children who started ten years ago working as a Tupperware saleswoman, and six years ago as a hairdresser. Two years ago, she started selling clothes to help her husband to cover the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Manal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her clothes business through buying a new collection of winter clothes for the upcoming Christmas to satisfy her customers' needs. This loan will help her increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Manal is the second lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Ehsan is the second lady on the right, Ramona is the first lady on the right, and Ghada is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothes for the upcoming Christmas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maria is 55 years old now.

Maria has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use.

Maria has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married and has two children,  one who attends school while the other is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Beatrice operates a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is married and has two children, one who attends school and one who is still young. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Faith operates a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase utensils, a sack of beans and maize. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, a sack of beans and maize.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a twenty-year-old single man living in Ajloun. He’s studying criminal science to get a bachelor degree, and he is in his second year. He chose this major to follow in his father's footsteps as he served in the public security department. 

Mohammad's dream is to become an investigator. He is requesting a loan that will help him pay for his next semester fees so he will to be able to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Farhan

texts.en:
Farhan is a twenty-year-old single man living in Salt. He is getting his bachelor degree in finance and banking. Farhan has three other siblings that his father looks after. One of his brothers also goes to the university to major in engineering.

Having two children in the university makes it harder on their father who started working in a governmental institution after retiring from the military. Farhan decided to apply for an educational loan to help him and his brother pay for their semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his and his brother's semester fees.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 30 years old. She is married and lives in the small village of Abasha district with her husband and two school-aged children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 50 nut trees and sell the harvested nuts seasonally. Julieta and her husband get orders to pick harvest in the greenhouses and they are paid daily. 

Julieta wants to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,200 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a cow and will start producing dairy products. This will give her a chance to generate a stable income and improve the living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 25-year-old married mother of two children. She is acquiring this loan to pay her child's school tuition fees. 

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. 

Hiba hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Godson

texts.en:
Godson is male, married with six children, living in Kasese Uganda. Godson is a farmer growing crops such as maize, rice, cassava and others to sell and earn a living. Godson has been in commercial farming since 2003.

Godson used the previous loan to buy fertilizers for his farm and out of farming he has managed to get a retail shop. He has a dream which is to educate his children. However, he is faced with a challenge of floods which destroy his crops. He wants a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, manure and pesticides to spray his crops and improve soil fertility .

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, manure and pesticides to spray his crops.

loans.name: Beverlina

texts.en:
Beverlina is a thirty-one year old woman living in Mayorga, Leyte. She raises and sells hogs to make a living. She has three kids ages 5, 3 and 1 month old respectively. She has been raising hogs for five years now. 

Aside from hog raising, she engages in a tuba (coconut) wine vending business.

She is currently facing a problem to finance both her businesses so they can go back to normal operations. 

Beverlina is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP  to buy a container and tungog (it gives tuba its maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation). This is very helpful especially in producing more gallons of tuba, that will eventually increase her earnings and pay for food for the whole family.

Beverlina is trying her best to make the future productive as possible for the welfare of her growing children and also provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a container and tungog.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is a forty-two-year-old man married with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a very hard-working man who devotes much of his energy and time to his business so as to get the best out of it. 

He started the business five years ago with a view of getting money to look after his family.

Yusufu needs the loan to buy general merchandise like soap, blue band, bread among others to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell in his shop like soap, blue band, bread.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a twenty-one-year-old single man living in Zarqa. He comes from a well-educated seven member family; Ashraf is studying Cooling & Air Conditioning Engineering in his fourth year. The family is depending on his brother's salary and his mother's retirement salary. 

Today Ashraf is applying for a loan to help him pay for his upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Alinane Group

texts.en:
Dollica is 33 years old with 4 children and is a widow. She is wearing yellow in the picture. She supports her children by operating a saloon and she also sells wrappers in the market nearby. 

She has been doing her business since previous years and she is requesting this loan to purchase more wrappers (local cloth for skirts), mesh and chemicals for her saloon to satisfy her customer's needs. With the knowledge she gained in business management from MLFs training she believes that her business will be sustainable. 

Dollica plans to diversify her business with a grocery shop when she makes enough profits. As a woman, she is able to feed her family three meals a day and she is self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fish, crabs, shrimp, lonja, shells, etc.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, tiene hijos menores, vive en casa propia junto a su familia, el caserio cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz. Se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú. Isidro es natural de la zona. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado menor y a la agricultura.

La actividad que desarrolla Isidro es la crianza y comercializacion de ganado menor(patyos, cuyes, conejos, entre otros) y a la agricultura; su esposa se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora en su casa. El destino del crédito es para la compra de una moto lineal para su uso y para su negocio esto le permitira ampliar su linea de trabajo. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isidro is 41 years old, married, has minor children, and lives in his own house with his family; the village has water and electricity services. It is found in the district of La Matanza, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú. Isidro is a native of the zone. The community is small and the residents work raising small animals and in agriculture. 

The work that Isidro does is raising and selling small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, rabbits, among others) and in agriculture. His wife works selling beer and chicha de jora (maize beer) from their house. The loan is destined for the purchase of a motorcycle for his use and also for his business. This will allow him to expand his line of work. This will permit him in the short-term to improve his income, increase his earnings, and in the end improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his sue and for his business, this will allow him to expand his line of work.

loans.name: Wilison

texts.en:
Wilson, who is in his late 20s, is single.  

He has been running a genge duka (a retail shop with fruits and vegetables) for eight years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Wilson's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to open the shop and to restock the out-of-stock items. He is doing great. He used the profit to take care of himself and covered household expenses.  

He will use this loan to increase the genge duka stock. He dreams of owning a hardware store.

Wilson will make sure he pays the loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase the genge duka stock.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 24 years old, married, and charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child. 

He operates a retail shop mainly selling cooking oil, salt, sodas, and sugar among other items. This is supplemented by income from riding a motorcycle for transport.

He desires to develop and make more profits from his business although he faces a difficulty of bad roads leading to constant motorcycle repairs, which is costly to him. 

He will use the loan to buy more soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy more soap for selling.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 24-year-old married father of four children. He started working four years ago in a grocery shop to cover the needs and expenses of his family, in addition to his ill sister, for he is the sole earner of his family.

Today, Hussein is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to cover his sister's necessary surgery, for his income is not enough anymore to cover the increasing living costs. This loan is very important to Hussein for it will cure his beloved sister and end her pain.

Hussein is a hard worker and an ambitious man who hopes to open his own bakery in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to cover his sister's necessary surgery.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 43 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa familiar junto a su hermana, en el caserío Pedregal. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que no en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales,comercio de arroz, comercio de ganado vacuno etc. Dicho caserío esta ubicado en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Julio Cesar es brindar el servicio de trasnporte urbano en su mototaxi, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 3 años en sus caseríos y alrededores. El destino del crédito será para realizar la compra de plátano para luego comercializarlo. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto es muy comercial en la zona. Julio Cesar piensa trabajar otorgando buen servicio, buen producto, que le permitan a un mediano plazo incrementar sus ventas y generar ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 43 years old, his legal status is single, he has 2 children, and lives in the family home with his sister, in the village of Pedregal. Life in the district is peaceful since in regards to business or other work that the people do, they work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and raising animal, selling rice, selling cattle, etc. This village is located in Buenos Aires district, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

The work that Julio Cesar does is offering urban transportation in his motorcycle taxi. He has done this work for over 3 years in his village and the neighboring ones. The loan will be used to purchase bananas to later sell them. The market offers good perspectives due to the fact that the products is very commercial in the zone. Julio Cesar plans to work offering good service, good products, which will allow him in the medium-term to increase his sales in increase his income to get a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to later sell them.

loans.name: Metrine's Group

texts.en:
Metrine is 25 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Metrine is representing her group of 14 farmers in the Matete District in Kenya, and she is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Metrine's desire to have access to the best seed prices. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy more land to cultivate.

Metrine and her group will receive a total of six solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of nine acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Shafi

texts.en:
Shafi is married and has two children. His son is studying at second course of college and his daughter goes to 11th class. Sahfi’s wife is a housewife. 

Always Shafi is proud of his children that they learn well since Shafi has not been educated. His family has been IDP (internally displacted persons) from Füzuli city already 22 years, and now they live in the Füzuli region. 

This is Shafi's second loan. He repaid the first loan on time. 

Shafi has cows. He has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years and breeds cattle. Today he needs a loan of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this loan he wants to buy more hay for winter. 

Shafi is thankful for the help from the Kiva organization and lenders.
