loans.use: to buy hay and increase business so he can continue to support his children's education.

loans.name: Laidia  Bartola

texts.es:
Laidia es una señora de 40 años,  vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima cálido húmedo, un sector muy comercial ya que es la unión entre la sierra y la costa. Laidia  vive en casa de sus padres, aún no está casada ni tiene hijos.
Laidia actualmente trabaja como secretaria de una asambleísta, pero su sueño es ponerse su propio negocio; quiere ponerse un local de terapias de masajes; por ello acudió a la Fundación donde escuchó que podían dar créditos a las personas con sueños de crecer como microempresarios, fue favorecida con un crédito,  el mismo que lo invertirá en su negocio, va a comprar una camilla de masajes terapéuticos; está muy feliz ya que asi no dependerá únicamente de su trabajo y podrá ayudar a personas que necesiten un masaje para su salud.
texts.en:
Laidia is a 40-year-old woman, who lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city of the coastal region, with a warm, humid climate, a very commercial area since it is at the junction between the mountains and the coast. Laidia lives in her parents' home. She is not yet married, nor has children.

Laidia currently works as a secretary in an Assembly, but her dream is to establish her own business. She wants to open a therapeutic massage service, for which she approached the Fundación where she heard that they could give loans to people whose dreams are to grow as micro-entrepreneurs.  She 
was fortunate to get a loan, which she will invest in her business. She will purchase a bed for therapeutic massages. She is very happy since in this way she won't only depend on her job and she will be able to help the people who need a massage for their health.

loans.use: to undertake her business of therapeutic massages and achieve her dream of growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos varones de 15, 12 y 4 años, y una hija mujer de 2 años, y su negocio es la confección de tejidos artesanales hechos a mano.
Ella es independiente, buena madre, constante, responsable, activa y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la feria de la zona ‘16 de julio’, caracterizada por el comercio informal donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía entre los 2-18 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Yolanda es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica al transporte y le ayuda con los tejidos, sus hijos mayores estudian en la escuela y también ayudan en el negocio, los hijos menores se encuentran a su cuidado. la familia vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos de forma artesanal (a mano), para luego comercializarlas los días jueves y domingos en la feria ’16 de julio’ y los días lunes en la feria de ‘Senkata’. Su prendas más solicitadas son; chompas cuello alto, chalecos, bufandas, guantes, gorros y otros. “Aquí hace mucho frío y mis prendas se venden todo el año, por eso tengo un negocio rentable y constante…” comenta. su sueño es tener un taller de confección de tejidos para ampliar su mercado y desea realizar la compra de una máquina de tejer para producir en mayor cantidad. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yolanda solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer industrial para producir en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda has dark skin, long black braided hair, and is short statured. She wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl, and gathered skirt). Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her husband who makes a living in transportation, and helps her with the fabrics. Her older children are in school and also help with the business. Her younger children are in her care. The family lives in their own home made of brick, which has potable water, electricity, and gas. 

Her business is the production of handmade artisanal fabrics, which she later markets on Thursdays and Sundays in the “16 de julio” market, and on Mondays in the “Senkata” market. Her most sought out garments are: turtleneck sweaters, vests, scarves, gloves, hats, and others. She comments, “Here it is very cold, and my garments sell year round. For this reason, I have a profitable and constant business.”

Her dream is to have a workshop for fabric production, to increase her merchandise. She wishes to buy a weaving machine to produce in greater quantities. This is the first sequence of loans that she requests from the institution in the 3 years that she has been in this occupation. 

It is for these reasons that Yolanda is requesting a loan to buy an industrial weaving machine to produce in greater quantities.

loans.use: to buy an industrial weaving machine to produce in greater quantities.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền is 23 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. Hiền has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Hiền hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mbula

texts.en:
Mbula is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has electricity but no piped water. 

For over five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Mbula dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Mai operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. Mai has been involved in this business for five years.

This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Mai faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Mai hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of two children, who both attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Mwanaisha has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. 

Mwanaisha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting of loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings. With this loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. 

She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION - ANTA”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Anta en la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; la socia continua dedicándose a la  compra y venta de granos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz, habas entre otros.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta" communal bank, which is located the Anta district of Cusco, Peru.

Fellicitas continues her work of buying and selling grains.  She has had her business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn and beans, among other things.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans, among others.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a thirty-four-year-old married woman. She has opened a small mini-market inside her house to help her husband in having another source of income for the family, as her husband works as a farmer, and it is somehow a seasonal job. 

She is hoping to get the loan to add selling some basic food items, like rice, sugar, food cans, and other items.

loans.use: to add selling some basic food items, like rice, sugar, and food cans

loans.name: Adelaide's Group

texts.en:
Adelaide's group comprises 13 farmers in Kenya's Matete District. It is being represented by the group leader, Adelaide, who is pictured above. 

Adelaide is 45 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for five years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Adelaide isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Adelaide will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

With this loan, Adelaide's group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize, and a solar light.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia Irma continua con su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio l cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia vende arroz, azúcar entre otros.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.   
  La socia Irma pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Irma continues with her business of selling basic household products.

She's had this business for a while, and it is going well thanks to the efforts she puts into the work every day. She would like to continue with the same so that she can support her family.

She sells rice and sugar, among other products, and she is requesting the loan to buy these.

Irma is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta" community bank in the province of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other products.

loans.name: Linet's Group

texts.en:
Linet is 51 years old and has 10 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of nine farmers from the Matete District of Kenya. 

Linet has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she has described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Linet has also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about. The solar light will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Linet's group will receive a total of six solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Santos Isidora

texts.es:
Santos Isidora tiene 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conviviente y sus 2 hijos uno menor de edad de 12 años que cursa el nivel primario y uno mayor de edad de 18 años que se encuentra cursando estudios superiores. Santos Isidora vive en una zona rural, contando con servicios de agua y luz en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Santos Isidora es la cría de animales menores8patos, cuyes, conejos, entre otros) con una antigüedad de 3 años, el cual le genera ingresos para su subsistencia. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra una cantidad mayor de animales menores (pavos, conejos, pollo, etc.) para su cría y posterior comercialización, lo que le va a permitir diversificar y aumentar su stock de animales para poder satisfacer las diversas necesidades y preferencias de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios y buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos Isidora, age 39, lives in her own house made from basic material.  She lives with her life partner and their two children.  One of them is 12 years old and goes to elementary school.  The oldest is 18 years old and is enrolled in higher education studies.  Santos Isidora lives in a rural area in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.  She has water service and electricity.  Her community works basically in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.

Santos Isidora’s business activity is raising small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, and rabbits, among others).  She has been doing this for three years, and through her business she generates income for her subsistence.

She will use the loan to buy more small animals (ducks, rabbits, chickens, etc.) to raise and later sell.  This will allow her to diversify and increase her stock of animals.  This way she will be able to meet the diverse needs and preferences of her customers.  

This will allow her, in the short term, to improve her income and increase her profits.  Then, she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.  There is not much competition in this type of business in the area.  With her business she gets the best prices and good profits.

loans.use: to buy small animals like ducks, rabbits, and chickens, etc.

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Salome, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children: a boy and a girl who are both still in school. She has been selling maize grains at the milling machines. She works from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Salome's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to sell small items door to door, but now she is selling maize at wholesale prices. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase maize grain stock and meet her customer's demand. She dreams of growing her business.

Salome will share this loan with her loan group Hakika, which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase maize grain stock and meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She is positive that her sales will significantly increase this Christmas holiday. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Edna dreams of having a big grocery store and aims to give her children the best education in order for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
This is Noralyn, 49, a resident of Coron, Palawa, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a fisherman and a mother to her six children.Together with her husband, she manages their own household.  She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household expenses and school needs of her children.

Noralyn makes and sells native delicacies like rice cakes. These are commonly eaten for snacks and also for desserts. She sells them per order and and expects an increased demand this Christmas season. She also sells dried fish on the side. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue with her  business, she would like to apply for a 43,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy the raw ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar, and coconut milk. She is positive of a good result for her business and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Noralyn aims to grow and expand her business. She wants a happy and united family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sticky rice, sugar, coconut and other ingredients needed for her food business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy, 43, is married with four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been in the phone and salon business since 1997. He is very hardworking and loves his work. 

Jimmy has managed to earn enough money from his business to pay school fees for his children and to start constructing a permanent house. He is very grateful to Kiva for his previous loan, which helped him buy power inverters and batteries to use in his business when the power is off. 

Jimmy is requesting a loan to buy plastering materials, like cement, to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy plastering materials, like cement, to finish his house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul has been a farmer for over 10 years. He has done this so that he could to sustain his family. He wants a loan to buy land for expanding his onion farm. His future hope is to build a permanent house if all goes well. His food crops are affected by hailstones, strong winds and unexpected downpours due to changes in weather. He used a previous loan to buy a plot of land for building a home in the future.

loans.use: to buy land for expanding his onion farm.

loans.name: Club De Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLUB DE AMIGAS” iniciará el vigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de enaguas, venta de ropa para cachorros, venta de cosméticos, venta de frazadas, venta de artesanías, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de bicicletas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace trece años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, al aprender la técnica de tejido decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group Club de Amigas (Club of Friends) will begin their twenty fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. The group is comprised of 8 members and run by a board of directors of which Lourdes is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are various and include: selling petticoats, selling clothes for kids, selling cosmetics selling blankets, selling craft work, selling food, a grocery store, and selling bicycles. 
The loan that they are requesting will benefit the micr-enterpreneurs including Lourdes. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 3 years and joined as a result of a massive promotion that the institution carried out in her area. Currently, she has a knitting store and sells sweaters. She lets us know that she started this business some years ago, when she learned to knit she decided to start her own business. 
The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her business capital (to buy wool wholesale). She buys from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then makes and sells her sweaters in her store. This form of work enables her to generate income to support her family economically - she is married and has 2 children. 
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio  is a fisherman living in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. He is a sixty-five-year-old married man with a fifteen-year-old child. He catches fish and sells them in the nearby community. He has been fishing for more than 20 years now.
 
Antonio has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy materials for boat renovation like plywood, nails, epoxy (adhesive) and fishing materials like a fish cage. Antonio will now reconstruct his boat and  in the coming months, this will help improve his catch and probably increase his earnings.

In the future, Antonio is hoping that he can try his best to manage his current business for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy materials for boat renovation like plywood, nails, epoxy (adhesive) and fishing materials like a fish cage

loans.name: Melissa Sibonney

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Melissa, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 1  hijo de 8 meses  de edad. Su marido es mecánico.
Doña Melissa es una joven que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y la crianza de su pequeño hijo,  ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a realizar sus recorridos tres o cuatro días por semana en las horas que sabe que puede encontrar a sus clientes ya sea en la mañana o en la noche, deja a crédito esta mercadería y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva más de 2 años dedicada esta actividad la cual les sirve de mucho para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y blusas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia pues vive con los suegros.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton the Trabajando Juntas credit group meets every two weeks. The place is known for the delicious sweets the residents make, which are known throughout the country.
  
This is where Melissa lives. She is 21 years old and in a common law marriage. From this relationship she has an 8 month old son. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Melissa is a young woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses and the expenses for raising their young son. She works as a merchant, selling clothes via catalog. She sells door to door and goes out three or four days a week at times when she  knows she can find her customers, be it morning or night. She sells this merchandise on credit and collects every week or two weeks. She has been doing this activity for 2 years and it has really helped her and her family get ahead. 

This loan is to buy pants, shirts and blouses. She has been in the credit group for 4 years and she likes it because with the loans she gets ahead. Her dreams are to have her own house, because she lives with her parents in law.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Avegale

texts.en:
Avegale is 35 years old and has three children.  She is married and her three children are in school.

Avegale is in the agricultural business raising cows in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional cow to raise.

Avegale has been raising cows for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Avegale would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow to raise

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
His bright beadwork contrasts dramatically with the bleak, flat plain surrounding Edwin. He strings a new bracelet, sitting outside before the morning sun intensifies. It is a rare moment of leisure around the village of Kachibora, but even at rest Edwins's mind is burdened with the hardships of life in the Kitale area of Kenya.

Edwin is a mixed small-scale farmer and has been practicing agribusiness for the past nine years and has never looked back. For a living, Edwin sells milk and food products from his farm into the local market. He makes extra money with a small personal business. He enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of his products, and he really feels satisfied.

Although Edwin has been making profits through farming, he has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge he has encountered is a lack of funds to get his business off the ground. Edwin is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kitale and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Edwin does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people, and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint.

With this loan, Edwin is confident that his income will increase, and this will allow a permanent change in his life. He plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. He also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on his farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Edwin will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for his farm. Through this loan, he will assure his large family of a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy quality breeds of poultry.

loans.name: María Piedad

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña María con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace 7 años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el grupo. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The loan group Trabajando Juntas (Working Together) meets every 2 weeks in the town of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets that the local people make and that are known throughout the country.
María lives here. She is 58 years old, married, and has 3 grown-up, independent children from this marriage. Her husband is retired. 
With the goal of having her own income, María sells products from the Avon and Yanbal catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works 3 days a week, mostly in the morning as it's easiest for her to complete her route at this time. She sells door to door and customers pay monthly. She loves selling and she has come to realize this after 7 years in which she has done very well as she has plentiful customers. What she sells most of are the cosmetics and perfumes. 
She will use this loan to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products. She has been in the loan group since its beginning and she likes it because the group offers help. Her dream is to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Yessica Carolina

texts.es: Yessica cuenta con 20 años de edad y es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo platillos típicos todos los días frente a su vivienda, actividad que le ha permitido apoyar a sus padres con la economía de su hogar. Ella es soltera y habita en vivienda propia al lado de su padre, su madre y sus 2 hermanos. Yessica se siente feliz de poder contar con su negocio de venta de platillos típicos, por la zona en la que se encuentra tiene una buena cantidad de clientes, es por ello que desea adquirir un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papas, maíz, carne, verduras y frutas para elaborar refrescos y obtener así mejores ingresos y lograr cubrir la demanda de productos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Yessica is 20 years old. She is young entrepreneur who earns a living selling traditional dishes every day in front of her house. This activity has allowed her to help her parents with the household finances. She is single and lives in her own home with her father. mother and 2 children. Yessica is happy to have her business selling traditional dishes. In the area where she is there is a good number of customers. That is why she wants to acquire a FUSAI loan to invest in: potatoes, corn. meat, vegetables and fruit to make beverages and obtain better income and be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to invest in potatoes, corn, meat, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: Javier es un hombre de 31 años de edad que viendo la necesidad  en su hogar de tener ingresos económicos decidió instalar una tienda de productos varios, apoyado con sus ganancias del trabajo de pescador, oficio que sigue practicando, para mantener la estabilidad económica de su hogar. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos 3 varones de 3, 12 y 14 años de edad y una niña de 10 años de edad. Javier desea invertir en su negocio ya que ha observado que cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, jabón, detergente, azúcar, leche, frijoles, arroz, café, etc.
texts.en:
Javier is a 31 year old man who saw the need to have additional income for his household so he decided to start up a corner store business which sells varied products.  He installed this with earnings he won from his job as a fisherman, a profession which he still practices to ensure financial stability in his home.  

He lives in a house he owns with his life partner and his 4 kids; 3 boys of 3, 12 and 14 years old and one girl of 10.  Javier wants to invest in his business as he has noticed that each day there are more clients interested in buying his products.  This is why he has decided to request a loan to FUSAI to invest in candy, soap, detergent, sugar, milk, beans, rice, coffee, etc.

loans.use: to invest in candy, soap, detergent, sugar, milk, beans, rice, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Y Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
Las 19  integrantes de este grupo cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas ponen su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante, ayudando a sus familias por medio de ese esfuerzo.
Rosalia es parte de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y humilde, quien comenta que se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, y pese a que es un trabajo un poco difícil, lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Rosalia es una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma luchar por sus seres queridos como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The 19 members of this group run various businesses. Each one of them gives her all to be able to grow and be successful, helping their families through their efforts. 
Rosalia is a member of this group. She is a hardworking and humble woman who says that she sells natural remedies and, although it is rather difficult work, she does it to help her family and loved ones. Rosalia is a woman who fights and sacrifices herself for her goals. 
She is requesting this loan to buy natural remedies in bulk so that she can continue to work as she has been. In this way, she can work for her loved ones as she has come to do.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Bruno Emilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.
El socio  Bruno continua dedicándose a  ejercer la docencia en uno de los colegios de la zona, el socio lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar vivieres para su hogar.
El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the community bank Virgen Inmaculada Concepción (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception). He lives in the district of Anta in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.
Bruno continues to teach in one of the schools in the area. He enjoys his work and does well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. He wants to be able to keep working this way so he can keep supporting his family. 
He is requesting a loan to buy provisions for his home.
The member appreciates and values the support offered by this loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy provisions for his home.

loans.name: Didace

texts.en: Didace, aged 30, is married with three children, aged between 2 and 9 years. Two of them go to school.  He sells shoes and has been doing this as a business for six years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and for his family's welfare.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 45-year-old woman. She is married with seven children. She used the previous loan to buy manure for her farm.

She lives in her own house located in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer and has been farming for ten years. This has enabled her to buy more land. However, she is constrained by the current climate change with uncertain seasons, especially the dry seasons leading to low yields. Her family dream is to increase income levels for her household, and her business dream is to become the leading farmer in the area.

For this ambition to become a reality, she needs a loan to help her buy more manure to boost the fertility of the soil so as to have increased production.

loans.use: to buy more manure for her farm.

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is a forty-two-year-old married woman living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She is married and has three children, all going to school. She is a cocoa farmer and has a cocoa plantation. She also buys and sells cocoa to supplement what she has harvested. She hopes to expand her business of buying and selling cocoa and she is very committed to her business. She is affected by seasonality.

Vick wants the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man with three kids, all of whom attend school. He lives at  a rental house that  has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Evans operates a grocery vegetable-selling stall, and he sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding the business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Farukh Nabi

texts.en: Farukh, aged 33, married and father of a daughter, runs a general store in Wazirabad. He is a hard-working and honest person. He is keen to educate his daughter and wants to give her the best. In order to boost sales and improve his business he wants to buy additional stock of different sorts to sell at his department store. Due to insufficient funds he chose to go for a loan from BRAC Pakistan after agreeing the terms and conditions. He is pleased and hopeful that this source of investment will help him achieve his business target.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his store.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya is a twenty-one-year-old single lady living in Jabal Al Hussein. She is studying to get her bachelor's degree in Hotel Management. She is now in her fourth year. Aya lives with her seven-member family. Her father and sister’s salaries are their only source of income. Rising tuition costs and being in a big family make it harder for her father to afford her university fees. This led Aya to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees and the purchase of school supplies.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fee and the purchase of school supplies.

loans.name: Ghazwa

texts.en:
Ghazwa is a 42-year-old married mother of three children who started a year ago selling cosmetics from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Ghazwa is a hard worker who sacrifices a lot to provide her children with better living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's university tuition fees, as she wants to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and make-up to satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's university tuition fees and buy cosmetics and make-up for resale

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 23-year-old single lady who has worked for two years in a clothing shop to cover her needs and expenses, especially the educational ones. She is a hard worker, independent, and ambitious. She is trying hard to succeed in her work and education at the same time, but due to the increasing living costs, her salary is not enough anymore. Thus, she is obtaining a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university's tuition fees.

Zainab hopes to open her own clothes shop to increase her income and save some profit for her future.

loans.use: to pay her university's tuition fees.

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila is married. She lives in Füzuli region with her family. They are IDP (internally displaced persons) from native land Füzuli city for 22 years. She has two lovely children. She has a few cows. Tamila prepares dairy products (cheese, yogurt, milk, etc.) to sell in the local bazaar and to her neighbors to earn money. Today she needs 2,350 AZN because the stall of her cows is in danger of falling. She wants to repair her stall.

She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for help. She wants to buy a few cows and to increase her business in the future so her monthly income will increase and she can help her children to have a good education in the future.

loans.use: to repair a stall, increase business, and help her children to have a good education in the future.

loans.name: Gracilla

texts.en:
Gracilla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities like  pouch vinegar, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, eggs, coffee and canned goods. She is married with six children. The oldest is 17 and the youngest is 1 year old. Gracilla lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. She has been operating a store for 10 years now. Her husband's occupation is farming.

Gracilla is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for the store and to purchase pig for the start-up of hog raising. This is very essential in helping Gracilla operate her store, and hopefully she can raise and sell more pigs in the future. Augmenting her income will help to pay for school fees and provide healthy diets to the whole family.

Gracilla dreams of expanding her business to be successful and to continue supporting the education of her children as well.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store and to purchase a pig for the start-up of hog raising.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Fifty-four year old Bernardita is a merchant, operating a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various merchandise like sugar, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. She is a mother of three children. Her youngest child is 19. Together with her family, she lives in Mcarthur, Leyte.  It has been 20 years now that she has been operating her store. Aside from that, she also engages in a food selling business, as an additional source of income.

Due to a lack of capital to finance her current livelihood, Bernardita has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for the store like canned goods, beverages, toiletries and seasoning. She can now display a variety of stock, attracts more consumers to buy and hopefully increase her earnings.

In the coming future, Bernardita hopes to handle her current business successfully and also continue to finance the schooling of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store like canned goods, beverages, toiletries and seasoning.

loans.name: Mónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Mónica, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 2  hijos de 4 y 2 años  de edad, el mayor esta en jardín de infantes. Su marido es técnico en refrigeración.
Doña Mónica es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene un taller en el cual arregla todo tipo de artefactos eléctricos, son muchas las personas que lo buscan para que les arregle refrigeradoras, lavadoras o que les instale y de mantenimientos en aires acondicionados, trabaja para  particulares y también les brinda mantenimiento a varias instituciones de la localidad, el lleva más de 15 años con esta actividad y gracias a Dios casi nunca le falta trabajo ya que es muy bueno en lo que hace.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar herramientas y ciertos repuestos que el utiliza para realizar su labor. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede sentirse útil y ayudar a su marido a salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan grop Trabajando Juntas (Working Together) meets every 2 weeks in the village of Rocafuerte. This place is know for the delicious sweets that the local people make and that are known throughout the country.
Mónica lives here. She is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children with him who are 4 and 2 years old. The eldest is in kindergarten. Her partner is a refrigeration technician. 
Mónica is a very good wife who, in order to help her husband, is requesting a loan that he will use in his business. He has a workshop where he fixes all types of electrical goods. Many people seek him out as he fixes refrigerators and washing machines and installs them. He also does maintenance on air conditioners. He works for individuals and also does maintenance for various institutions in the area. He has been doing this for more than 15 years and, thanks to God, has almost never been without work as he is very good at what he does. 
He will use this loan to buy tools and certain spare parts that he uses in his work. Mónica has been in the loan group since it began and she likes it because the loans help her to feel useful and help her husband to be successful. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen foods and soft drinks vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional cases of soft drinks and packs of frozen foods to sell for her business.

Roselie has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from selling ready-to-wear.

Roselie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cases of soft drinks and packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 28 years old. He is not married. He has a supermarket and has been in business for two years.

With the loan, he would like to buy more juice, water, and bread to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more juice, water, and bread to resell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosita is 61 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosita has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Rosita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Freedom Group

texts.en:
Group Freedom is composed of three married women. They are on average 33 years old with two children. They live in nuclear families, in the city of Teshie neighborhood.

They met through neighborly, friendship and trade relations. To increase their financial capacity and develop their business, they joined micro-finance institution ID-Ghana. This is their fourth loan. The previous three loans have been repaid without issues.

This group trades in plate tables, plates, cutlery sets and cosmetics. With her loan, Charllotte is planning on purchasing plates, tables and mats from the wholesalers in Accra. She sells from door-to-door to mixed-gender clients. She takes cash and offers payment facilities.

She is forecasting making good monthly profit which will be reinvested in the business once the loan is repaid.

loans.use: to purchase plates, tables and mats from the wholesalers in Accra.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en: Felicite is 44 years old. She is married with four children aged between 16 and 22 years. She sells clothes and has been in business for two years. With this loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is 46 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 8 years. Two of them go to school. He sells clothes and has been doing this business for 7 years. With the loan, he would like to buy trousers and shirts to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy land and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy trousers and shirts to resell.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 31 years old. She is married with five children aged between 10 months and 11 years; three of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more flasks, cups and plates for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more flasks, cups and plates for sale.

loans.name: M.arshad

texts.en: M.arshad is an enthusiastic entrepreneur running a wholesale business in Sialkot. He is hardworking and dedicated to his work. He deals in food items, specifically snacks and candies, etc. In order to extend his outreach and increase his customer base, he wants to invest more in his business and buy additional stock. He hopes that this investment will be beneficial for his business. He has therefore requested a loan as he is short of funds. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snacks, candies and sweets to distribute to retailers.

loans.name: M.shakeel

texts.en: M.shakeel runs a shoe store in his community. He is 40 years old and married and the father of three. He started this business at a very young age. He has gained good experience and made a good customer base. He wants to offer more variety to his customers and also wants to improve his business. He is currently short of funds due to increasing household expenses. Therefore he is seeking a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help him in this. He is hopeful that this investment will be fruitful and he is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more variety of shoes for his shoe store.

loans.name: Mohammad Ashfaq

texts.en:
Mohammed Ashfaq, 55, is a father of four children. He runs a shoe store in his community. He is hardworking and disciplined. He wants to give his children higher education. He has been running this business for the past 25 years. He has established himself well in the market and is happy with the progress of his business. In order to make his business more lucrative, he wants to buy more variety of shoes for his store. He has therefore requested a loan as he is short of cash.

He is hopeful that this investment will be fruitful and he wants to become more successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more variety of shoes to sell at his shoe store.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité Primavera está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comités de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas mantienen una actividad propia emprendida por ellas mismas, trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, y quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo.
Dilce es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es peluquera, una mujer muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza y que todos los días trabaja arduamente en su negocio, atendiendo a todos los clientes. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, tijeras, shampoo, enjuagues, peines y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su servicio a sus clientes. Dilce esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The comunal bank Primavera is in its first loan cycle of the communal bank’s program for women entrepreneurs, where everyone has their own business started by themselves. They work and help each other in order to get ahead, and want to help their families through their work. 

Dilce is one of the members of this group. She is a hair stylist and a hardworking woman who makes an effort everyday by working hard at her business and serving to all of her customers.  She is an enterprising person who wants to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy several supplies for her salon, like hair dye products, creams, scissors, shampoo, rinse, combs and others that will help her to keep giving her customers a good service. Dilce is thankful for the opportunity that she is getting and that will be of great help for her.

loans.use: to buy hair dye products, creams, scissors, shampoo, rinse, combs and others.

loans.name: Deisy Aracely

texts.es: Deysi es una mujer emprendedora que a sus 37 años de vida se gana la vida vendiendo gran variedad de productos de belleza y joyería de enchape. Ella habita al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar seguro donde vivir. Deysi sabe que en su vivienda los gastos son muchos, por lo que también se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir en una empresa cercana, ella es una mujer emprendedora que desea invertir en su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: joyería de enchape y productos de belleza para obtener mejores ingresos y darle así una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Deysi is an entrepreneurial woman who at 37 earns a living selling a wide variety of beauty products and laminate jewelry. She has lived with her husband and their 2 children in their own home for a long time. She is happy to have a safe place to live. Deysi knows that there are a lot of expenses in her  home so she earns a living making clothing in a nearby business. She is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to invest in her business. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in laminate jewelry and beauty products to make more income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in laminate jewelry and beauty products.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is running a sari-sari (variety) store selling various items ranging from noodles, soy sauce, sugar, canned goods, and tuba (coconut wine) to biscuits. She is a sixty-six-year-old married woman residing in Mcarthur, Leyte, a mother of two grown  children.  In addition to that, she engages in fishing. She sells fish.

Evangeline is asking for a loan in the amount of 40,000 PHP to buy additional stock for the store and fishing materials like a fish cage. In the coming months, Evangeline hopes to experience a huge volume of catch and display a variety of stock in her store, thus attracting more buyers, and this will improve her income.

She could then afford to buy healthy food which is essential in her day-to-day activity.

In the future, Evangeline is hoping that she can manage both her businesses successfully.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store and fishing materials like a fish cage

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been involved in a vegetable-selling business for many years with the help of her husband. Her business provides her enough income to meet day-to-day expenses. She is famous for providing fresh vegetables in her area.

She is the mother of four children and trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities including food, health, clothing and education. For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy sacks of more vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, onions, etc. to meet market demand consistently and earn more revenue.

loans.use: to buy sacks of more vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, onions, etc. to meet market demand consistently and earn more revenue.

loans.name: José Fredy

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive don  José, tiene 50 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 8  hijos, siete mayores de edad y el menor de 17 años el cual estudia en colegio, 6 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su  mujer es ama de casa.
El señor José es un hombre muy responsable que le ha tocado trabajar toda la vida para darles lo mejor a su familia, el tiene un local en su casa donde vende plátano, maduro, agua en botellas, colas, golosinas y ají preparado, esto último es algo que aprendió de su padre y es muy tradicional en su ciudad, consiste en curtir el ají en botellas con otros ingredientes que les da un sabor delicioso y es de mucho agrado de sus clientes, todas las mañanas el compra el mejor plátano  a agricultores de la zona que le llevan a su casa. Lleva más de 20 años con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar plátano, aguas y ají. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios para su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Trabajando Juntas" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known throughout the country for it's delicious sweets that the locals make.

José lives here. He is in a common-law relationship and from this relationship has 8 children. Seven of them are adults and the youngest 17 years old studies at school. Six of them still live at home. His wife is a housewife.

José is a very responsible man who has had to work all his life to provide the best for his family. He has a store in his house where he sells plantains, bananas, water in bottles, soft drinks, sweets and prepared chilies. The last item is something he learned from his father and is very traditional in his city. It consists of putting the chili in bottles along with other ingredients, which gives them a delicious taste that is appreciated by his clients.

Every morning he buys the best bananas from local farmers that bring them to his house. He has been doing this business for more than 20 years and it has allowed him to get ahead. This loan will be used to buy bananas, water and chili. He has been a member of the communal bank since it's inception and he likes it as the loans are very necessary for his business. His dream is to continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy bananas, water and chile.

loans.name: Lady Virginia

texts.es:
En el sitio El Limón de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De  Crédito El Limón.
En este lugar vive la señora Lady, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 6 años  que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro en construcción.
Doña Lady es una mujer que le gusta sentirse independiente y ganar sus propios ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y  su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres veces por semana unas tres horas por día pero también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva, la mayor parte de su mercadería siempre es para entregar ya que los clientes cuando sabe que va a viajar le encargan a su gusto. Tiene más de 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. 
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, blusas, pantalones entre otras prendas que ella vende. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
In the area of El Limón, in the parish of Colon of the city Portoviejo, the El Limón credit group meets every two weeks. It is a place known for its hardworking people who work in farming and ranching.  

This is where Lady lives. She is 27 years old and in a common law marriage. From this relationship she has two children, aged 9 and 6. They are in school. Her husband is a master builder. 

Lady is a woman who likes to feel independent and earn her own income to help with the household expenses. She works as a merchant, selling all types of clothing door to door. She goes out three times a week three hours a day but she also sells from her house where her customers go when she has new merchandise. Most of her merchandise is for delivery because when her customers know she is going to travel they order what they want from her. She has been doing this activity for 9 years and it has gone very well for her.
 
This loan is to buy t-shirts, blouses, and pants, among other items of clothing that she sells. She has been in the credit group for 7 years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to continue ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants and other clothing.

loans.name: Fanny María

texts.es:
En el sitio El Limón de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De  Crédito El Limón.
En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 48 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Fanny es una mujer que le gusta ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo,  zapatillas de catalogo y bisuterías, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos o tres días por semana dependiendo de sus clientes, también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos cuando necesitan algo de lo que ella vende, deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual comenzó con el primer crédito. 
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, blusas, zapatillas y bisutería. Lleva 12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
El Limón in the Colon parish in Portoviejo city is known for its hard-working people dedicated to farming and livestock. Every 15 days the members of the El Limon credit group meet. It is in this place that 48 year old Fanny lives. Fanny is married and has three grown children, two of whom still live with her. Her husband is a driver. Fanny is a woman who likes to earn her own income and with this income help her husband with the household expenses. She is a vendor who sells all kinds of clothing, shoes by catalog and costume jewelry. She sells door to door two to three days per week depending on her customers. She also sells from her home where long-time customers who need something visit her. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has had this business for 12 years and it began with her first loan.

This loan is to buy to buy t-shirts, blouses, shoes, and costume jewelry. She has been a member of this credit group for 12 years. She likes the group because the loans helped her start her business. Her dreams are to continue into the future with her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, shoes, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a cloth sales business for many years to meet the family expenses. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She is able to earn enough through her business.

Now she needs more cloth to meet customer demand regularly. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and fashionable designs to attract more customers. Sharifan is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and fashionable designs to attract more customers

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 34 years old and married with five children between the ages of 3 months and 13 years. Three of his children go to school. For the past 18 years, Fidele has sold clothing. 

Fidele is requesting a loan to buy trousers and shirts to sell. He will use the profits from his loan to reinvest in his business and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy trousers and shirts to sell

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. She describes herself as ambitious. 

Racheal operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, milk, flour, bread, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as low stock. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, milk, flour, and other items she sells. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to sustain her family. She will use the anticipated profits to set up another business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, milk, flour, and other items she sells

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico vive con su conviviente, no tiene hijos menores de edad en su poder. Maribel vive en una zona rural, contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Maribel es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros) con una antigüedad en el negocio de 3 años, así como también se dedica a la venta de animales menores (patos, pollos, etc.) con una antigüedad de 7 años ambos negocios le permiten solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos como bebidas gaseosas, y otros con ello podrá aumentar y diversificar su stock lo que le permitirá satisfacer las diversas necesidades y preferencias de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Maribel is 41 years old. She lives in her own house made of rustic materials with her partner. She has no dependent children. Maribel lives in a rural zone and has running water and electricity Her community works in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce. It is located in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru.

Maribel's business is selling primary food items (rice, sugar, oil, amongst others). she has been doing this for 3 years. She also has also been working selling small animals (ducks, chickens, etc.) for 7 years. The two businesses allow her to pay off the loan with no problem.

The loan will be used to invest in her business stocking it with new products like soft drinks and others. It will allow her to increase and diversify her stock to satisfy the diverse needs and preferences of her clients. In the short term that will allow her to improve her income and profits and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family. She has no competition in this field in her arear so she can get good prices.

loans.use: to invest in her business stocking it with new products like soft drinks and others so she can increase and diversify her stock.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Virginia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pails of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pails of fish to sell

loans.name: Viito

texts.en:
Viito lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hardworking married man with eight children of whom four attend school. 

Viito deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of maize, beans, and rice among other items. He supplements his income by farming. He hopes to expand and develop his business and also educate his children. 

Viito will use the loan facility to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Diane

texts.en: Diane is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 2 months and 7 years; 2 of them go to school. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for 1 year. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and other ingredients for making more food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and other ingredients for making more food to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Susan has been in this business for 12 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is 50-year-old woman who is a widow with two children. For many years, she has been stitching clothes and she provides tailoring services and facilities to the people of her community to meet the day-to-day expenses of her children. However, due to a lack of available funds, Rifat is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

Rifat is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons. Her loan will create a means of increasing her revenue. Rifat is hopeful that her loan will enable her to grow her business and attain her dream of providing a quality life for her children.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Silvia Mercedes

texts.es:
En el sitio El Limón de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De  Crédito El Limón.
En este lugar vive la señora Silvia, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada desde hace 33 años y  de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ellos viven dos nietos de 8 y 5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Silvia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia y para que a su nietos no les falte nada ya que ellos están a su cargo luego de la muerte del papá de los niños, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale los sábados y domingos casi todo el día a entregar las prendas y cobrare ya que ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que utiliza para los estudios de sus nietos. 
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, blusas, pantalones, entre otras prendas que ella vende. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayudan. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
El Limón in the Colon parish in Portoviejo city is known for its hard-working people dedicated to farming and livestock. Every 15 days the members of the El Limon credit group meet.

This is where 53 year old Silvia lives. She has been married for 33 years and has 4 grown independent children, and two grandchildren ages 8 and 5 who attend school. Her husband is a driver. Silvia is a very hard-working woman who enjoys working to help her family get ahead and so that her grandchildren have what they need as they are under her care after the death of the children's father. She is a vendor, selling all kinds of clothing door to door. She sells on Saturdays and Sundays almost all day long and delivers the items and collect as she leaves items on credit and collects every 8 days. She has had this business for more than 10 years and she uses the income to pay for her grandchildren's education.

This loan is to buy t-shirts, blouses, pants and other items to sell. She has been in the credit group for 5 years and she like it because the loans help a lot. Her dreams are to give the best she can to her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, pants and other items.

loans.name: Diega Josefina

texts.es:
En el sitio El Limón de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De  Crédito El Limón.
En este lugar vive la señora Diega, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ellos, una estudia en universidad. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Diega con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudarle a su marido se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogos y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los  días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta unas dos  horas por día, su hija también  le ayuda con sus ventas ya que ella vende en la universidad donde estudia, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace 10 años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y zapatos. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el grupo. Sus sueños es ver a sus hijos realizados.
texts.en:
El Limón in the Colon parish in Portoviejo city is known for its hard-working people dedicated to farming and livestock. Every 15 days the members of the El Limon Credit Group meet. This is where 52 year old Diega lives. She is married and has three grown children, two of whom still live with her, one is studying in the university. Her husband is a driver. Diega wanted to generate her own income and help her husband with the household expenses. She sells shoes by catalog and Avon products (beauty and cosmetic products, perfumes, and items for the home). She works every day door to door, selling a couple hours each day. Her daughter also helps with sales as she sells at the university where she is in school. Diega sells on credit and collects weekly. She enjoys selling and has had this business for 10 years and it has gone rather well for her and she has many customers. What she enjoys the most are the cosmetics and perfumes.

This loan is going to be used to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and shoes. She has been in the Credit Group for 10 years and she like the help the group provides. Her dreams are to see her children grow up to be successful adults.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and shoes.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saul vive en casa propia de material rustico, Saul vive con su cónyugue, cuenta con 3 hijo de 9, 5, 3 años de edad el cual el primero cursa primaria en colegio nacional, Saul tiene 10 años radicando en la zona, tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad. La misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Saul es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña ubicado en el caserio de El Huabo, con una experiencia en el rubro de 5 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha.
