De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Saul lives in his own house, made of rustic material. Saul lives with his spouse. He has three children, aged 9, 5, and three years old. The oldest is in public elementary school. Saul has been living in the area for 10 years. He has very good work and personal references in his community, which is in the district of Pucará, province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. His community is mostly dedicated to agriculture, ranching and commerce.  

Saul's activity is agriculture, specifically growing pineapples in the community of El Huabo. He has 5 years' experience in this type of work. The loan that will be made will be used in agricultural work, applications of plant protection products, fertilizer, and to pay for labor for the harvest. This will help the physiological, morphological, and productive improvement of his crop. It will also help him have a more timely crop and therefore a better yield and quality of products, therefore he won't have have any problems selling his crop.

loans.use: to do his agricultural work, paying for the application of plant protection products, fertilizers, and to pay for labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Diomedes Alesis

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive don Diomedes,  tiene 61 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de una hermana. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos han podido sacar adelante su negocio.
El señor Diomedes es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta ganarse la vida a punta de trabajo honesto, el trabaja en el municipio local pero también en sociedad con un familiar tienen un local en el centro de la ciudad, allí venden pañales, perfumes, papel higiénico y muchos otros productos, mientras el cumple con sus horas de trabajo su socia atiende el negocio, pero cuando el sale es él quien se encarga de administrarlo y mas los fines de semana que es cuando más venden, llevan más de 3 años en este negocio con el cual espera seguir después de su jubilación.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pañales, papel higiénico, perfumes y todo de lo que ellos venden en su local. Sus sueños seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Trabajando Juntas" communal bank meets every fortnight in Rocafuerte canton. This place is known throughout the country for the delicious sweets that the locals prepare.

Diomedes lives here. He is 61 years old, single and lives in the house of a sister. He has been in the communal bank for 5 loan cycles and he likes it as the loans allow him to get his business ahead.

Diomedes is a very hard-working man who likes to earn his living honestly. He works for the local municipality but together with a family member he has a store in the center of the city. He sells diapers, perfume, toilet paper and many other products. . While he carries out his work his partner takes care of the business. When he gets off of work he takes care of the administration and on the weekends is when most is sold.

He has been in this business for 3 years and he hopes to continue with it after he retires. He will use the loan to buy diapers, toilet paper, perfume and all that they sell in their store. His dream is to continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy diapers, toilet paper, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 57 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Julieta has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries (like canned goods, noodles, detergent, soap, and shampoo) to sell.

Julieta would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries (like canned goods, noodles, detergent, soap, and shampoo) to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvie is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Elvie has a bakery business in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, margarine, etc. for her bread-production business.

Elvie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, margarine, etc. for her bread-production business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 47 years old and married with four children. For the past two years, she has run a general store and she also earns an income from raising livestock. Ma. Theresa works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF.

Ma. Theresa is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, snack foods, beers, biscuits, detergent soap, and other products to sell. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, snack foods, beers, biscuits, detergent soap, and other products

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 49 years old and married with three children.

Mary Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mary Jean aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Falaha's Group

texts.en:
Falaha is a forty-one-year-old woman married to Nidal; they live in Southern Ghour. 

They have a small business where they sell stationary items for school students in the area. They also have a corner in their shop where they sell snacks like chips, chocolate and biscuits. They opened their shop using the money Nidal saved from his retirement salary from the military. 

They are requesting a loan to add new food products and to prepare the shop for the second semester by adding more stationary items to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to add new food products, and to prepare the shop for the second semester by adding more stationary items to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and power bills.

Christine operates a grocery stall, from which she sells vegetables. She has been in this business for 3 years, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a big business in the future. 

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with four kids, three of whom attend school and the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

Tatu operates a grocery vegetable selling stall, she sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high costs of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs. 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Seyfaddin

texts.en:
Seyfaddin is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are eight and 10 years old. His children go to secondary school. Seyfaddin lives with his wife and children in the Fuzuli region, but he is an internally displaced person (IDP). He is from Füzuli city but for over 22 years his home has been located near the war zone, where living conditions are difficult. For the past seven years, Seyfaddin has been raising sheep. He buys little lambs, raises them, and sells them in the local bazaar.

Seyfaddin is requesting a 1,300 AZN loan from the Komak to buy lambs for his farm. He is thankful to Kiva for help. In the future, Seyfaddin wishes to develop his business, increase his income, and to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy lambs for his farm

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows watermelons. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of rain. She will use the Kes. 30,000 loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to enable her grow more watermelons. Her business goal is to be a wholesale distributor of watermelons within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be self-reliant and able to sustain her family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Josephine is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Epefania has been in this business for three years. Epefania earns more income from food vending.

Epefania has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en: These people are part of the Yehowa Akwe group (God will cater). They live in the same area and sell fish and electrical appliances. Eunice is a wife and mother who sells fish, both fresh and smoked. She is requesting 2,000 GHS to buy more fish to sell to customers. She handles her family's daily expenses and supports her husband in managing their expenses. She has more than ten years experience in this business and is applying for her ninth loan with ID-Ghana. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. The group has received proper orientation about the loan and saving principals and promises to utilize this total loan of GHS 5500 judiciously. In the future, and with the help of the institution, Eunice would like to expand her business and save money to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 28 years old and married with two children.

Elenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Elenita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elenita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 45 years old and married with six children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elsie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married woman and has three children whom all attend school. She has owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a fruit- and coconut-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh. 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Amanda Gabriela

texts.es: A sus 19 años de edad Amanda es madre soltera, su hijo tiene 2 años de edad, Amanda creció en el campo donde la fuente de ingresos es la ganadería y la agricultura,  ella cursaba el quinto curso de la secundaria cuando se quedo embarazada y desde ese tiempo tuvo que dejar sus estudios y dedicarse a trabajar, ella  en la actualidad trabaja de en una panadería de vendedora y también se dedica a criar animales menores, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos y después venderlos teniendo ganancia, lo que Amanda aspira de este negocio es mejorarlo y seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en: At 19 years old, Amanda is a single mother and her son is 2 years old. Amanda grew up in the country where the main source of income is farming and agriculture.  She was in 12th grade of high school when she ended up pregnant which forced her to give up her studies and make a living working. She currently works in a bakery as a sales clerk and she also makes a living raising small animals.  She is going to invest this loan in buying pigs to raise then and then sell them, earning a profit in the process.  What Amanda wants from this business is to better it and keep working for the well-being of her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Sol Naciente se formo en la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene 17 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas, que buscan un mejor porvenir para su familia por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes, la Sra. Ramona, se dedica a la Costura, es decir tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, hace tiempo se dedica a esta actividad por lo tanto posee mucha clientela. Según su primera encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza se encuentra mejorando bastante, y comenta que su esposo también la ayuda bastante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sol Naciente Group was formed in Encarnacion city and has 17 members. They are all friends and neighbors who seek a better future for their families by working together. They are in the program to eliminate poverty.

One of the members is Ramona, who is a seamstress. She has a small shop in her home and has had this business for some time so she has many clients. According to the initial poverty survey, her poverty level is improving. She comments that her husband is also helping a lot. She seeks a loan to be able to invest in buying fabrics, needles, glue, and other items in order to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, glue and other items.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a 54-year-old married woman from Rafah. She is a mother to four sons. Six years ago, Aysha opened a grocery store in the city where she sells basic grocery products. She would like to improve the store and add more inventory because the demand is high, since it is the only store in this area.
Aysha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more grocery products and a refrigerator for her grocery store. This will increase her sales and also her income.
Aysha appears in the photo in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products and a refrigerator for her grocery store.

loans.name: Koe Pyuahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Koe Pyahu forma parte del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas están dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, luchando por mejorar cada día e ir creciendo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación, como un medio de poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una de las integrantes.
Todas las integrantes son mujeres muy luchadoras, entre las que se destaca la Sra. Sonia, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene despensa y heladería, su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que todos los días empieza desde muy temprano. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe para mejorar.
La Sra. Sonia solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos para su despensa, como también para comprar helados varios, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The Koe Pyahu Group is part of the women's committee program, and all members participate in the program, fighting every day to improve and grow. They are completing the poverty elimination survey, which is a way of knowing the life situation of each member. All the members of the group are very hard-working, and among them is Sonia, who has a convenience store and ice cream store. Her work requires sacrifice as she opens every day very early and works every day. She is thankful for the opportunity to improve. Sonia seeks a loan to buy items for her store, as well as a variety of ice cream, which will help her finalize her business plan resulting in an improvement in her income.

loans.use: to buy various general store products and a variety of ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pigs that she can sell, which will increase her working capital and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pigs to sell at a profit and improve the family's quality of living.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is a married woman residing in Mcarthur, Leyte. She is 54 years old. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells basic items like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, bread, and beverages. She has been operating the store for eight years. Her husband is a fisherman. Isidra has 13 children. Five of her children are still attending school. 

Isidra is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of items like noodles, toiletries, canned goods, and soft drinks. These stocks are essentials; thus her store will be filled again, attracting more consumers to shop and buy. In this way, she hopes that her income will increase so that she can pay her loan, purchase a healthy diet, and provide better living conditions.

Isidra hopes that her current business will be productive so that she can continue financing her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items like noodles, toiletries, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 19 years. He describes himself as ambitious. 

Jackson operates a retail shop where he sells cooking oil, sugar, milk, flour, bread, washing soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as low stock. 

Jackson will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, milk, cooking oil, flour and other items he sells. His business goal is to have a mini supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be self-reliant and able sustain his family. He will use the anticipated profits to set up another business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, milk, cooking oil, flour, and other items

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and married with three children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, detergent soap, sanitary pads, soft-drinks, sugar and diapers to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, detergent soap, sanitary pads, soft drinks, sugar and diapers to sell.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 35 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. Cecil is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cecil is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as fish, meat, vegetables, spices, and other items for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, vegetables, and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter Deema to appear in the photo instead.

Taghreed is a forty-year-old widow. Her daughter Deema goes to the university to study nursing. Taghreed is applying for the loan to help Deema pay for her semester fees. 

Deema’s ambition is to find work in her field so her mom can rest.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's semester fees

loans.name: Zulla

texts.en: Zula is 31 years. She is married with three children aged between one month and seven years; two of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more radios and telephones to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more radios and telephones to resell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. For the past seven years, she has operated a water kiosk, selling water from her home to the community. Eunice owns a house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Her greatest business challenge is transportation. Eunice decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

Eunice is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to purchase a stock of mineral water to sell.

loans.use: to purchase mineral water to sell

loans.name: Hamza Razaq

texts.en:
Hamza is a young and enthusiastic entrepreneur from Sialkot. He is 25, married and blessed with a son. He wants to give a better and prosperous life to his family. Therefore, he wants his business to flourish and constantly tries to improve his business so that it can become more lucrative. Given the demand and competition in the market, Hamza wants to offer more variety to his customers. Therefore, he has requested a loan to help him arrange the financing for the purchasing.
He is happy and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of crockery for his store.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 45-year-old married woman who is running a business of milk-selling with her husband of many years. They have two buffaloes they use for selling milk to the people of their locality. They also sell butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. They have become famous for providing good-quality milk and make enough to meet day-to-day expenses. They have gradually improved their business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. They have five children and need to earn much more to fulfill their basic needs.  Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This will allow them to purchase one more buffalo to increase their earnings. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for them and will bring positive changes to their business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Paola Gabriela

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Paola, tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 1  hijo de 3 años  de edad. Su marido trabaja en una institución del estado. Ella estudia párvulo en una universidad en Portoviejo.
Doña Paola como varias personas del cantón se dedica a la elaboración de dulces, roscas, tortas y varios bocadillos mas, ella junto  a su suegra preparan sus dulces para clientes particulares que les piden para compromisos sociales, para la venta al público y también para comerciantes que los llevan a  otras ciudades a vender, ellas por lo general los  fines de semana tiene estos contratos, lleva más de 6 años dedicada a esta labor la misma que le permite ganar lo suyo pues los gastos de sus estudios son muchos. 
Este crédito es para  comprar todo tipo de víveres para preparar sus deliciosos dulces. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the credit group Trabajando Juntas gather at the canton Rocafuerte. This place is known by its delicious candies made by the local people and are widely known around the country. 

In this place lives Paola of 25 years of age. She is in union and from this relationship she has one son of 3 years old. Her partner works in a state institution. She studies to become a nursery school teacher at the University of Portoviejo.

Just like a lot of people in the canton, Paola works making candies, roscas, cakes and other snacks. Along with her mother-in-law they make candies for particular clients who make orders for social events, and also to sell to the public and to traders that take them to other cities to sell. 

She usually performs this activity on the weekends, and she has done it for over 6 years. It allows her to earn some money and pay for her studies which are not cheap.

This loan is to buy all kinds of supplies to make her delicious candies. She has been with the credit group for 3 cycles and she likes these loans because they are at a low interest rate. Her dreams are to give his son only the best and to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
Las vencedoras lleva por nombre este grupo, que está luchando y esforzándose por poder crecer y salir adelante. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como medio de que cada una conozca su realidad y conforme ello vayan trabajando.
La Sra. Yeny forma parte de este grupo, ella en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado bastante a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de comidas que ella hace, y en lo cual comenta que le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Vencedoras group is fighting and strengthening itself to be able to grow and be successful. The members are in the program to eliminate poverty, with each members coming to understand her reality and how to improve their work.

Yeny is part of the group. In her last survey she demonstrated a poverty level of 3, which is to say she has improved quite a bit through the efforts and work by selling the food she prepares. She shares that her business is going well. She seeks a loan to be able to buy ingredients for her meals such as vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken and other items to be able to continue with her work. She is thankful fo the opportunity that the loan provides as it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken and other items to prepare meals to sell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Gilda has been in this business for two years. Gilda earns more income from food-vending.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and has four children. She has a live-in partner and three of her children are still in school. For the past four years, Teresita has been fattening pigs in the Philipppines. She has borrowed two previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Teresita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rhoda works hard to support her family.

She has a goods-selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending and a general store. Rhoda is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more goods like sandals, slippers, etc. to sell for her business.

Rhoda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like sandals, slippers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Josephine has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Katan

texts.en:
Katan is a married man and has been blessed with two children. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are power bills and school fees.

For the past six years, Katan has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. He cites theft and competition as his major challenge in his business. 

Katan is requesting KES 20,000 to boost his kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 45-year-old married mother of 7 children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. They run a general store in their house. People of their community are satisfied with the services they provide. 

Razia is in her 6th loan cycle. She is currently requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She has an excellent repayment record and is regarded as a good client. With this loan, she wants to purchase more commodities including rice, sugar, salt, oil, and beverages to increase their revenue. They are hopeful that the loan will help them to grow their business, and they dream of providing a high-quality education to their children.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities including rice, sugar, salt, oil, and beverages

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is 38 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 6 and 17 years. All of her children go to school. Rehema has a butcher shop, and she has been in this business for three years. With the requested loan, she would like to buy more cows for meat. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more cows for meat.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of one and 10. Three of his children go to school. For the past seven years, Patrick has sold clothing. 

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy trousers and shirts to resell. He will use the profit from his loan to buy land and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy trousers and shirts to sell

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en: Ameer is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with the help of her husband for many years. Her husband also assists her in purchasing stocks of goods from the market. Ameer is the mother of two children and is motivated to provide them with good-quality food, clothing, health care, and education. Ameer wants to grow her business so she is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, beverages, and other grocery items to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salts, biscuits, beverages, and other grocery items

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Los angeles  esta en su Segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde 5 de las 18 señoras  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, por lo que ellas deben mejorar y trabajar un poco mas.
Una de ellas es la señora Guillermina, quien tiene una despensa con todo tipo de insumos que vende desde tempranas horas del día y hasta muy tarde, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se esta esforzando por ser alguien en la vida, y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder surtir su despensa con verduras, carne, panificados, leche y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Los Angeles Group is in its second loan cycle in the women's communal bank program.  All the women have committed to working and helping each other mutually so they can get ahead.  They're completing the poverty-elimination survey, on which 5 of the 18 women came out blow the poverty line, so they have to improve and work a little harder.

One of the members is Guillermina, who has a grocery store with all types of products she sells from early in the day until very late.  She's a very hardworking woman who's making an effort to be someone in life and help her family.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to stock her store with vegetables, meat, baked goods, milk, and other products.  That way she can keep on makings sales, just as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, baked goods, milk, and other products

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and her three children; one of them attends the public primary school.

Her family was affected by the last war at Gaza, and her house was destroyed. She applied for a loan to build the walls of her house and to purchase cement and rubble.

She hopes to be able to provide her sons the best life conditions. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to build the walls of her house and to purchase cement and rubble.

loans.name: Darweesh

texts.en:
Darweesh is 47 years old and lives with his wife and five sons in Gaza. He has been working at a grocery. Darweesh is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was partially destroyed and he would like to repair it. 

Darweesh is requesting a loan from Ryada to rebuild his kitchen, install pipelines, and buy glass and planks to renovate his home. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him. In the future, Darweesh hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to rebuild his kitchen, install pipelines, and buy glass and planks to renovate his home

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en:
Vivani is a married mother of three children, all of whom don't attend school because they are adults. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is power and water bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes. 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes from Tanzania for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes from Tanzania for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes. 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will offer job opportunities. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 31 years old. She is married with three children aged between 6 months and 9 years; one of them goes to school. She sells shoes and has been in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged forty-four and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of six children aged between five and eighteen; four of them attend school. 

Robert operates a retail shop, mainly selling sugar, sodas, salt, and cooking oil among other items. He earns additional income from growing cassava. He hopes to develop his business and also pay school fees for his children, but inadequate capital is a problem he faces. 

Robert will use the loan to buy more sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Colita

texts.en:
Colita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Colita is 46 years old and her three children are in school.

Colita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Colita has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
El   Sr. Agustin es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 56 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Amadada 49 años, tiene 4 hijos, quienes son su principal motivación para poder seguir luchando.
Agustin tiene una mercería, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, es un señor muy trabajador, excelente. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, bebidas, y demás, de manera a seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Agustin is from the city of Santaní. He is 56 years old and is married to Sra. Amadada, age 49. They have four children who are his primary motivation for continuing forward.

Agustin has a general store with an established clientele. He generates a good income because he is a hardworking and wonderful man.

Agustin is requesting this loan so that he can buy various products for his store such as vegetables, meat, beverages, and other products. This will enable him to continue his sales as before.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, beverages, and other products that he can sell.

loans.name: Aymara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AYMARA” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de api, venta de chompas, venta de cereales, tejido de chompas, venta de comida, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al observar el mercado de la comida en su zona, posteriormente fue ampliando poco a poco su negocio que en la actualidad es la fuente de ingresos de su hogar. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “AYMARA” group will begin its 10th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. The group has 8 members and is directed by an executive board and Virginia is its president. The members' businesses are varied: sewing shawls, selling api (a corn drink), selling sweaters, selling grains, weaving sweaters, selling food, selling fish. The loan will be used to benefit their microbusinesses where Virginia is a member.

Virginia has been a member of Pro Mujer for 8 years, joining at the invitation of a friend who was a client of the institution. Today Virginia has a business selling food. She learned this work several years ago upon observing the market in her area. Then she grew her business little by little until today where it is the source of income in her home.

The loan will be used as capital to buy groceries at wholesale that she will get from the vendors in La Paz city and then make and sell her food in her stand. This form of work enables her to generate resources to support her family economically, as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Estrellas Doradas K-Pop Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DORADAS K-POP” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wilma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de dulces, venta de perfumes, venta de CD, venta de ropa deportiva, taller mecánico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wilma es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años conjuntamente su madre, posteriormente a su matrimonio decidió independizarse y tener su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ESTRELLAS DORADAS K-POP” group will begin its 3rd cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Santiago II. The group has 9 members and is directed by an executive board of which Wilma is president. The members' businesses are varied: selling food, selling candy, selling perfume, selling CDs, selling athletic clothing, mechanic shop.

This loan will benefit their small businesses where Wilma is a member. Wilma joined Pro Mujer 3 years ago. She has a business selling food. She learned about this work years ago with her mother, then after she married she decided to have her own business. The loan will be an increase in capital (to buy groceries at wholesale) to acquire products from the wholesalers in La Paz City and then make her food to sell in her stall. This work will enable her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is married with three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 61 years old and married with one child. 

Estelita is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Estelita has been in pig fattening for 1 year now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Regie is 29 years old and her one child is currently in school.

Regie has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Regie requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc., for her business.

Regie has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc., for her business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
The humid and rocky Kapsowar area of Kenya can be considered a hardship area. Even with savannah plains and little human activity, there exists a farm that stands tall, a farm with over four high-pedigreed Freshian cows, producing over 40 litres of milk. It’s quite an outstanding feat, considering the harsh terrain and other handicaps, like the lack of electricity from the national grid, and also because of being dependent on traditional methods of harvesting water.

Kiva lenders, meet Thomas, the man credited with the success story of the farm. He is a youthful 47-year-old farmer who is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience, despite personal challenges and his passion to support his four children as a primary caregiver.

The living conditions in the Kapsowar area are very tough, and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Thomas has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Thomas started practicing mixed farming and has been doing this for the past ten years. Thomas’ sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time.

The Kapsowar area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Thomas is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Thomas is very determined to succeed, and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his children. Thomas’ dream is to provide a secure future for his children through paying tuition fees for them. Through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

By lending today, you can improve Thomas’ lifestyle and farming business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so he can deliver his vegetables, milk, and eggs to the market.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is 37 years old. She is married and has two children.  One of them is a 10-year-old son and he goes to the fourth class, and her younger son is 5 years old. She is a very hardworking and caring mother.  The family is living in Baku region.

Tarana is a wood master, and she has been in this business for 8 years. Today she wants to increase her business. Tarana has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy new apparatus and materials which will be useful in her work, like wood and pegs.

She is thankful to the Komak organization and all lenders for the help. In the future she wants to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy new apparatus and materials to increase her business because in the future she wants to give a good education to her children

loans.name: Sartawi De Tambillo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTAWI DE TAMBILLO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de helados, venta de mantas, servicio de transporte, venta de comida, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dionicia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo criara para poder comercializar la leche y el queso. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.
texts.en:
The “SARTAWI DE TAMBILLO” group will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Copacabana The group has 8 members and is directed by an executive board of which Dionicia is president. The members' businesses are varied: selling food, selling ice cream, selling shawls, transportation service, selling food, and selling food.

This loan will benefit their small businesses where Dionicia is a member. Diocicia joined Pro Mujer 1 year ago at the invitation of a Pro Mujer representative that visited her home. She has a business selling cheese. She learned about this work years ago from her parents and from a young age helped support her family. Now she has her own family so she decided to start her own business. The loan will be an increase in capital (to buy cattle) to acquire products from the wholesalers in her community and then be able to sell her milk and cheese. This work will enable her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is married with a child. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laminate sheets, beams, and construction pins in order to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells milk, sugar, cooking oil, flour, bread, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of milk, sugar, cooking oil, soap, and other items. Her business goal is to have a mini-supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk, sugar, cooking oil, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Suma Pankarita De Atalaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA PANKARITA DE ATALAYA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, tejido y venta de mantas, venta den ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de gelatinas y refrescos, venta de masitas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeria es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una familiar que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de pasteles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior donde era empleada, posteriormente con un poco capital decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The non profit group “Suma Pankarita de Atalaya' will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer which is part of the Regional Hub of Alto Lima. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive board that Valeria is the president of. The businesses that the community association members run are varied and include a neighbourhood store, the weaving and sale of blankets and sale of clothes, cosmetics, jellies, soft drink and pastries.

This loan will benefit the small group of micro-businesses that Valeria is a part of. She tells us that she has been part of Pro Mujer for ten years after having been invited to join by a relative who was a client of the institution. At the moment she runs a store selling pastries. She learnt how to run this business from a previous job. After working there she decided to use her small amount of capital to start her own business independently.

The loan that Valeria is taking out now will be used to increase her capital and buy flour in bulk which she will obtain from the bulk vendors in La Paz. After making the pastries she will sell them from her work space. This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, since she is married and has five children.

When asked what she liked most about Pro Mujer, Valeria replied that she liked the savings and the health benefits that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita is 60 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Tomasita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Tomasita has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 29 years old. She is married with four children aged between 1 and 6 years. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes and shoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es una persona que esta esforzándose por ser alguien en la vida, esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, quiere ser una enfermera útil a las demás personas y a la sociedad. 
Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo ha usado en el pago de las cuotas, para poder seguir con sus estudios. hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con su carrera.
texts.en:
Gloria is from the city of Paraguarí. She is a person who is striving to make something of her life. Gloria is studying for a degree in Nursing. She wants to become a nurse who is useful to other people and to society.

She says that her previous loan was used to pay her fees, which allowed her to continue her studies. Today she is requesting another loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees. This will allow her to continue with her degree.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 28 years old and lives with his wife in Gaza. He has been working as a carpenter for ten years.

He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed. He would like to repair it again but he lost all his property, so he is now trying to take the first step until he can get back to his normal life.

For these reasons, he has requested a loan from Ryada to purchase cement and other building materials, and also to pay for the worker to start working at rebuilding. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family and to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other building materials, and also to pay for the worker to start working at rebuilding

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling food supplement products in the Philippines.

Lolita has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of food supplements to sell. She has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of food supplements to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man with three kids, all of whom attend school.  He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

William operates a grocery stall selling vegetables; he sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 he wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the agricultural tractor she has.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Petronila de 33 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Petronila  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04 años  a la venta de ropa usada y nueva su venta es con los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Petronila  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, blusas, etc. ya que viene la época de navidad y desea surtir un poco mas su negocio su venta la realiza de forma ambulante. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
 Está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su quinto préstamo que solicita.
 Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Petronila is a 33-year-old single mother with two dependent children. She lives in a community in San Lorenzo, Valle al Sur in Honduras.

Doña Petronila has her own home and has been selling used and new clothes for four years. Her customers include friends and people who visit her on a daily basis. She is a hardworking woman who wants to move forward.

Doña Petronila is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes such as trousers, dresses, skirts, blouses, and other items. With the Christmas season approaching, she wants to stock up on a bit more merchandise that she can sell as a street vendor. With the help of this loan, she hopes to improve her quality of life.

Petronila is pleased to continue working with Prisma since this is the fifth loan that she has requested. Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy trousers, dresses, skirts, blouses, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Maria Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like feed, rice, sanitary pads, coffee, diapers, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

Maria Elena has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like feed, rice, sanitary pads, coffee, diapers, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a notebook computer for his studies.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz proviene de una familia humilde, su meta es culminar sus estudios para obtener más ingresos   y ocupar un mejor cargo en su lugar de trabajo así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, que han sido siempre su mayor sostén.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Liz comes from a modest family. Her goal is to finish her studies so that she can earn more income and obtain a better position at her place of work. As a result, this would improve her family’s quality of life since they have always been her greatest support.

Liz is studying for a degree in Nursing. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. This would allow her to continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
Charish is 39 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. Charish is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Charish has been in pig fattening for 18 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Angelita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 23 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, trabaja cultivando granos básicos, tiene 31 años de edad, es acompañado, vive en casa propia; trabajando en el campo puede tener ingresos económicos para cubrir los gastos familiares, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y desde hace 10 años lo hace de forma independiente.
Invertirá en el pago de mozos, una desgranadora y transporte de la cosecha hacia su vivienda, esto le da oportunidad de tener recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos de la recolección de la cosecha y así entregar en menor tiempo su producto.
Sus sueños son mejorar los ingresos, cancelar su deuda y cambiar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: Wilfredo earns a living by growing basic grains. He is 31 years old and lives with his life partner in his own house. By working in the fields, he is able to earn enough to cover his family expenses. He learnt how to do his job from his parents and he has now been doing it independently for 10 years. He will use the loan to pay for labourers, a corn sheller and for the costs of transporting the harvest to his home. The loan will present him with an opportunity to have sufficient economic resources to cover the costs of collecting the harvest and therefore allow him to deliver his product quicker. His dream is to improve his income, to pay off his debts and change his family circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for labourers, a corn sheller and for the costs of transporting the harvest to his home.

loans.name: Apoleñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “APOLEÑAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jovanka es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de vestidos, venta de deportivos, venta de masitas, venta de cepillos dentales, venta de cuadernos, venta de vestidos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jovanka es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de cuadernos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años iniciando de forma ambulante con diferentes productos quedándose con los cuadernos ya que son materiales imperecederos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuadernos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Apoleñas Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Jovanka is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including a neighborhood store, clothing sales, athletic clothing sales, cake sales, toothbrush sales, notebook sales, and dress sales.

The loan they're  getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Jovanka.  She said it's the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a client of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling notebooks.  She made it known that she started her business several years ago as a street vendor selling different products.  She decided on notebooks because they're non-perishable.

Jovanka's loan is to increase her capital with a wholesale purchase of notebooks, which she'll get from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, then sell in her sales stall.  This job allows her to earn an income to support her family, because she's married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the trainings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy notebooks wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell in the local markets.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: Clotilde vive en concubinato, ella tiene un hijo Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticrético Clotilde se esta ganando la vida como ayudante de carpintería y necesita un prestamo para seguir con la compra de  madera para su posterior reventa o transformación en muebles Clotilde es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Clotilde lives with her partner and son in La Paz. Their house is made of brick and cement, which is paid for through a loan. Clotilde earns her living as a carpenter's apprentice and needs a loan to continue buying wood for furniture restoration and resale. Clotilde is the only source of income for her household, which is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to continue buying wood.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Edwin, a youthful 40-year-old budah (father), and a wise farmer who neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Edwin is happily married and together with his wife, blessed with four lovely children. 

For the past 15 years he has been involved in mixed farming and his primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes and also, he keeps dairy cows. Edwin has been able to provide nutritious food for his family. Although he has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, he is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made him give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ he said. He mobilized other marginalized farmers in his village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring farmers like him. 

He is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Edwin is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting his produce to the market has been a challenge, hence suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Edwin is going to achieve his dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for men in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Edwin feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out marginalized farmers, so that they can gain respect and equality among their rich counterparts. 

The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because Edwin will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market.  He will also increase his sales volume, because he will be able to transport more goods to the market increasing his income level. Edwin is a farmer who is making a change for himself and for others in the community, because he intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Edwin will improve his living conditions and assure his children of a secure future. Please help Edwin, so that he can transport product timely to the market!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport his produce.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is her power bill.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Angelita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as candies, detergent soap, coffee, vinegar, canned goods, beers, soft drinks, etc.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 65 years old and widowed with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fe has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Fe has been in this business for 50 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Engelberta

texts.en:
Engelberta is 60 years old and married with three children.

Engelberta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Engelberta has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Engelberta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 35 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado se su cónyuge y dos hijos menores de edad 7 y 5 años, vive en casa propia de material rustico un piso en caserío san Juan Pampa, Elmer es nacido en caserío san Juan Pampa y cónyuge es nacido en caserío el Pueblo lo hizo donde esta la parcela agrícola que trabajan; vive en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío el San Juan pampa Distrito de santo tomas; vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Elmer es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor, plantación tiene tres años de edad, esta en segundo año de producción y para 2015 estará en tercer año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio 3 has donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 03 años en caserío el pueblo lo hizo Distrito Santo Tomas, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en distrito santo tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente Elmer se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno en caserío San Juan Pampa que es donde realmente esta estable y también al cultivo y productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de 2 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer, 35, has a stable home with his wife and his two young children, ages 7 and 5.  He lives in his own one-story home made of modest materials in the community of San Juan Pampa, where he was born.  His wife was born in the community of El Pueblo, where the plot of land they farm is located.

He lives happily with with his family and the members of his community in the rural part of San Juan Pampa in the district of Santo Tomás, in a small community devoted mainly to agriculture and ranching.  He has running water in his home.

Elmer's job is growing coffee.  Currently he has two hectares of the Catimor variety on his farm, which he has had for three years.  He's in the second year of production; 2015 will be his third year.  He has his own land, three hectares on which he grows the coffee.  He has three years of experience growing coffee.  He sells his crop in Santo Tomás to buyers in the region.  Elmer also works in ranching raising dairy cows in San Juan Pampa, which is very stable, as well as growing bread products.

The loan is to take care of his two hectares of coffee in production, which will ensure a bigger and better crop for the 2015 season.  As a result he'll earn more income so he can improve his quality of life and his family's.

loans.use: to take care of two hectares of coffee in production to ensure a bigger and better crop in the 2015 season

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines.
