Wenifreda requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business, which she has been in for 36 years now.

Wenifreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

loans.name: Diocelin

texts.en:
Diocelin is 46 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Diocelin works very hard to provide for them.

Diocelin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, rice, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Diocelin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, rice, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Florepes

texts.en:
Florepes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Florepes has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ginalyn has a bag making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ginalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her bag making business.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 100,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 37 años de edad, es madre separada, tiene cuatro hijos de edades 21, 19 y 2 de 16 años de los cuales las dos gemelas estudian secundaria en colegio nacional, ella cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales. Leonor vive en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú, contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Leonor es la venta de abarrotes en general (pollo, verduras, arroz, azúr, etc.) Cuenta con 2 años dedicandose a este rubro, cuenta con clientela reconocida de la zona y caserios aledaños, además cuenta con un mototaxi la cual brinda servicio de transporte urbano, ingresos adicionles que le permiten solventar su cuota sin ningun problema. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en negocio de compra de abarrotes en general, para poder aumentar y diversificar sus stock de productos y así poder satisfacer la diveras necesidades y preferencias de su público consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Leonor is 37 years old, separated, and has four children aged 21, 19, and twins aged 16 who attend secondary school. Leonor has good work and personal references. She lives in the rural district of Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in Peru’s northern mountains. Her home has water and electricity. The local people work in agriculture, animal raising, and business.

Leonor earns her living selling groceries such as chicken, vegetables, rice, sugar etc. She’s been working in this field for two years and has an appreciative customer base in the area and nearby communities. She also has a mototaxi which she uses to offer transportation services. This brings in additional income and she will have no problem paying off the loan.

Leonor plans to use the loan money to buy groceries and thus increase and diversify her stock. Then she will be able to satisfy the various needs and preferences of her customers. In the short term she will be able to increase income and eventually improve  both her own and her family’s standard of living. There isn’t much competition in the area for her kind of store.

loans.use: buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 39 years old. She is married with three children between one and six years old, two of whom go to school. She sells clothes and has been in the business for four years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more skirts and shirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and welfare.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and shirts to sell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 34 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Karen has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school. Violeta has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. Violeta has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en: Shatha is a 19-year-old single lady living in Irbid. She’s a second year student majoring in French language and literature. Shatha is an Independent person who works a part-time job besides studying, because she wants to help her parents with her semester fees. But today, because of some financial issues, Shatha is applying for an educational loan to help her pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman but has no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

For the past nine years, Fatuma has operated a fruit and coconuts business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 50,000 KES Fatuma wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for reselling. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for reselling.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Coumba Croisement's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 22 janvier 2003, le banc villageois vient d’entamer ses vingt troisième cycles dans le programme. L’activité principale des membres est le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie. Les femmes en majorité ont une bonne maîtrise des caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et il y a une bonne entente au sein du groupe.

Madame Coumba (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une femme très dynamique et participe activement aux activités du banc village. Elle est mariée, âgée d 38 ans et mère de 04 enfants 02 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la transformation plus particulièrement la pâte d’arachide qu’elle achète par sac de graine non décortiqué avant la transformation. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience pour avoir pratiqué l’activé depuis plus de 06 ans.

Elle compte avec son nouveau prêt, acheter 47 sacs de graines d’arachide pour stockage et transformation.

Avec les bénéfices, elle souhaite soutenir activement son mari dans la gestion des frais scolaires et sanitaires des enfants et aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created 22 January 2003 and the banc villageois has just started its 23rd cycle in the program. The members of this group work primarily in small-scale commerce while also practicing rain-fed agriculture. They mostly understand how credit works and how to save. They all live in the same village and share a good relationship with each other.

Coumba (who is seated on the right [of the photo] with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is a very dynamic woman who participates actively in the activities of the banc villageois. She is married, 38 years old, and a mother of four children--two boys and two girls. 

Coumba works making groundnut paste, that she makes by buying sacs of unhusked groundnuts. She has had a good experience with this business, which she has been doing for more than six years.

With this new loan, she plans to buy 47 sacs of groundnuts, which she will store and make into paste. 

With the earnings, she wishes to support her husband in taking care of their children's school fees and health costs. She also wishes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 47 bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his work as a journalist.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old and has one child in school. She is a married woman.

Judith is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Judith has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 32 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school, and Janeth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, rice, etc.

Janeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, rice, etc.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bernadeth is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Bernadeth has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Bernadeth requested a 12,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Bernadeth has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 48 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adela has been in this business for 20 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Reham

texts.en: Reham is a married woman living in Madaba. She recently opened her beauty salon and has started work right after she bought the essential tools like hair dryer and brushes. She is still missing a lot of tools like hair clips, curling machine, etc. She is applying for this loan to help her buy those tools so she can provide a better level of service.

loans.use: to buy tools like hair clips and a curling machine so she can provide a better level of service.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 40-year-old married woman living in Marka. She prepares food by order and makes pickles at home to sell. Her project started two years ago and she is hoping to improve it to become an independent catering business. But now Mona wants to buy more cooking pots and tools to be able to take bigger orders. For that reason, she is applying for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cooking pots and tools to be able to take bigger orders

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 31 years old. She is married with three children aged between 4 months and 11 years, and two of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been running this business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more trousers and shirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Kenneth, a youthful 27-year-old wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Eldoret, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya. Kenneth always says, “I eat from my sweat.” 

He is based in Kosyin, a rural village. He has two children and has been practicing farming for the past five years, and has never looked back. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crops. Most of the small holder farmers in Kosyin village own approximately one acre per household and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. Kenneth has been practicing mixed farming and he enjoys the income he gets, but he has been facing challenges delivering his products to the market. Kosyin village is a very remote area and the roads are in pathetic condition; this has hampered Kenneth from making timely delivery of products to the market while still fresh. Kenneth sells vegetables, milk and tomatoes which are very perishable and require quick delivery if you are to fetch a high price. 

Kenneth is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike that will help him deliver his products to the market in a timely manner, and overcome the challenge of facing losses. Through the loan he will be able to do timely delivery which means he will not suffer losses; this will translate into an immediate increase in profits. Kenneth plans to employ someone who will help him on the farm and deliver products to his large client base. Profits from the loan will be used to comfortably repay the loan fully and invest in a solid foundation for his family moving forward.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to deliver his products to the market

loans.name: Nuevo Viloroco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO VILOROCO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Petrona es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de helados, venta de mantas, servicio de transporte, venta de comida, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Petrona es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.

En la imagen se encuentra presente la hija de una de las clientes acompañando al grupo ella esta vestida con una chompa de color purpura.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Viloroco" community bank will begin its 3rd cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Copacabana. The group consists of 8 members and is directed by an executive board of which Petrona is the treasurer. The members have various businesses: selling food, selling ice cream, selling blankets, transportation service, selling food, and selling food. The loan will be used for the group's microbusinesses where Petrona is a member of the group.

Petrona has been a member for a year, joining at the invitation of a Pro Mujer representative that visited her in her home. Today she has a business selling food. She tells us that she learned this work from her parents, and as a child she worked to support her family. Now she has her own family and she decided to open her own business. The loan is to increase capital (buy groceries at wholesale) from wholesale vendors in La Paz city and then make her food to sell in her selling space. This work enables her to generate income to support her family, as she is married with two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and attention the organization offers.

In the photo the daughter of one of the members is included in the group and she is dressed in a purple jacket.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Korka's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 22 janvier 2003, le banc villageois vient d’entamer ses vingt troisième cycles dans le programme. L’activité principale des membres est le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie. Les femmes en majorité ont une bonne maîtrise des caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et il y a une bonne entente au sein du groupe. 

Madame Korka (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 filles et 01 garçons. Son activité consiste à l’achat et la revente de produits de consommation courante dans les marchés hebdomadaires (savon, sucre, huile, thé, …) afin de les revendre dans son village.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle veut acheter deux sacs de sucre à 20 000 Fr CFA le sac, 10 paquets de thé, du savon et divers autres produits de consommation courante.

Les bénéfices lui serviront à renforcer ses épargnes d’une part et de mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group has been created on January 22, 2003. Its banc villageois just started its 23rd loan cycle. The group members mainly work as vendors and also grow farm produce on rain-fed land. Most of the members are well familiar with the loan and savings program. They all live in the same village, and there is good rapport among the group members.

Mrs. Korka (the one seated on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower. She is 47 years old, married and has two children: one daughter and one son. She buys and resells staple products (such as soap, sugar, oil and tea) in order to resell them in her village.

With this new loan she would like to buy two bags of sugar at 20,000 West African francs each, 10 boxes of tea, some soap and various other first necessity products. The revenues will  allow her to bolster her savings as well as help her husband better manage everyday expenses.

loans.use: buy two bags of sugar, 10 boxes of tea, some soap and various other staple products.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 25 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Sheryl is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Sheryl requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sheryl has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Sheryl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Gorette is 54 years old. She is married with two children between 22 and 25 years old and both of them go to school. She sells fruits and has been in business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more oranges and mangoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more oranges and mangoes to resell.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a conservative lady who asked her brother Khaled to take her place in the photo.

Rawan is a thirty-one-year-old woman living in Zarqa. She is taking the loan to help her brother Khaled to pay for his semester fees.

Khaled is studying chemistry, besides working a part-time job as a cashier. He’s an ambitious student working hard between work and university. When Khaled finishes his chemistry degree, he wants to work in medical labs and centers.

loans.use: to help in paying for her brother's semester fees.

loans.name: Arlette

texts.en:
Arlette is 32 years old. She is married with two children, aged 8 and 11 years; both of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for ten years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 56 years old and married with eight children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Felicidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Felicidad has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as cosmetics, toiletries, biscuits, candies, yarn, frames, and other groceries.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 47 years old and married with seven children. All of her children are in school. Jean works very hard to provide for them.

Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Jean has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, biscuits, candies, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 32 years old. He is married with two children aged between 1 and 6 years; one of them goes to school. He sells clothes and has been in business for seven years.

With the loan requested, he would like to buy more shirts and shorts to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and shorts to resell.

loans.name: Jemmarie

texts.en:
Jemmarie is 24 years old and married, with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like rice, shampoo, and canned goods.

Jemmarie has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from a loading station.

Jemmarie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like rice, shampoo, and canned goods

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 26 years old and married, with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, and rice.

Jennifer has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from a loading station.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, and rice

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa esta casada tiene un hijjo y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Ninfa sigue dedicandose a la costura, si bien Ninfa no fabrica prendas de vestir, ha visto que puede aumentar sus ingresos con accesorios para dormitorio  En esta ocasion quiere un credito para comprar tela para hacer fundas para almohadas Por el momento Ninfa  es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero la clienta goza de buena salud y espera recibir su ayuda
texts.en: Ninfa is married. She has a child and lives in La Paz in a house made out of brick and cement, which she owns. Ninfa continues to make a living from sewing. Although Ninfa does not make garments, she has seen that her income could increase if she made bedroom accessories. On this occasion she wants a loan in order to buy fabric for making pillowcases. Currently Ninfa’s work is her household’s sole source of income, but she is in good health and hopes to receive your help.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making pillowcases

loans.name: Lamarana's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 22 janvier 2003, le banc villageois vient d’entamer ses vingt troisième cycles dans le programme. L’activité principale des membres est le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie. Les femmes en majorité ont une bonne maîtrise des caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et il y a une bonne entente au sein du groupe. 

Madame Lamarana(assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 04 filles et 01 garçons.  Elle s’active dans la transformation de pâte d’arachide,  elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité par sac, fait le tri, le décorticage et la transformation afin de la revente par seau de 5 ou 20 kg.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 08 sacs de 50 kg d’arachide non décortiqué pour la transformation.

Les bénéfices lui serviront de mieux contribuer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille : nourriture, santé, éducation et à renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created 22 January 2003, and this banc villageois just started their 23rd cycle in the program. The group members work primarily in small-scale commerce along with rain-fed agriculture. They understand mostly how credit works and to save. They all live in the same village and get along well.

Lamarana (seated on the right with her hand raised) is the feature borrower of this group. She is 34 years old, married, and a mother of five children--four girls and one boy. 

Lamarana works making groundnut paste. She buys [groundnuts] in the weekly markets in her area, sorts them, husks them, and then makes them into paste, which she sells in five kilogram and 20 kilogram buckets.

With this new loan, she plans to buy eight 50-kilogram sacs of unhusked groundnuts. Earnings will serve to better take care of her family's needs: food, health, education, and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy eight 50-kilogram sacs of unhusked groundnuts

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 34 years old and married, with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, rice, and beverages.

Juditha has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fish vending.

Juditha aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, rice, and beverages

loans.name: Mukanoheri Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 27 years old. She is married with two children aged between one and six years old, one of whom goes to school. She sells clothes and has been running the business for six years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more skirts and t-shirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and t-shirts for sale.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, sigue ofreciendo cosméticos, frutas y verduras a sus clientes, el préstamo anterior le ha servido para fortalecer la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene nuevos ingresos con los que cancela su deuda y optimiza el nivel de vida familiar.
Para Ana los créditos son una herramienta con la que mejora su negocio, por lo que requiere un nuevo refinanciamiento para comprar tomates, papayas, güisquiles, pipianes, cebollas, zanahorias, etc., abastecerá su negocio cada vez que lo necesite con frutas y verduras frescas.
texts.en:
Ana continues to sell cosmetics, fruits, and vegetables to her customers. The previous loan has helped her strengthen her fruit and vegetable sales. She has new income with which she repays her debt and improves the quality of her family's life.

For Ana, the loans are a tool with which she improves her business, which is why she needs a new loan to buy tomatoes, papayas, chayote squash, zucchini, onions, carrots, etc., to stock her business with fresh fruits and vegetables whenever she needs to.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, papayas, chayote squash, zucchini, onions, carrots, etc. to stock her business with fresh fruits and vegetables whenever she needs to.

loans.name: Santos Eduardo

texts.es:
Santos, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes y concentrado para ganado, espera obtener una mejor cosecha de granos básicos y ganancias mayores.
Con el capital de trabajo anterior su negocio tiene mayor capacidad de inversión y productividad, su familia cuenta con mejor alimentación diaria.
texts.en:
Santos has decided to take out a new loan in order to buy manure, seeds, fertilisers and feed for cattle; Santos hopes to grow a better harvest of basic grains and earn higher profits.

Since borrowing his first loan, Santos' business is now able to invest more and productivity is higher. In addition, Santos' family has better food to eat every day.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilisers and feed for cattle; Santos hopes to grow a better harvest of basic grains.

loans.name: La Vecindad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LA VECINDAD” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por quince  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, venta de mantas, venta de celulares, venta de ropa interior, venta de chompas, servicio de llamadas, venta de comida, venta de comida, venta de calcetines.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al observar el mercado y al conocer la técnica de venta de estos productos decide emprenderlo mediante un pequeño capital y con los contactos adecuados. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chamarras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “La Vecindad” will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Regional Office of Juan Pablo II. It is formed by fifteen members and it is managed by a board of directors in which Maria is the President. 

The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are diverse, and among them are a grocery store, and sale of cosmetics, blankets, cell phones, underwear, sweaters, phone service, socks and prepared food. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs in which Maria is a member. She says that it’s her fourth year at Pro Mujer, and she entered by a friend’s request who is a client of the institution.

Nowadays, she has a business selling sweaters, and says that she started this business several years ago. She studied the market and when she got to know the sales techniques of these products she decided to start it with a small capital and good contacts. 

The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital (buy sweaters in bulk) that will be acquired from the wholesalers of the city La Paz. Then she will sell them at her stand. This type of work allows her to generate incomes to support her family, since she is single and has four children.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health service that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy sweaters in bulk.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 51 years old and married with six children.

Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Luz has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Luz aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 32 years old. She is married with two children between one and seven years old, one of whom goes to school. She has a shop and has been in the business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.en: Appolinaire is 44 years old. He is married with four children between 10 and 22 years old, all of whom go to school. He sells soft drinks and has been in the business for three years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more juice and soda to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more juice and soda to sell

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es: Prudencia vive en concubinato y tiene 4 hijos Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de adobe donde paga un alquiler Prudencia sigue dedicandose a la confección de tejidos pero cuando tiene tiempo libre ella gana dinero extra lavando arena Prudencia necesita un credito para comprar materiales que le permitan fabricar ponchos (delgados y gruesos) tanto para varon como para mujer Ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud, ella espera que puedan ayudarle con su proyecto
texts.en:
Prudencia lives with her partner and has 4 children. She lives in La Paz in an adobe house, where she pays rent.

Prudencia continues to make a living knitting, but when she has free time, she earns extra money washing sand.

Prudencia needs a loan to buy materials that allow her to make ponchos (thin and thick), for men as well as women. She is the only source of income in her house, but she enjoys good health. She hopes that you can help her with her project.

loans.use: to buy materials to make ponchos.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Tambillo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER DE TAMBILLO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rufina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de helados, venta de mantas, servicio de transporte, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rufina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo criara para poder comercializar la leche en las empresas distribuidoras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene nueve hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.

En la imagen una de las clientes esta ausente, la misma se fue con premura a su domicilio ya que tenía que volver a su cosecha.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Amanecer de Tambillo" [New Dawn of Tambillo] communal bank will begin its first semester in Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana regional hub. It is comprised of nine members and is run by a board of directors, of which Rufina is the President.

The businesses that the members of this community bank run vary and include: food sales, ice cream sales, blanket sales, and transportation services. The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro enterprises, one of which Rufina's.

She says that she joined ProMujer a year ago, at the invitation of a Promoter of the institution who came to visit her at her home. She currently has a business selling milk. She tells us that she learned this business from her parents, since she supported the family business from a young age. Now that she has a family of her own, she decided to start her own business.

The loan that she will take out now is for increasing capital (buying cattle) that she will buy from wholesale venders in her community. She will then raise it to be able to sell the milk to distributors. This type of work helps her generate income to support her family, since she is married and has nine children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the service that the institution offers.

In the photo, one of the clients is absent. She went home early because she had to return to her crop.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Cholponay

texts.ru: Чолпонай погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду КИВА и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Она по прежнему занимается пошивом театральных костюмов, верхней одежды, реставрацией одежды. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом- на покупку ткани, фурнитуры и швейной машинки. На доходы от кредита Чолпонай хочет увеличить ассортимент и благоустроить дом.
texts.en:
Cholponay repaid her previous loan, after having used it as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. She is still engaged in sewing theater costumes and outerwear, and reparing clothes. The monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase fabric, accessories and a sewing machine. Cholponay would like to use the income from the loan to increase her assortment and equip her house.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials for sewing

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель, 32 года, разведена, имеет 2 детей. Асель имеет средне-специальное образование. По характеру она: честная и пунктуальная. Она работает мед сестрой в областной больнице, получая заработную плату в размере около 6,500 сом (KGS). Так как у Асель маленькие дети, она решила утеплить свой дом. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), чтобы купить пластиковые окна, пластиковые двери и заменить трубы в ванной комнате. Это позволит Асель позаботиться о ее детях, обеспечив их комфортом и теплом.
texts.en:
Asel is 32 years old, divorced and has two children. Asel has vocational education. She is honest and punctual by character. She works as a nurse at the regional hospital, receiving an income of around 6,500 som (KGS). 

As Asel has small children, she decided to insulate her house. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS), in order to purchase plastic windows, doors and change the pipes in the bathroom. This will allow Asel to take care of her children, providing them with comfort and warmth.

loans.use: to purchase plastic windows and doors and change the pipes in her bathroom, in order to insulate her house

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан, 55 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Анаркан - среднее образование. С 1971 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая фасоль на 3,04 ГА собственной земли. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 1 теленок и 10 овец. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Anarkan is 55 years old, married, and has two children. Anarkan has secondary education. Since 1971 she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, growing haricots on 3.04 hectares of own land. Thanks to Anarkan's persistent work, her farm currently has one cow, one calf and ten sheep. The total monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase eight sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es casada, tiene 3 hijos y se dedica a la elaboración de polleras y mantas de vicuña, vive en casa propia con un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento, su vivienda está ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Valeriana elabora polleras y mantas de vicuña, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua;  ella necesita credito para comprar lana de vicuña en mayor cantidad que otras veces Valeriana goza de buena salud y espera su ayuda
texts.en:
Valeriana is married, has 3 children, and she knits sweaters and shawls from vicuna wool. Valeriana lives in her own house, which is composed of worn out blocks and a cement floor. Her home is located in the city of La Paz.

Valeriana generates income to cover household expenses, including food, lights, and water, by knitting sweaters and shawls of vicuna wool. At present, she needs a loan to purchase vicuna wool in larger quantity that previously. Valeriana enjoys good health and hopes for your aid.

loans.use: to buy vicuna wool for her knitting business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está en el segundo año de la carrera de administración de empresas, vive con sus padres y comenta que su aspiración de aquí a 3 años sera poner una empresa familiar de artesanía y administrarla ella misma.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de sus carreras, y de esa manera poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Aida is from the city of Carapeguá. She is in her second year of study toward a degree in Business Administration. Aida lives with her parents and says that within three years, she will open a family craft business that she will manage herself.

Aida is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her degree fees. This will allow her to continue with her work just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Richary Anteña Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roalbina,la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende su mercadería a  todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, gaseosas entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar golosinas, leche entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de panificadora, venta de frutas, internet, venta de carne.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank, “RICCHARY ANTEÑA,” which is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the Anta province and the department of Cusco. 

Rosalbina continues with her business, a grocery store.  She sells her merchandise to all of the customers requesting it.  She continues selling rice, sugar and soft drinks, among other things, this being the way that she gets her family ahead.  She is requesting the loan to purchase snacks and milk, among other things. 

The other members work in businesses such as a bakery, selling fruit, selling meat and an internet business.  The members who appear in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work-related reasons.

Rosalbina is grateful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and she promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the established period of time.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Heritage Group

texts.en:
Susan, who is in her early 30s, is single with two children who are still in school.  She has been running two projects, a mamalishe (local eatery) and a retail shop.  She works from 5 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Susan's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to increase her retail shop inventory and restock the missing items in her mamalishe stock.  She dreams of owning a hotel.  

Susan will share this loan with her loan group "Heritage", which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her retail shop inventory and restock the missing items in her mamalishe (local eatery)stock.

loans.name: Vicente Valentin

texts.es:
Vicente Valentin tiene 19 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, y sin carga familiar. Reside en casa de sus padres, Vicente Valentin es natural de la zona. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que su actividad es la agricultura, ganadería, comercio y transporte. Ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

Vicente Valentin se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con su mototaxi propia en la ruta Morropón - Laynas – Carrasquillo y viceversa, además transporta estudiantes, este servicio lo ofrece desde hace más de 2 años. Con muy buenas referencias en la zona donde vive y clientela fija en la zona. El destino del crédito será para mejoras de motor de mototaxi, compra de carpa y arreglos adicionales para su mototaxi. Para poder así seguir ofreciendo sus servicios y poder captar a nuevos clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente Valentin, 19, is not married and has no dependents. He lives in his parents' house. Vicente Valentin is a native of the area. Life in the community is calm since its activity consists of agriculture, raising livestock, business and transport. Vicente lives in the district and province of Morropón in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Vicente works carrying passengers in his own mototaxi on a route which goes Morropón - Laynas – Carrasquillo and back. He also takes students, a service that he has offered for more than 2 years. He has excellent references and loyal customers in the area where he lives. The aim of the loan will be to improve the motor of his mototaxi. This will mean that he can continue offering his services and will be able to attract new customers, which will allow him in the short term to increase his income and therefore improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to improve the motor in his mototaxi, as well as other repairs, and to buy awning.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the mamalishe (local eatery)stock and sell to more people.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Janet.  She is twenty-eight years old, married and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013.

She does maize and bean farming as her main economic activity. She has benefited much from HiH EA enterprise and financial management training which has enabled her to manage the business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and planting seeds so that she can increase her farm output and consequently increase her income. This will assist her to cater for the family's needs such as food, medical expenses and also provide school fees for her children. 

Janet is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy planting seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo, se mantienen trabajando en las diferentes actividades agrícolas para generar recursos económicos con los que cubre las necesidades familiares y cancela sus deudas, la prosperidad de su negocio es gracias a la buena utilización del préstamo que anteriormente Padecomsm y Kiva le facilitaron.
Invertirá en pollos de engorde, cabritos y concentrado para pollos, con esta compra fortalecerá el negocio, espera tener buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Gustavo takes care of himself working in different agricultural jobs in order to generate financial resources that he uses to cover his family's needs and cancel his debts. The prosperity of his business is thanks to his good utilization of his previous loan that Padescomsm and Kiva made possible.

He will invest in broiler chickens, goat kids, and feed for the chickens. With these purchases, he will fortify his business and he hopes to have good results.

loans.use: to invest in broiler chickens, goat kids, and chicken feed and with these purchases, he will fortify his business.

loans.name: Twin Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Michael, a member of Twin Women Group. He is twenty-four years old and a father of one kid who is school going. He sells shoes to earn a living.

The training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled him to run the enterprise more effectively. His business has expanded and he hopes the Kiva loan will help him add more thereby increasing his income. This will enable him to cater for family expenses.

Michael is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Naomi, thirty-nine years old, married and blessed with five children. Naomi does maize, bean and dairy farming.

After joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013, she received training on business development skills which enabled her to expand the farming business by leasing two acres of land to grow more maize and beans since the demand is high.

Naomi is borrowing money to purchase farming inputs such as fertilizer to help improve on crop yield. This will lead to a good harvest thereby improving her income to help meet her family’s basic needs.

She is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Norah, 30 years old, married and blessed with five children. Norah’s economic activity is maize and beans farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2012 and she has received training on enterprise development and financial planning, which  equipped her with skills that have enabled her to effectively manage her enterprise.
 
She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and planting seeds. She hopes the loan will help her boost her business and increase her income. She will, therefore, be able to support her family and improve their overall living standards. 

Norah is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kisab Women Group

texts.en:
Nancy, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Kisab Women Group. She is 30 years old and has seven children. Nancy does maize and potatoes. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa savings mobilization and financial management training she received, which equipped her with knowledge and skills to manage the enterprise more effectively. She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her potatoes farming business by buying fertilizer that will help improve the crop yield, thus improving the living standard of her family. She intends to use part of the profit to provide food to the family and pay school fees.

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocio del Pilar tiene 41 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija en casa de familiares junto con su padre en centro de Cayaltí. Su menor hija estudia en Senati estudios superiores y a la vez trabaja para apoyar a la canasta familiar. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Rocio del Pilar se dedica a la venta de productos de bodega y a la venta de alimentos. Además, brinda servicios de limpieza a diferentes empresas. El destino del crédito es para inversión en compra de mercadería para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de productos, así atenderá la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar, podrá ampliar su cartera de clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rocio del Pilar is 41 years old, a single mother who lives with her daughter in a family member's home along with her father in the center of Cayalti. Her young daughter studies post-secondary studies in Senati and works to support the household. Rocio del Pilar lives in a community dedicated to business, farming and livestock locaked in Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Rocio del Pilar sells grocery store items and food. In addition she provides cleaning services to different businesses. The loan will be used to be able to increase and diversify her stock of products, in this way she will be able to meet the customer demand and satisfy her customers. In the short term this will enable her to increase her income, increase earnings, resulting in a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to be able to diversify her stock of products.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is pictured here on the day his biodigester was installed. This investment will change the way he works with his animals and cultivates corn and oats, since from now on every waste generated by his animals will be transformed into renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer through the biodigester. 

Pablo will not have to buy wood anymore for his wife to cook, nor LP gas and chemical fertilizers. He will protect the soils and watersheds around his fields by using the nutrient-rich fertilizer, increasing the yield of his crop in a natural way. With the biogas produced from his animals' manure, his wife will be able to cook without inhaling the toxic smoke. By displacing the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers, Pablo will save money while protecting the environment.

He plans to use the savings to invest in greenhouses and plant vegetables, as well as improve infrastructure on his farm. This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is 57 years old. He is a widower and lives with his sons who help him with the house and food expenses.

Miguel has worked in a metal shop for more than 30 years and also rents a small place in a market were he has a food stall that provides additional income for his family.

He is asking for a loan to refurbish the food place.  He says that it has a very good location and that with a small investment he can increase the revenues. He describes himself as credit worthy and says that through hard work he has been able to send his kids to school and help them get a house.

loans.use: to refurbish his business

loans.name: Ramón Arturo

texts.es:
Ramón de 54 años de edad, es motorista y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el bachillerato, luego decidió trabajar para ayudar en los gastos de su casa, esta casado y junto con su esposa tienen 2 hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, los dos se encuentran estudiando, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuido de sus hijos mientras que Ramón se dedica a atender un molino de nixtamasa en su casa desde hace 15 años, también tiene una pequeña panadería la cual atiende desde hace unos años trabajo que lo aprendió por la necesidad de los recursos económicos en que vivian y así logro tener un poco mas de ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor alimentación y una mejor calidad de vida, sus hijos y su esposa también le ayudan en la venta de pan por las tardes a los alrededores de la comunidad. 

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar una vaca lechera para tener leche para su familia, el sueño de Ramón es ayudarle a sus hijos económicamente para que puedan sacar sus estudios y ampliar el negocio de molienda y de panadería para ofrecerle a sus clientes un buen servicio y que se sientas satisfechos.
texts.en:
Ramon is 54 years of age and he is a driver, and he received his high school diploma. Then he began to work in order to help with household expenses.  Ramon is married and he and his wife have two children, ages 13 and 15, both of whom are studying. Ramon lives with his wife and the children.

His wife dedicates herself to household matters and cares for the children while Ramon has operated a mill in his house for the last 15 years, grinding corn for tortilla-making. He also operates a small bakery which he has attended to for some years. Ramon learned this work due to the need of added economic resources which he experienced and, thus, he came to have a little more income and could offer his family better food and an improved quality of life. His children and his wife also help by selling bread in the afternoons throughout their community.

The loan he is soliciting through our institution is for purchasing a milk cow to provide milk for his family. Ramon's dream is to help his children economically so that they can progress in their studies and, also, to expand the milling business and the bakery and offer his customers better service so that they will feel more satisfied.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to provide milk for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, metal sheets, and wood so that she can replace the roof of her home and build a wash basin.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada tiene 59 años, vive en casa familiar con una hija discapacitada a su cargo. Ada cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Ada se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general(arroz, azúcar, café, entre otros), desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para capital de trabajo, pues desea realizar la compra de una cantidad mayor de mercadería, para poder diversificar y aumentar su stock de productos, para poder satisfacer las diferentes necesidades y preferencias de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ada is 59 years old. She lives in her family home with a disabled daughter who she cares for. Ada has good personal and professional references. She is from a united family. She lives in a community that is dedicated to commerce, agriculture and livestock. It is located in the Saña district, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Ada has worked selling groceries (rice, sugar, and coffee, among others) for more than approximately 5 years. This loan is destined to be used for working capital because she desires to complete the purchase of a large quantity of merchandise in order to diversify and increase her stock of products so she can satisfy the different needs and preferences of her customers. This will allow her to increase her profits and her earnings in a short period of time and therefore improve the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to obtain working capital because she desires to complete the purchase of a large quantity of merchandise in order to diversify and increase her stock of products.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene 34 años, ella es madre soltera, tiene un hijo pequeño quien es su mayor inspiración y por quien está luchando para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida.
Actualmente estudia enfermería, está realizando su tutoría de tesis y quiere poder pagar las cuotas de su tesis, es para ello que pide este préstamo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Leticia is a 34-year-old single mother with a young son who is her greatest inspiration. For this reason, she strives to provide him a better quality of life.

Leticia is currently studying Nursing. She is in the process of completing her thesis, so she wants to pay the associated expenses. This is why she is requesting this loan.

Leticia appreciates this opportunity since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay the fees related to her thesis.

loans.name: Rosa Ester

texts.es:
Rosa, cuenta con una mayor demanda de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda, es por ello que nuevamente requiere de un financiamiento para comprar maíz, frijoles, especias, bebidas, arroz, aceite, etc. con lo que su inventario estará debidamente surtido para  cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
En su negocio Rosa ha ofrecido nuevos productos con ayuda de la inversión anterior, la cual le ha dado buenos resultados como mejores ingresos, un aumento en sus ventas y nuevos clientes. Con las ganancias minimiza las necesidades familiares y mantiene una buena calificación en el uso de créditos.
texts.en:
Rosa has had an increase in demand for basic staple items in her store. It is for this reason that she is once again requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, spices, beverages, rice, oil, etc. so that her store is properly stocked and meets the necessities of her customers. 

Rosa has been able to offer new products in her store with the help of her previous loan. This has given her great results such as a better income, an increase in sales, and new customers. With these earnings she meets the needs of her family and maintains a good rating on the use of her loans.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, spices, beverages, rice, oil, etc. so that her store is properly stocked.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married and has four sons, all of them are married and independent. She owns, and has worked in, a stationary and office supplies store for more than 25 years. She has two homes and she rents one of them out to earn additional income.

She is asking for a loan to make some home improvements in the house that she rents. By doing these improvements she will be better able to rent it out.

She says that her business is pretty big and well stocked and her goal is to continue to invest in real estate.

loans.use: to make some improvements to her rental house.

loans.name: Kiletien Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Faith, a member of Kiletien Women Group. She is twenty three years old, married and blessed with four children.

Faith earns a living by doing dairy farming and also farms maize, beans and potatoes. She has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training on enterprise management.

Faith is taking a loan from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as manure to help improve on crop yield. She hopes that this will boost her farming business and thus increase her income.

Faith is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as manure.

loans.name: Faith And Hope Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Jackline, a member of Faith and Hope Women Group. She is twenty six years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in December 2013.

Jackline runs a grocery shop where she sells fruit and vegetables such as kale, cabbages, carrots, mangoes and bananas.

Having gone through HiH EA enterprise training, she is now able to manage her business well. She is taking a Kiva loan to add more stock to meet her customer’s needs and thus maximize her profits. Income from the business will help support her children’s education and family's basic needs.

Jackline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support; she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit and vegetables such as kale, cabbages, mangoes and bananas.

loans.name: Bernardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Bernardo de 44 años de edad, es albañil y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el segundo año de bachillerato, no continuo sus estudios porque decidió aprender a trabajar para ayudarle a su familia en los gastos de la casa, ahora en día es un hombre acompañado y junto con su compañera de vida procrearon 2 hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad, uno se encuentra estudiando el otro aun esta pequeñito aun no estudia, Bernardo vive con su esposa y sus hijos.

Su compañera de vida se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuido de sus hijos, mientras que Bernardo trabaja como albañil desde hace muchos años, trabajo que lo aprendió de unos amigos y por la necesidad de los recursos económicos en que vivían, para llegar a su trabajo Bernardo viaja en bicicleta 2 kilómetros, trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El crédito que está solicitando en la institución, es para comprar una novilla con la cual dentro de un tiempo le dará leche para obtener un poco más de ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor alimentación y mejor calidad de vida, el sueño de Bernardo es poder construir una vivienda más grande para darle a su familia una mejor comodidad y un hogar digno para vivir.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a 44 years old and has worked in construction for many years. He completed two years of high school before he decided to go to work in order to help his family meet its household expenses. He learned to do construction work from a friend in order to earn a living. He is married and lives with his wife and their two children, ages six and one; the older child is in primary school, but the younger one still stays home. 

Bernardo's manages the family's home and cares for their children while Bernardo is working at construction jobs. He works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. at a site two kilometers from his family's home, and commutes by bicycle. 

Bernardo is applying for a loan in order to purchase a cow that will soon provide milk. The cow's milk production will provide a small boost to the family's income as well as a better diet for the family, and a better quality of life. Bernardo hopes to build a larger home for the family to live in greater comfort and dignity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow that will soon provide milk and boost his income.

loans.name: Noralbis

texts.es: Noralbis aprendió a tejer desde niña en su natal municipio de Chimichagua situado en el Cesar, con este talento en sus manos, decidió en el año 2012 iniciar su negocio elaborando mochilas, peyones y bolsos de mujer, los cuales comercializa a sus amigos y familiares que se encuentran ubicados en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla.  Ella trabaja ocho horas diarias muy comprometida para cumplir con sus pedidos y así mismo tener un stock de productos para ofrecer a la clientela, ella les brinda facilidad de pago y una amplia gama de modelos y colores en sus diseños que reflejan la cultura caribe.  Sus compra las realiza de contado por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar al por mayor la materia prima de sus productos; lana, hilo sintético y accesorios.  Con esta inversión Noralbis incrementará su producción y con ello se espera obtener ventas representativas puesto que estamos a la entrada de una temporada de fiestas en la que sus clientes tienen mayor poder adquisitivo y le pueden generar mas compras.  Siendo madre de dos hijos de 3 y 6 años y una hija de  9 años, su meta familiar a largo plazo es remodelar su vivienda para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, así mismo sueña con abrir un local comercial donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en: Noralbis learned how to weave when she was a girl in her hometown of Chimichagua, located in El Cesar. With this talent in her hands, she decided in 2012 to start a business making indigenous-style shoulder bags, peyones (textiles that are placed over a horse saddle) and women's bags, which she sells to her friends and relatives who are located in a neighborhood of the municipality of Barranquilla. She works eight hours every day, is very committed to filling their orders and also to have a stock of products to offer to her customers. She offers them a payment facility and a wide range of models and colors in her designs which reflect the Caribbean culture. She makes her purchases in cash, so she is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase raw material in bulk for her products: wool, synthetic yarn, and accessories. With this investment, Noralbis will increase her production and with this, she hopes to get representative sales since we are entering the holiday season in which her customers have more buying power and which can produce more purchases. Being a mother of two sons, ages 3 and 6, and a daughter, age 9, her family goal in the long term is to renovate her home to offer a better quality of life to her children, and she also dreams of opening a retail location where she can exhibit her products.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for her products: wool, synthetic yarn and accessories.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha es casada tiene 4 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento  Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes y quiere un credito para incrementar su mercaderia como arroz, azucar, conservas y en este nuevo caso bebidas alcoholicas y tabaco Martha es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud  por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Martha is married and has 4 children. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house, Martha has a grocery store and wants a loan to increase her merchandise like rice, sugar and canned goods and this time alcoholic beverages and tobacco. Martha is the only source of income in her household and is in good health. She needs your help.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise like rice, sugar, canned goods and new this time alcoholic beverages and tobacco.

loans.name: Eliana Margarita

texts.es: Eliana es una emprendedora mujer de 23 años de edad, motivada por tener su propio negocio y con el apoyo de su cónyuge, inicio hace un año su almacén de ropa.  Su cónyuge quien labora en un almacén de ropa, donde además de vender al público también venden prendas de vestir al por mayor como camisetas, jeans, suéteres de distintas marcas, fue quien consiguió que le suministraran esta prendas de vestir con las que inicialmente surtieron el negocio, pero hoy en día no es su único proveedor puesto que han incrementando las ventas y clientela, y se hace necesario tener mas variedad. Ella realiza sus ventas desde su local en el barrio donde reside en el municipio de Barranquilla, y también tiene clientes en Sincelejo a quienes vende a crédito.  Como sus compras las realiza de contado en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual invertirá en la compra de suéteres y jeans para hombre, con la finalidad de renovar los modelos e incitar a las ventas mas que todo en la temporada decembrina donde el ambiente de fiesta hace que las personas se interesen en lucir nuevos atuendo.  Sus metas familiares son traer a la vida al bebe que espera y lograr brindarle un hogar y una casa propia.
texts.en: Eliana is an enterprising woman, 23 years old, motivated to have her own business and, with the support of her spouse, she opened her clothing store a year ago. Her spouse, who works in a clothing store, where in addition to selling to the public they also sell clothing in bulk such as shirts, jeans, and sweaters of various brands, was who arranged that they would supply her with the clothing with which they originally stocked the business. But, today it isn't the only provider, since because sales and customers have increased, it's necessary to have more variety. She makes her sales from her retail space in the neighborhood where she lives in the municipality of Barranquilla, and she also has customers in Sincelejo to whom she sells on credit. Since she makes her purchases in cash, currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in the purchase of men's sweaters and jeans. She wants to update the models and stimulate sales more than ever in the December season, where the holiday feelings make people interested in wearing new outfits. Her family goals are to bring the baby she awaits to life and be able to offer it a home and its own house.

loans.use: to invest in men's sweaters and jeans.

loans.name: Jose Rufino

texts.es:
José, con el préstamo anterior ha mejorado la productividad de sus cultivos y el cuido de los animales de corral que posee, con las nuevas ganancias puede cultivar un área más grande, ofrece a su familia una mejor alimentación diaria y mantiene estable su negocio.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos y alimento para los cerdos, continuara trabajando y teniendo ingresos para subsistir.
texts.en:
José, with his previous loan, has improved the productivity of his crops and the care of the small animals he has. With his new earnings, he can cultivate a larger area, offer his family better daily nutrition, and maintain stability in his business.

He is asking for a new loan to purchase agricultural supplies to grow basic grains and pig feed. He will continue working and having income to subsist.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to grow basic grains and pig feed, and he will continue working.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mozos, cultivara granos básicos y realizara los trabajos de siembra sin problemas. 
Con el crédito anterior se ha mantenido trabajando en la agricultura y tuvo materia prima suficiente para la venta de tamales, ha mejorado económicamente y puede cumplir con sus compromisos. Su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel needs another loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay assistants. He will be growing basic grains and will carry out the planting work without any problems.
