With the previous loan, he has sustained himself working in agriculture, and he had enough raw materials for selling tamales. He has improved economically and is able to fulfill his commitments. His family has a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay assistants. He will be growing basic grains.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana decided to invest in her biodigester in order to produce her own biogas and organic fertilizer by taking advantage of a simple resource: her cows' and sheep's manure. She is transforming waste into an opportunity to save costs and protect the environment while improving the quality of life of her family. Indeed, they will be able to displace the expensive and fossil fuel-based LP gas, stop buying wood for cooking on a weekly basis as well as chemical fertilizers. The corn Juana's family seeds will improve with the organic and nutrient-rich fertilizer produced by the bacteria in the biodigester. The smoke produced by the wood in the kitchen will also be eliminated, and no family member will inhale the toxic substance anymore. 

Juana is ambitious and would like to expand the farm by buying more cows with the savings she will make. She also plans to improve her house to make it a more comfortable place to live.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester.  The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a small dairy farmer.  He dedicates himself to selling his cows' and sheep's milk.  In addition to his activities on the farm, he works as a mason to supplement his income.  

He decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because he was interested in the opportunity to optimize his operating costs by displacing the expensive and non-renewable LP gas as well as chemical fertilizers.  Instead of piling his animals' waste up outside the farm, thereby attracting flies and contaminating watersheds, he will input it in the biodigester, letting the natural methanisation process and bacteria transform it into precious biogas and organic fertilizer.  His wife will cook with renewable energy instead of wood, and by spreading the fertilizer on his small plot of land where he cultivates corn, their yield will increase in a natural way.  He will save money while reducing his carbon footprint and make life easier for his family. 

Gregorio would like to focus on his farm and expand his milk production capacity. With the savings he makes through the biodigester, he plans to acquire a milking machine.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester/  The remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Diana Lourdes

texts.es:
Diana Lourdes, es una mujer que necesita un prestamos para poder terminar su carrera de Licenciatura en Psicología, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Diana, tengo 50 años de edad y nací en Las Matas De Farfan municipio de la provincia San Juan De La Maguana. Actualmente vivo en Santo Domingo a la parte Este del país con mis dos hijos y mis dos nietos.
Los ingresos que entran a mi hogar son muy pocos, pues mis hijos y yo actualmente no estamos trabajando y lo poco que entra es suministrado por el padre de mis hijos el cual tiene ingresos que a penas dan para los gastos del hogar.
Estoy cursando el sexto cuatrimestre de la carrera de Psicología Clínica en la Universidad Abierta Para Adultos (UAPA) , carrera de la cual me siento enamorada pues me permite ayudar a personas en su ámbito laboral.
Seria muy triste para mi que a esta altura de mi carrera tenga que parar la universidad por falta de ingresos que me ayuden a continuarla, y por eso con la buena de Dios me dirijo a ustedes para que me ayuden a pagar lo que me queda de mi carrera y asi poder darle una mejor vida a mi familia e impulsarla hacia delante.
Sin ustedes mis metas de ser profesional y encaminar a mi familia no sera posible.
texts.en:
Diana Lourdes is a woman who needs a loan to be able to finish her degree in psychology. This is her history: My name is Diana, I am 50 years old and I was born in Las Matas de Farfan municipality in the province of San Juan de la Maguana. Currently, I live in Santo Domingo in the eastern part of the country with my two children and my two grandchildren.

The income that enters my household is very little, since my children and I are not currently working, and the little that enters is support from the father of my children, who has income that barely covers the household costs.

I am in my sixth trimester in my clinical psychology degree in the Universidad Abierta Para Adultos (UAPA), a major which I love since it allows me to help people in their work environment.

It would be sad for me at this point in my degree to have to stop my university education for a lack of income that would help me continue it, and for this reason with God's grace, I direct myself to you so you can help me to pay what remains of my degree program, and so to be able to give my family a better life and give it a boost forward.

Without you, my goals to be a professional and guide my family would not be possible.

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Kihingo Fadc Commercial Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Kinuthia, 64 years old, married, and blessed with three children who go to school. He is a member of Kihingo FADC commercial Farmers Self Help Group. Kinuthia does maize, beans and potato farming.  He also does carpentry to earn a living. The training he received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise management enables him to manage his businesses effectively. 

He is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as manure to help improve on crop yield and timber for his carpentry workshop. He hopes for improved incomes that will enable him to cater for family needs such as food. Kinuthia is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy timber and manure.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa is 45 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Adelfa works very hard to provide for them. Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. Adelfa requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, beverages, etc. to sell in her store. In the future, Adelfa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, beverages, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is a married woman with three children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Asteria is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Asteria has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Asteria requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Asteria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Asteria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 35 years old. He is married with 2 children between 3 and 8 years old.  One of them go to school. 

He has a shop and has been working in this business for 1 year. 

With the loan requested, he would like to buy more sugar and biscuits to resell.  

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and welfare.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 42 years old. She is married with 3 children, between 1 and 5 years old.  One of them go to school. 

She sells food stuffs and has been in a business for 4 years. 

After getting her loan, she would like to buy more bananas, potatoes and maize flour for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her her house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, potatoes and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Agnes, 45 years old, married, and a mother of six. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She owns a grocery shop as her main business. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to manage the business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock of kale, cabbages and carrots etc., so that she can increase her income from improved sales. This will assist her to cater for the family needs such as food and paying school fees for her children.  Agnes is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy stock of kale, cabbages and onions, etc.

loans.name: Michatha (B) Organic Farming And Environmental Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Peter, a member of Michatha (B) Organic Farming and Environment SHG Group.  He is fifty nine years old, married and a father of seven.  He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.  He does horticulture and dairy farming to earn a living.  The training he got from HIH EA enabled him to commercialize his farming business thus earning more profits as compared to the previous period. 

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more quality fertilizer and dairy feed to improve the yields of his crops and cows and hence earn more income.  He plans to use the anticipated income to pay for the school fees of his children and support family needs. 

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo used to spend an significant portion of his income on expensive fossil fuel-based LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizers.  He needed all of these to cook, heat water and for his fields.  Since he purchased his 10 cubic meter biodigester, he is able to produce his own energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer, using his cows' manure.  Not only does he reduce his costs by becoming more self-sufficient, but he also contaminates less, since the waste is put into the system instead of polluting watersheds and attracting swarms of flies.  

In addition to selling his cow's milk, Pablo seeds and harvests oats.  The nutrient-rich fertilizer will improve the quality of the soil and increase his crop's yield.  Pablo aims to expand his milk production capacity, and therefore plans to use the savings he makes through the biodigester to buy more cows.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester.  The remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 51-year-old married father of six, and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp.  Due to the low financial situation of Palestinians, especially those who live in camps, he started working as a mechanic twenty nine years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Imad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car which will facilitate his business and transportation. 

He hopes to expand his business more to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 60 years old and separated with three children. Eliza works very hard to provide for them. Eliza runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for one year. Eliza requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, cup noodles, beverages, eggs, etc. to sell in her store. In the future, Eliza would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, cup noodles, beverages, eggs, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a 59-year-old, married woman with eight children. She has one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Aurora has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Aurora has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy equipment for the maintenance of her business.

Aurora has been in this business for three years. In the future, Aurora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 72 years old and widowed with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc. 

Catalina has been in this business for 36 years and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Roseli

texts.en:
Roseli is 42 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and additional chicks to raise.

Roseli has been raising chickens for two years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional chicks to raise.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel works hard to support her family. Rechel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Rechel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Rechel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to help her achieve more work.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
To be young and starting a family is a challenge for many people in the Nandihills area of Kenya.  

Hello world, meet an inspirational smallholder farmer by the name of Samuel.  Born in the Nandi region of Kenya, Samwel has grown up to be a very hardworking and enterprising farmer.  His upbringing was not easy but at least he managed to finish his primary education. He is currently running a 4-acre mixed farm in Kilibwoni village with the unwavering contribution of his dear wife.  He keeps poultry, sheep and dairy cattle that give him eggs, meat and milk to sell. 

Samwel is seeking a loan to purchase land. Since 2000, when he ventured into farming, he has been relying on his parents farm to run the agribusiness, and still will continue to do so.  However, the business has grown and all the space is totally utilized.  With the loan investment, he will acquire additional land to facilitate the growth of his business. 

His financial discipline led him to be appointed the treasurer of Kamaran Group (made up of farmers who save together and use the savings to access and guarantee loans of each member).  Returns from the investment will go toward loan repayment, setting up the new land and food for his family.  He will also use the money to meet all the basic needs of his family.

Support this hardworking man with a loan!

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Sartasiñani Kullacanacas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI KULLACANACAS” iniciará el trigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de lentes, venta de CD’s, venta de chompas, venta de peluches, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de lentes; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años conjuntamente su esposo, ya que compraron una sola mercadería que comercializaban en diferentes zonas. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de montara de lentes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “SARTASIÑANI KULLACANACAS” communal bank will begin its thirty fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Santiago II Center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, of which Celia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them is are: selling glasses, selling CD's, selling sweaters, selling stuffed animals, and selling coca. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Celia. She indicates that four years ago she joined Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling glasses. She says that she started this business several years ago with her husband. They bough merchandise that they would sell in different areas. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying glass frames wholesale. She will acquire them from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. Later she will sell them at her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings and the health care that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy glass frames wholesale.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en: Ethel is 37 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For the past year, Ethel has been buying and selling charcoal as a business in the Philippines. She requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, Ethel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 39 years old and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell.

Jasmin has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear business for 15 years and also earns an income from a general store. Jasmin aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 39 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children who currently in school.

Elsa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsa has been doing pig fattening for 15 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 30 years old, is married and has one child who is in school.

Janice is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines.  Janice has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.   Janice has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her chicken

Janice would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her chickens

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Marites has been in this business for 2 years now.

She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old with five children, two of whom are still in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a beauty products business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 6 years.  She has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her business.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell for her business

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is 44 years old, marriedand has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelda has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Nelda has been in this business for 16 years. 

Nelda requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Nelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is 49 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Solita runs an ambulant business vending household goods in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.  In the future, Solita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 69 years old and is married with eight children. 

Natividad is in the agricultural/pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Natividad requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Natividad has been in pig fattening for 16 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Natividad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Grover

texts.es:
Grover es un hombre joven de 18 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de la milenaria hoja sagrada de Coca.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, inteligente, activo, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ un área caracterizada por recibir la hoja de Coca procedente de los Yungas. La hoja de coca siempre tuvo una gran importancia como símbolo religioso dentro de la espiritualidad andina, es por eso que la inquisición, durante su extirpación de idolatrías, prohibió la hoja de coca. 
Grover es de tez morena, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla donde habita, para el comercio habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que se dedican a la agricultura y sus hermanos que trabajan, viven en una casa construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad.  Su negocio es el comercio de la hoja de Coca; esta posee proteínas, vitaminas y minerales que la hacen no solo una excelente opción nutritiva, sino además una vía para curar diversas enfermedades. La hoja de coca es un producto que se consume mediante el mascado, a través de bebidas o infusiones confeccionadas con un extracto de esta. Los valores nutricionales de la hoja de coca son: Contiene alcaloides que producen una estimulación del organismo, Posee una gran cantidad de proteínas y vitaminas, lo cual le da mucha energía al cuerpo, Tiene un alto contenido en minerales, tales como: calcio, potasio, magnesio, fósforo, hierro y zinc, Es rica en flavonoides y antioxidantes, que previenen al organismo de la aparición de enfermedades, Esta planta no es adictiva y provee al organismo de diversos beneficios. Se recomienda su uso para: Calmar el mareo en grandes alturas, Prevenir las enfermedades cardiovasculares, Proteger contra las caries, Combatir el cáncer de colon, Evitar la obesidad, Eliminar la depresión, Tratar enfermedades de las vías respiratorias, como el asma y la bronquitis, Regular la presión arterial, Curar los problemas estomacales y Controlar la diabetes, entre otras. “comencé esta actividad por las buenas características de la hoja y porque su consumo es muy popular y siempre es requerido, por eso mi negocio prospera…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de hoja de Coca por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de la época. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Grover solicita un préstamo para la compra de hoja de Coca por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Grover is an 18-year old single, young man without children, and his business is the sale of ancient, sacred coca leaves. 

He is entrepreneurial, independent, intelligent, active, tenacious, responsible and hardworking. His business is located in the “Villa Fátima” zone, an area known for the sale of coca leaf from the Yungas region. The coca leaf has always had a significant importance as a religious symbol within Andean spiritual beliefs. It is because of this that the (Spanish) Inquisition, during its removal of idolatry, prohibited coca leaf.   

Grover is dark-skinned and short statured. His maternal language is Aymará, which is spoken where he lives, but he speaks Spanish for business. He lives with his parents who make a living through farming – and with his brothers that work. They all live in a house made of adobe that has running water and electricity. 

His business is the sale of the coca leaf. It contains proteins, vitamins and minerals that not only make it an excellent, nutritious option but also a way to cure various diseases. The coca leaf is a product that is consumed by chewing through beverages or teas prepared with coca extract.  

The nutritional values of the coca leaf are: containing alkaloids that produce stimulation in the body; possessing a large quantity of protein and vitamins, which give the body energy; having a high content of minerals such as calcium, potassium, magnesium, phosphorous, iron and zinc. It is rich in flavonoids and antioxidants that prevent the body from the onset of disease. The plant is not addictive and provides various health benefits. 

Its recommended use is for: relieving altitude sickness, preventing cardiovascular diseases, protecting against cavities, combating colon cancer, preventing obesity, eliminating depression, treating respiratory diseases such as asthma and bronchitis, regulating blood pressure, curing stomach problems and controlling diabetes, among other things. 

“I began this work because of the coca leaf’s good characteristics and because its consumption is very popular and always in demand, so my business is thriving,” Grover says. His dream is to improve his family’s quality of life, and he wants to make an investment in his business by buying wholesale coca leaves to supply his customers at this time. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in five years that has been done for this work.

It is for these reasons that Grover is asking for a loan in order to purchase wholesale coca leaves to supply his seasonal customers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale coca leaves to supply his seasonal customers.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is 74 years old and happily married. She lives in Tudela,Misamis Occidental. For the past years, Loreta has been a farmer. She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to maintain a good crop harvest. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business with a hauling truck for delivery.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain a good harvest.

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato is 61 years old, married and has 3 adult-age children.  He lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  

He has a coconut land from which he generates income to support the needs of his family.  However, he had pawned some of the land and that's the reason why he has asked for a loan in the amount of Php 20,000.00 from PMPC. 

This financial assistance given to Donato will be a great help for him and to his family.

loans.use: To buy back his pawned coconut land

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is a 44-year-old separated woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Lailanie has a business selling beauty products in the Philippines and has been in this business for 17 years.  Lailanie has requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of beauty products to sell.

In the future, Lailanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of beauty products to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 45 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Janeth is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Janeth requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Janeth has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jiza

texts.en:
Jiza is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jiza is 38 years old and four of her children are in school.

Jiza has a processed food business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jiza has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rechie Mae

texts.en:
Rechie Mae is single and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rechie Mae has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Lorna is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a beauty products business in the Philippines.  It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. 

Lorna requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy additional items for her business to restart her business activities.  Lorna has been in this business for 2 years and would like to rebuild it with your help. 

In the future, Lorna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married and has a clothing business in the Philippines.  She works hard to support her family.  Maricel has been in this business for 5 years now.

She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of clothes to sell.

In the future, Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 49 years old and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Teofila has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Teofila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is 25 years old and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Darlyn requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of feed for her pigs.  Darlyn has been raising pig for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 50 years old and is married with three children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.  Leah has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Leah is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Erleen

texts.en:
As a parent of six children, Erleen works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile phone cards and raising livestocks. 

Erleen is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like canned goods, spices, meat, etc for her food vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like canned goods, spices, meat, etc

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.  Cherry has been in this business for 2 years. She also earns additional income from farming vegetables, raising pigs and from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers for her selling ready-to-wear business.  Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Nena works hard to support her family, and has been in this business for 23 years now.

Nena has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Nena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Rosita works hard to support her family and has been in this business for 7 years now.

Rosita has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sheila is 19 years old and is the third of eight children in her family. Her mother Sherly, who is a member of the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), supports the family through a food vending business in the Philippines. Sheila is studying a Bachelor of Science in elementary education and is currently in her third year of a four-year program. Sherly is borrowing PHP7,000 to pay for her daughter's tuition fees for the second semester of the 2014-2015 school year. When she graduates, Sheila plans to have a stable job so that she can help her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Dioneth

texts.en:
Dioneth is a 44-year-old married woman and has six children, three of whom are currently in school.  

Dioneth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has been in this business for 20 years.  

Dioneth requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Dioneth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned that she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Josefina has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Josefina wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Julay

texts.en:
Julay is 68 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Julay has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Julay would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old and marreid with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, candies, juice, etc. 

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 43 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years. 

 Arlyn has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

In the future Arlyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items to sell like caned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc

loans.name: Marnely

texts.en:
Marnely is 44 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school.

Marnely is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines.  She has been farming sugarcane for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  

Marnely has requested a new PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Marnely would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 45 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP10,000 loan through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional inventory of household goods to sell. Gina has previously borrowed and repaid a loan from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. Gina aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of household goods to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 39-year-old, married woman with four children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jane has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy equipment needed for her fish vending business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for thirteen years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment needed for her fish vending business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is a 36-year-old, married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Five of her children are currently in school. Roselyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP23,000 loan through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers. Roselyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita has mastered her hog raising business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she was truly grateful to be able to avail credit to fully support her business. Just like how she takes care her hog raising business, she would like to take care of her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she will have access to loans for any future financing needs. The loan of PHP7,000 will help her to build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 21 years old, married and has one child.  

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jessa requested a 7,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Jessa has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lydia is 47 years old.

Lydia has a business selling accessories in the Philippines. Lydia requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es: Nora de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce de manera ambulante por la diferentes colonias, y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pan dulce por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Nora is 43 years old, and she lives in her own house with her husband. She sells sweet bread door-to-door in different areas, and she has many clients. She is requesting a loan to buy more sweet bread wholesale to continue with her sales and thus to be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more sweet bread wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Lino

texts.es: Jose de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la elaboración de lavaderos de concreto desde hace 30 años y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, hierro y arena para la elaboración de los lavaderos y asi continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 56 years old, and he lives in his own house with his wife and son. He has been dedicated to making concrete sinks for 30 years, and he has established clients. 

He is requesting a loan to buy cement, iron, and sand to make the sinks and thus to continue with his work, since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.en: Perfecto is a 59-year-old fisherman who engages in the catching and selling of fish to the nearby community. He is a married man with five children. Two of his children are still attending school. He lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. He has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years. Perfecto is asking for a loan of PHP30,000 to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, fish feed, and fishing weights. This will help Perfecto to improve his fishing technique and hopefully increase his earnings by catching a higher volume of catch and selling more fish. In this way, he can continue to support his children's education and eventually create an impact on his livelihood that is on its way to recovery.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, fish feed, and fishing weights

loans.name: Benefe

texts.en:
Benefe is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. 

Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is happily married with 4 adult-age children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

She has been in her hog fattening business for many years, where she generates income to sustain the needs of her family, and where she had finished her children in studying. 

However, because she wants to have good growth of her hogs, she borrowed an amount of 14,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy bags of feed and vitamins. 

Nora is very grateful for the help aided by the cooperative to continue her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of feed and vitamins for the growing hogs

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 42 years old.

Marites has a business selling peanut butter in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional peanut butter to sell.

Marites has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter to sell

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Marivel works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marivel is borrowing PHP7,000 through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional items for her products in her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business. Marivel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her products

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a 23,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is juggling her business and the renovation of her home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing, which will be supported by her loan of PHP40,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Elena has given priority to her role as a microfinance member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful for this organization as all of her financing needs on her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Lourdis Arlin

texts.en:
Lourdis Arlin is 45 years old and separated with four children. With one child in school, Lourdis Arlin works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdis Arlin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, beverages, and other items.

Lourdis Arlin has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Lourdis Arlin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, tiene 8 hijos de 25, 24, 23, 17, 16, 9, 8 y 7 años, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, contante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Batallas’ un área rural que está confinado con el oeste por el lago Titicaca y se encuentra a una altitud promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar,   la región tiene un pronunciado clima diurno en donde las variaciones de temperatura durante el día son más pronunciados a medida que avanza el año. La temperatura media anual en la región es de 8,8 ° Centígrados.
Rosalia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura, y sus hijos; los 3 mayores son independientes, los demás estudian en la escuela. Toda la familia vive en una casa construida de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno, ella realiza la cría y engorde de ganado a través del uso de la totora como pastoral y principal fuente de alimento, también alquila un campo dónde se ocupa del cuidado del pasto para alimento de su ganado, estos campos se secan en época de invierno y es cuando se utiliza la totora. Su trabajo lo realiza todos los días de la semana sin descanso. “llevamos a nuestro ganado a los pastizales vecinos que nos alquilan por temporada, luego estos se secan y debemos usar totora como principal fuente de alimento…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea realizar la compra de semilla para la siembra de alfalfa y otros alimentos para el ganado. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosalia solicita un préstamo para la siembra de alimento para ganado y con los beneficios comprar ganado para la crianza.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a 45 years old mother, is married, and has 8 children, who are 25, 24, 23, 17, 16, 9, 8, and 7 years old. Her business is selling cattle.

She is a good mother, independent, happy, responsible, and hard working. She does her work in the area of Batallas, a rural area that is on the western side of Lake Titicaca and that is at an altitude of 3900 meters above sea level. The area has pronounced daytime climate for which variations in the temperature during the day are more pronounced as the year goes on. The median annual temperature in the region is 8.8 degrees Centigrade.

Rosalia has brown skin and long black hair that she wears braided. She wears traditional dress (hat, blanket, and full skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken in her region; for business in the city, Spanish is spoken. She has lived her life with her husband, who is dedicated to agriculture, and with her kids. Her 3 older children are independent; the others are studying in school. Her whole family lives in a house made of adobe that has electricity and well water.  

Her business is cattle. She raises and fattens the cattle. She uses a large reed to herd the cattle and as the cows’ primary source of food. She also rents a farm where she takes responsibility of taking care of the grass that feeds her cows. Those farm dry out in the winter, and that is when she uses the large reed. 

She does her work every day of the week without rest. She says, “We take our cattle to the neighboring pastures that we rent by the season. Then they dry out and we have to use reeds as the main source of fodd. 

Her dream is to improve the quality of life for her family, and she wants to buy seeds to grow alfalfa and other food for the cattle. This is the first sequence of loans in 10 years that she has taken out for this work.

It is for these reasons that Rosalia requests a loan to grow food for her cattle, and with the earnings, to buy cattle to raise.

loans.use: to grow food for her cattle and, with the earnings, to buy more cattle to raise.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en: In 2012, Nonita learned about the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and the financial assistance it gives. She tried her luck on building a business focusing on farming activities. She feels that she owes her fortune to PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Nonita has requested another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help to boost her farming income significantly. Nonita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Martha is 60 years old and has one child who is still in school. Martha has a buy-and-sell food supplements business in the Philippines. Martha has requested a PHP5,000 loan through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of food supplements to sell. Martha has been in this business for two years. In the future, Martha would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of food supplements to sell

loans.name: Mirlita

texts.en: Mirlita is 27 years old, married and the mother of four children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc. Mirlita has borrowed and repaid three prior loans from NWTF, has been running her general store for three years and earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear items. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, and beverages.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mylene is 38 years old and all of her children are in school.

Mylene has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Mylene requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruit to sell.

Mylene has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en: Ma. Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 from NWTF to buy additional ingredients, including meat, spices, and vegetables. Ma. Lilibeth has been in this business for three years and earns additional income by raising livestock. She has sustained her business through her own hard work with the help of loans from NWTF. Her dream is to repair and renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, icluding meat, spices, vegetables.

loans.name: Gengen

texts.en:
Gengen is 24 years old, married and has one kid in school.

Gengen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gengen requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gengen has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Gengen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school.

Annaliza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Annaliza requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Annaliza has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 25 лет, есть годовалая дочь, замужем. Образование у Чынара высшее, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей одеждой на дому, также развозит по организациям. Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, на данный момент у нее есть товар в обороте на сумму  100,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и купить контейнер.
texts.en:
Chynara is 25 years old, has a one year old daughter, and is married. Chynara has higher education. As an additional income for her family, she works with selling clothing from her home. She also delivers to organizations. Thanks to Chynara's persistent work, she currently has goods worth 100,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase clothing for reselling. Chynara plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and to purchase a container.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for reselling, in order to increase assortment and attract new clients

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto de 64 años de edad, es agricultor, padre de dos hijos. Él ha sido un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, a pesar de que no pudo estudiar mas que sexto grado, pero aprendio a cultivar granos basicos, los dos hijos de él emigraron al extranjero. Alberto vive con su esposa y nietos.

El crédito lo necesita para cambiar el techo de su vivenda aprovechando que se a terminado el invierno y asi cuando vuelva la epoca lluviosa no tiene que andar de un lado a otro tapando goteras. Comprara especificamente, madera, lamina y tejas.

Sus sueños a futuro es construir mas la vivienda para cuando regresen sus hijos tener un espacio mas amplio y que sus cosechas sean mas productivas.
texts.en:
Alberto is 64 years old. He is a farmer and the father of two children. He has been a very responsible and hard-working man, in spite of the fact that he wasn't able to go to school beyond sixth grade. But he learned to raise basic grains. His two sons emigrated abroad. Alberto lives with his wife and grandchildren.

He needs the loan to replace the roof of his house, taking advantage of the fact that winter is over, and thus when the rainy season returns, he won't have to go from one side to the other covering leaks. Specifically, he will buy wood, metal sheeting, and tiles.

His dreams for the future are to add on to his house so that when his sons return, there will be more space, and also to have more productive harvests.

loans.use: to buy wood, metal sheeting, and tiles to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Aprolyn

texts.en: Aprolyn is from the city of Dipolog. She is 54 years old and is married. Aprolyn owns and operates a fancy jewelry business, operating a specialized retail store selling fancy jewelry in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately PHP5,000 a month. In 2009, she joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional inventory of fancy jewelry for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of fancy jewelry for sale

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en: Renilda is 43 years old, single, runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Renilda has been in her current line of work for two years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, canned goods and other groceries. Her goal for the future is to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.
